oFK5kNnvr--whZ_5NKAH9Q.text: Been dying to try this place and since we visited LV this past weekend we finally got a chance. My cousin lives in LV so that's how we found out about babystacks. Took us about 25 minutes to get seated during normal brunch time on a Friday morning. I ordered the spam scramble with garlic rice and got a side of their glorious red velvet pancakes. Both were aaaaaaamazing!!!! The red velvet pancakes were so moist and with the combo of the whip cream, chocolate chips, and cream cheese frosting, OMG!!!!! to die!! My fiance ordered the adobo fried rice omelette and that was phenomenal to!! Good service and great food!

R2T87LYPisEw4ZQ9R0s-DA.text: Delicious breakfast that reminds me of Hawaii because of the loco moco, Portuguese sausage and kahlua pork. It even has adobo rice! Oh, and did I mention pancakes?! The red velvet pancakes are a family favorite. It's not a Hash House or fancy brunch spot, but it hits the spot and not your wallet.

EdE_0BVTZnDJPIBlPdUGJQ.text: Usually I eat here however today I left without being seated. I normally don't have any issues with sitting at the counter but today the counter was FULL of guys and they were all together all dressed the same etc. There was a couple and a baby waiting for a table and the old lady at the counter kept trying to get me to sit at the counter and I told her I wasn't down for that. It seemed like I annoyed her and she's like well there's going to be a 20 minute wait so I sat down. It was busy but not that full, so after I sat a couple came in and signed in for a table and not even a minute later they were seated ? I was like WTF?! The old lady sat them right away, I should have been seated as I was there first. The AC was cranked up really high too, I understand that the wait staff gets warm but it's way too cold in there. I love the food here but it always does a number on my stomach. I ran over to Rachel's Kitchen I wasn't in the mood to deal with temperature and the hostess

rO5pfO1NmfnozUZSG6igWA.text: By far my favorite breakfast place! I always get hash browns and red velvet pancakes they're delicious! The service is usually outstanding and even though it's a busy place I never have to wait very long. They always keep me coming back for more!

y9UoPykE2Xv9qq_iR9Cbpg.text: Very long wait ...... Really the only negative ( maybe that is actually a positive:) ).  Decor not inviting BUT I brought 6  girls here and they all said their food was delicious!!!! Everyone wants to return.

sD3FvjyH826ACiEWoi8AfA.text: My favorite Go to place after Church. However its always packed, but its worth the wait. Great red velvet pancakes, and enjoy the vibe of the place. Glad I took a chance with this place. When I leave Las Vegas I'm going to really miss Babystacks.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet cakes and ranchero eggs are on point

AODblTPoY_RIyxavgmISbA.text: Every trip to Vegas includes a trip to Babystacks Cafe. I just can't get enough of their adobo fried rice and red velvet pancakes. I was hesitant to try this location because of the reviews but our group was forced to due to much longer waits at the other locations. I'll admit that the wait for a table was much shorter BUT the wait for our food was much longer than expected. I won't complain though because the food was just as good and worth every minute we waited. On this trip, our table decided on our usual dishes: adobo fried rice and red velvet pancakes. We also decided to try oreo cookie pancakes and a special loco moco dish of the day. Everything we ordered was a hit! You definitely can't go wrong by making a pit stop at Babystacks if you're ever in the Vegas area.

N5BRl5r385TjWJ1OqmFLSw.text: My boyfriend and I came here for the first time this morning. Did not catch our servers name but on our receipt says Vangie.. hopefully correct because this young lady was very good. The food is fairly priced in my opinion. I had the orange creamsicle short stack with a side of spam. Ended up eating the rest of my boyfriends Loco moko because he was so full from his delicious red velvet pancakes. We enjoyed our first experience here and will return.

D3aoN3ACjopY5BPHpK58sw.text: This is the second time we have gone here and it was even better than the first time!! I had the country Benedict last time and it was amazing. This time I got the corned beef hash with upgraded garlic rice and upgraded to lemon ricotta pancakes. Omg. Seriously perfect and it came out before we even had a chance to finish a game of hangman! Our server was so nice and pleasant too. Favorite breakfast spot in Centennial Hills!!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loves it so much he wore some of it! Nutella crepes! Mmmmmm

8gbP7_quz4I5PWv43VaIow.text: Great place for breakfast. It's almost always crowded, but they are able to get you in very quickly. So many choices of pancakes, and you can get them as a side with any meal. Their skillet breakfasts are amazing, and the loco moco is excellent. Service is always very good.

LP7FEFydXLs2NhPv8oJ8cA.text: OMG, I am not a pancake eating type person. Nothing about it sounds good. When my family decided to eat at a place called babystacks I was not too thrilled. When we got there we were told it was going to be a 35 minute wait. The crazy thing is it's a Thursday morning. I wanted to use that as an excuse to leave. My family still wanted to wait. To my surprise five minutes later we were being seated.  I decided to try the corned beef hash with seasoned potatoes and red velvet pancakes(I was really living on the edge). Again OMG, AMAZING I was pleasantly surprised on how awesome everything was. Seasoned to perfection. I don't like breakfast nor do I like pancakes. I know where I will be next time anyone suggest breakfast. Everything was so good and we all loved our food. Noone in my family could complain about anything and that is unusual for us. I could see why on a Thursday it would be such a wait.

mTuOn5iEOWADbHmT7Vw8WA.text: One of my favorite places for breakfast. Spam and eggs scramble is my personal favorite however they have a variety of pancakes and Hawaiian dishes. Don't be afraid to upgrade to garlic rice!

kblvI1OD8si_Hqeun7Tetg.text: This has become a tradition for us. I love the option that you can have the breakfast as an omelet or skillet.  I feel like the portions could be bigger but with the baby stak's I can't complain really. The coffee is really good too, most restaurants like this their coffee isn't strong at all.

9Tx7_7WC6ZHgtj6STK-2hQ.text: I love the warm and the atmosphere here. It is always busy during lunch hour but it's worth the wait. My favorite is always the loco moco. I always upgrade to garlic rice and with upgrade pancakes!

xLkS7n1_P0ydhAS4_4M-xw.text: Oh my goodness. Best breakfast. Ever. I absolutely love Babystacks and I look forward to whenever I come here! Obviously, the red velvet pancakes are the absolute bomb. But I would also recommend the cookie butter french toast and any of the omelettes/skillets. Their food is always fresh and I have never had a bad experience with anything I ordered. The one thing I will say however, is that it is a very small place and often extremely packed, especially on Sundays. The wait can be up to an hour! So try to avoid going here on Sundays and if you have a large party, call ahead of time. I love this place!

KEZL9pxh2KJUryCq_EyqAw.text: Great breakfast place. Their red velvet pancakes are a must try.  So yummy!  This place is good, hence it's busy.  If you're in a rush, this may not be the place for you.  Your loss.  For those of us who are patient,  I raise a coffee cup to your red velvetness.

jfBzXrLpKSemNlGgXTQ-JQ.text: Okay food waitress suggested something I really didn't want to try but it turned out to be okay after all. It was the French toast with the cereal all over it. Felt like I gained 10 pounds.

z2J1aqSAyyYid9iaXTfYdA.text: Great family breakfast place and the red velvet pancakes are the best. Love the staff and they are very friendly.

8rRJ0eKCWHDKAm7h9KZF3A.text: Best breakfast joint in town , fresh food and the service is fast. Highly recommended.

QVVQ_2P08lLPu2TX1oJpaQ.text: Lord I don't even know where to start. Honestly I was really excited about this place with the large line formed outside it gives you the feeling of a great meal ahead. But you sit down in a very uncomfortable chair at a fairly small table. The service was decent but not great honestly it was just non memorable at the least. Then we get to the food I don't care what they say these are processed products and there is nothing special about that I can go to a mcdonalds and get that kind of breakfast. The omelet was decent but again besides the eggs seemed like processed food inside the chili was just plain gross honestly. This restaurant is really close to my house but I am just not ever going to bother waiting to eat here again not worth the wait in the least.

tFzSBOlxB0QequK81VVHJA.text: My only issue with this place is that it is quite hot in the restaurant and the service was a tad bit slow. But the food is worth it

4ivxaNY9XkCdv1adlHELlA.text: Me and a couple coworkers came here after a busy graveyard shift. Our server Miley was amazing.  They had a special pancakes called cookies and cream that were delicious. The banana cream pie pancakes just as delicious. They carrot cake pancakes were like eating a fluffy piece of carrot cake. There was 7 of us and only a short stack of pancakes make it out of that place. I will be back here

-vPXdbFhWeMUVpOU3KW11Q.text: Never eat there again, first of all we were sat down and they have nothing on the windows so my boyfriend was literally blinded by the sun shining in because of the time of day. He made sure to ask the server if the corn beef and hash was homemade and he assured him it was. His food look like it came from a bag or was frozen. He told the server it wasn't good when he came to ask how everything was he asked my boyfriend what he'd like instead he asked for scrambled eggs and bacon. When the eggs came out they were not even cooked all the way so he said something and he told the sever he was done and didn't want anything at all, he brought him another set anyways. My food was ok except for the hash browns they were frozen in the middle, I didn't even bother to say anything because there was no reason at this point. Quality of the food is nothing special at all could have made 10x better food at home. We were very excited to try this place but our experience was very disappointing and will not being going back to this location or any other one. The employees were nice though.

17XZnSgbiSDHS9WZh-lUwg.text: I went here to eat on two occasions, with the last being this morning.  Today, I waited half an hour to be seated as it was quite busy, which was a great sign.  Once seated, we waited about 25 minutes for our waiter to come to our table to take our orders.  Once he took our orders, it took an hour for our food to come.  Now, the previous time we came, it took a while for our food to come, but not that long.  Once thing I noticed was that the servers (three of them) were all busy doing something, but it wasn't serving folks.  It almost seemed as if the kitchen was at a stand-still, and food would just creep out one order every 10 to 15 minutes.  Once the food did come, the portions seemed small for the price we paid.  Now, this is comparing the food to the other well known "local" breakfast chain we frequent.  The food wasn't terrible in quality, it just took FOREVER to come out, and was overpriced.  I can't recommend them at all.

DTcpgIFphMOqY1C3JL0Q1Q.text: This place is awesome just make sure you beat the crowd. The loco loco is fantastic, as well as the huevos rancheros. But most of all the babystack red velvet pancake dont leave without trying it would be a sin.

8pSfrVOfke7p8NkhstbPGA.text: Centennial Hills location. Sparse menu, lackluster food.  Very disappointed after great hype. Might as well go to Centennial IHOP.  Once was enough. Too bad.

O3FJZpfA46QthUTWPwB7WA.text: Visiting North Las Vegas to see the fam and they suggested to have the Adobo Fried Rice.  Got there just in time without any wait.  The staff is super friendly and very helpful.  I shared an order of the Adobo Fried Rice and side order of the Red Velvet Pancake with my cousin's girlfriend.  We didn't wait long for our order to arrive.  Everything was onolicious, it was much better than expected and I am glad we shared because I wouldn't have the room to eat the deelish Red Velvet Pancake. It was so fluffy and cooked thoroughly.

-YEAaExvAvBHW_br0HLO-w.text: If you are looking for pancakes, this is the place to go! They have many different varieties, and offer Linguica and Spam as side meats, along with all the normal accroutments. We have been very pleased with the food, and service here. Our only complaint is, the last two times we have been there, my Wifes credit card info was stolen, and used at nearby stores, resulting in her having to go through the whole process of getting her card cancelled, long investigations of where the funds went, and having to deal with not having that money available to us for several weeks. (the first time the charges were in excess of 800 dollars, the second time it was over two hundred!) Great food, but you run a chance of having deal with stolen info.

gmAGBD4mx1g-MhtmsOFOSw.text: Love love love this place. Any kind of breakfast food I crave can be found here. Warning: the wait times are insane! So make sure to get there early. I've gone twice now, first time I got the breakfast burrito and the second time I wanted to get a little crazy and get the loco moco. This place is def a go to

a6eN-laBNetdkIc5qJq-XQ.text: Finally tried baby stack. They are crazy busy on the weekend but it seems like they are not that bad on weekdays. Ordered adobo fried rice in an omelette and it was ok, the adobo was really salty and I feel it's missing something for it to be amazing. I've ordered the pancake on the side and I got the red velvet pancake and that was good, really fluffy and I like the whipped cream on top and the cream cheese syrup.  My fiance ordered the loco moco with the potato on the side and he said it's better than the real thing in Hawaii  and the potatoes were cooked perfect. Idk how that's possible, but he became a fan of loco moco now lol. The waitress gave us good service too and the price is decent. I'd come back to try more of their food.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco moco
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobo fried rice

wOCej15iaHwdQ9Fj2QUsCg.text: This is my second time coming here but my first time to check in I believe. Today I got the adobo omelette and it was sooo good! I would definitely go back to this place not just for their pancakes but for that as well.   I really like that they do give you the option if you would like to upgrade your pancakes to something that aren't even ordinary breakfast pancakes ! They are very interesting pancakes and very good! I would definitely go back especially for their red velvet pancakes !

FyD62xHAaYD6mkZIozr5Jg.text: Really enjoy having Babystacks around. Been multiple time and figured I need to review. I love the banana foster pancakes.  Always mean to try something new but always get those rounds of golden fluffy deliciousness. Seriously go try them!

xhML6pnox0bk5IubOeLhLw.text: My favorite breakfast place! I always get the linked sausages with scrambled eggs and seasoned potatoes! Their service, although almost always incredibly busy, is fast and friendly. It's always crowded because everything on the menu is fresh and delicious, and great portion sized meals. Whatever you can't finish you can always bring home and warm up, which still tastes great in my opinion for someone who doesn't like leftovers. Definitely the best babystacks in Vegas too out of all of them. :)

ZyD2xBIYzRXvqSK6ONUYAQ.text: Trying this place out since it seems to be a hot spot for Vegas locals.  My party included 10 adults and 3 little ones.  The place was large so the wait wasnt too long which was good. They will not seat you until your entire party is there.  This is different then most places as they will seat your party if more than 50% is on site.  Pro- very clean, nice staff and the pancakes are delicious.  Price is 2 dollar signs and the do charge extra for additions which is normal in Vegas.  Con- not all food came out around the same time. My niece didnt get her pancakes until 20 min after the laat person was served. Not sure qhy it took so long, the waiter didnt say, he only asked "is ot ok?". My sister said yes but i would have said NO.  Outside of that- my omlet was extra brown and dry. The tomatillo sauce tasted like it came from a jar.   My family memebers who ordered pancakes enjoyed the food.  I am not a pancake person so i will not be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ranchero omlet with avacodo slices (avacodo additonal $2.95).
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 eggs, turkey bacon and seasoned potatoes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids mini plate.  A lot of food

dKLPhQvymM28wjY8gd0fxA.text: Excellent food (love the yummy variety) and the wait staff was very friendly and efficient. Surprisingly,  not a long wait for a holiday. We decided to try BabyStacks on the 4th of July, based on everyone else's reviews. We will be back for sure, and def bringing our guests who come visit for a lunch or breakfast.

N4FQV_UtZzXoEk0fsBvTwg.text: I'm here a lot. Julie and Cora that work in the front are amazing. They stay busy so be prepared for a wait, but they turn tables fast and bring your food just as fast. I work in the parking lot so I go a lot ... I have not had a bad dish yet. I mean where can you get German chocolate pancakes like this?!!!

OJsL9iNKJfKFukBK4kwgjw.text: My daughter recommended this place, but hadn't been to it. I love breakfast, but this was a major disappointment. My omelet was burned (how do you burn eggs?), the toast showed little sign of being toasted, I couldn't get a coffee refill until I flagged down a different waitress (our waitress finally asked if I wanted more when she delivered the bill, after we finished the meal). One of the worst breakfasts I've had.

JW26l_AVTu3_5Ou2GCx20A.text: Always a good place for breakfast.  I've tried 3 of their flavored pancakes at different times (all good) and decided on tiramisu pancakes today, but not a fan, not much flavor to it. Looking forward to go down the list and try the rest of flavored pancakes.

f3GdSYp05m7QR_Diq8dQ2A.text: I know about this restaurant because a friend worked at another location. But I was very disappointed coming to this one. I placed an order to go. And first of all the two guys at front were going to charge me twice. I asked about the size of an orange juice and I was told "a cup full" wtf!! I wasn't able to get a size in ounces. I've worked in customer service and had I been in this situation I would have asked coworkers or my boss. But this guy just seemed very lost, couldn't even have eye contact or smile. And they also charged me EIGHT DOLLARS for the juice.

pj9QSiXlnqpoY-umA-shCw.text: Overcooked omelet (how do you overcook eggs?), undercoated toast, not enough servers to handle demand, no coffee refills unless you flag down a waiter/waitress. Not living up to its reputation.

qcp1MrDryEhXJQbcM6kz9A.text: My absolute favorite breakfast spot! The Huntington Skillet with a short stack of German Chocolate Pancakes hits the spot every time! I crave food here and eat it about once a week!

BWH4vyrKqgHOf4i2Eh1cgA.text: Place is obviously popular being its always busy... That's a good sign. Food is just like home cooking. Courteous and professional.

jxKjS9cWiRELKB6FtKLwaA.text: Last 2 times we went here wasn't very good. This time our omletes were way over cooked and browned without any flavor. The waitress forgot our coffee. The only reason they get 2 stars is the pancakes, they are good.

N2q_G6T3yoEihrghFDZL-A.text: Delicious food- super fresh and staff is warm and welcoming. New favorite breakfast place in Las Vegas

DEZYVQuQf7McHjxHKselEw.text: Great breakfast place. They're open for lunch also, but I've  only had breakfast there.  Good service and really good breakfast food! Colorado skillet is my favorite!!  Pancakes are yummy also!

sU-3DI0ambY3ldTwg3HKew.text: Busy place with a bit of a wait! Food was great! I had the bananas foster pancakes, eggs and potatoes!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K4ufaBJXFKR69hdmZJgyvg.text: This place is packed a good sign.  30 mins later were seated.  Not a second later our waiter is taking care of us we order our food it comes out looking excellent I got bacon pancakes they were delish!! Overall great service I will come back on my next refeed much Mahalos!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon pancakes

jZDsDhG2ZjTA0q5d5GNKrQ.text: Best Hawaiian breakfast joint in north Las Vegas! I always get up grades to garlic fried rice and banana stacks! The service is good and wait lines are not that bad. Great Hardy breakfast

dj4JafZhC4n-II-W8rWumg.text: Could have been better! I thought the place was Closed because of the DIRTY glass front of the restaurant. Food is okay. Service is alright. A couple of Flies did some Fly bies when I was eating. I stared at a Dirty duster behind the counter Gross! You guys have potentials just Clean the Place! Not very Appetizing specially early in the morning when most of us would like to have very Good start on the Day!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Put it Somewhere else Please!
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty Store Front

FmgKvNGngOKXVLSsRARrNA.text: This place is so good!!! Caution on the weekends as the wait can be 45 minutes minimum but it is worth it. Food comes out fast and is always delicious!!! Definitely worth a try if nothing else.

L52a8BBvEq0lF8X1_KfonA.text: There's a lot of hype about this place but I found it crowded, noisy and the decor was dull. I ordered a standard breakfast of eggs, bacon, potatoes and of course pancakes. Unfortunately, they were completely average. There's nothing special about this place and it's certainly not worth waiting more than 10 minutes to be seated.   You can get this kind of food any where and probably for less money.

bt_peyTaVon1LgQA-w7sBA.text: Great little breakfast place!  I ordered the lemon pancake in a breakfast combo, replacing the buttermilk for a small fee. Loved it! This lemon pancake is light, flavorful, not too sweet, not too intense. I would loved to have eaten a stack of these gems but too much for me! My friend had the german chocolate pancake and honestly, we agreed that we'd come back here just to order this as a dessert to take home.  How can a pancake taste like homemade German chocolate cake?? Wish we had this restaurant in my area.  It would be a fave!

hSfV4xFZxniqSDUAT-1V0Q.text: Best regular pancakes in the world!!!  Some how they have depth.   the batter is like a sourdough or artisan loaf of bread.  Pancakes are usually shallow and unrememberable , but i was commenting this to my girlfriend as we were eating these.  I have been told to try the other flavors of pancakes. yum

2qV1PWvssj8Ic3pgx4XXQQ.text: The service is great, however the food is just ok. The food reminded me of old food, like it was made and sitting to be served to the people. I do not think I will return. The food is not made with passion, and they are just trying to serve you and sit the next person.  if you do go get the strawberry pancakes because they were the best thing we had.

rRaDmvPP2Pc0RSnyDo4Bug.text: This review is solely on costumer service. I went to Babystacks a month or so ago with my husband, father in law, and daughter. We walked in and they were not busy. There were about 3 tables with people eating. When we walked in I was asked how many and told the girl in the front 4 people. She said it would be about a 5 minute wait. I immediately didn't understand because they were not busy at all. There were a couple of dirty tables that had looked like they had been sitting there for a long time. We sat there for 25 minutes or so while the staff stood in front of us and were talking and joking with each other instead of cleaning up the dirty tables or seating us.   After waiting 25 minutes we simply walked out. As we were getting in our car a employee came out and yelled "Hey do you guys still want a table?!" I was shocked at the employees behavior and lack of costumer service. I didn't even eat the food but I will NOT be back. This place seriously needs to get their employees under control and teach them how to act professionally.

li3uMf5751xphFSI0g96-w.text: My family loves this place but its not my favorite.  The menu option could be expanded to improve my review.  The food is good but limited choices.

bf8jYMv2761IrTJBufyrxQ.text: I go here for brunch almost every weekend! I try something different every time and have yet to be disappointed. Highly recommend the breakfast burrito and of course any of the specialty pancakes. There is usually a 30-45 minute wait on Saturdays and Sundays but service is very fast and friendly!

uxCDd_XSnET_WOU8bOPWFQ.text: Hey, it's a Hawaiian Denny's!  I've been here more than enough to know that this place, this specific location, is the worst. Every time I come here, I have to wait 20-25 minutes. And every time I come here, the hostess responds rudely to me when I return to ask if a table has opened up.  Last time, convo went something like this:  Rude hostess: "I called your name already."  Me: "I heard you say 20 minutes and it's been 20 minutes."  Rude hostess: "I said ABOUT!"  Woman, I'm not deaf, and what crawled up your ass? I always arrive before or on time. That's the point of setting a timer. Duh. Besides, there's no reason to respond to customers like that. Damn.   I've tried to order take-out from here to avoid the long wait, but from what I've been told this location doesn't do that on the weekends....or so they say. I showed up on a Sunday for brunch and saw a few customers walking out with take-out. WTF?  I feel like the food isn't up to par like it used to be. I was hoping Lola Cora's Corned Beef Hash would be like a taste of home cookin', but it was dry and unbearable to eat. The Adobo Fried Rice...meh, unimpressed. The Country Fried Steak is pretty good, and the Red Velvet Pancakes aren't bad.   What doesn't suck about this place? The waitstaff is great, and I've never had an issue. Rock on, waitstaff.

RKM5O7S-gX1vFfjNlErAZg.text: Me and my husbands favorite breakfast restaurant since we moved here! The staff are overwhelmingly nice and food gets out pretty fast! We always take food home because it's very filling for us! He loves the French toast and I love the many different varieties of pancakes!! Delicious!

5KoenvszYEhugSt-ZoL9Kg.text: I really enjoy their food but the overall service could be better. On three separate occasions our order has been wrong, usually having to do with the potatoes (we order hashbrowns but will get seasoned potatoes, not a huge deal to me). Also, when I order "over medium eggs" I expect the whites to be cooked and not runny which they are always runny here so I just order scrambled. Other than that I love their selection of food!

3EEST9wTWJsJ37paaal6-A.text: They have the best banna pancakes by far that I've tasted .  We don't usually come to this location since its on the complete opposite side from us, but since we were close we thought we'd stop by for lunch.  I've never had a problem with baby stacks, it was always considered one of the top choices for lunch.  This location felt a lot like being in a restaurant back home (Hawaii) with all the reggae music playing.    Our server, who I totally forgot her name was very patient although it was so busy. Being pregnant and all I wanted to order everything on the menu.  Slthough the I'm not the best food tester since I always order the same thing; the loco moco Hawaiian chili style! It's amazing   My boyfriend tried the breakfast burrito & he says it taste like any other breakfast burrito nothing special so I wouldn't recommend it.   I'd recommend this place if your looking for a decent, not pricey place to catch a good sit down lunch!

SjFpGDWl0kROlbcgqhFcsg.text: Very good for better than your local IHOP or dennys by far. Tons of menu items and big portions . Kids menu was a little small could of offers just pancakes and bacon but nothing to gripe about . And my biscuits were somewhat stale . But if that's all there is to complain about they are doing awesome and price is for sure. I will be back time and time again !!

fhgbcqQu8gWuBC2A3KEKUQ.text: Love this place! My breakfast was delicious once again :-) I had the chicken fried steak which is never a disappointment! Fast service and great staff! Plus, the blueberry pancakes were a total bonus too ;-)

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy choices!

ABoKGNCzGuVGCyRZuwvO3g.text: I was pleasantly surprised it isn't your standard pancake house. There are many unexpected Hawaiian and Filipino dishes as well! The garlic rice is to die for. I had the loco moco and my husband ate the kahlua grilled cheese. Both were fantastic. Will be back

s5-jxX8dyDg6WwzbAtqfPA.text: Amazing! Love love love!  I recommend the skillets over the omelette because I think you get more and it just fits together better. Every pancake I've had here has been delicious (the nominal charge to upgrade pancakes is 1.50), especially the seasonal flavors like choco mint and pumpkin but you can't go wrong with the best seller red velvet. My favorite dish is the Mexican skillet- it's my go to as well as all my siblings. Nitty gritty: this place gets busy! Even on weekdays this place is busy by 930-1000 and groups should be prepared to wait. On weekends I would say to get there before 815-830. W8LV_tzHCFj3rh2rMlkOZA.text: I had to visit a relative in Centennial (North of Summerlin), while I was in the Ninth Island (Vegas).  He suggested we eat at Babystacks that serves some Hawaiian Style grinds, and I'm glad he did.  Its located on Durango near Elkhorn, just off the 95.  We ordered Lolo Rick's adobo fried rice ($9.95 | chicken adobo fried rice wrapped in an omelette), with your choice of side.  I chose mac salad, while my friends chose country potatoes.  BS also offers loco moco, portuguese sausage, corned beef hash, as well as crepes and other traditional bfast items.  Da adobo fried rice was winnahzzz!  The chicken adobo was moist and nicely seasoned.  BTW, adobo has Spanish roots combining salty & sour flavors.  The Filipino version uses shoyu & vinegar to accomplish the foregoing.  It went well w/ the omelette, and we were stuffed afterwards:  5 Stars.  On the other hand, the mac salad was suprisingly bad.  It was comparable to store bought mac salad:  2 Stars.  Regarding the ambiance, this is a big place.  There are several tables in addition to a counter.  The space is flexible so you can combine tables for large parties:  4 Stars.  Likewise, the service was really good.  Our waiter was super friendly, and the remainder of the team gave us a lot of Aloha:  4 Stars.  Mahalos to my cuz for the rec on Babystacks.  The entire experience was very positive.  If you don't mind a little drive from the Strip, hit this local place.  You won't be sorry.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lolo Rick&#39;s adobo fried rice wrapped in omelette &amp; mac salad ($9.95) winnahzzz

K4s4NSmHWQ4Hmw45ObNCxA.text: I am a frequent customer at Babystacks and have been for over six years. I started going to the location near Buffalo and Flamingo because it was near my home. We moved across town and I started frequenting the location near Stephanie and Warm Springs. Now I've moved again and am located between two locations, the one on Buffalo and Smoke Ranch and the one I'm reviewing now that's located at Durango near Deer Springs.   I prefer the location at Buffalo and Smoke Ranch, but with the severely limited seating options, there is often a wait, even on weekdays. This is my fourth visit to the Durango and Deer Springs location. This location has a large seating area, so there is almost never a wait, which is convenient.   Needless to say, I know what my favorite Babystacks meal, the Honey [French] Toast is supposed to look and taste like. Before giving a poor review, I wanted to give the location a few tries to see if my experience was a one-time thing. Sadly it has not been.   On my first visit by myself about two weeks ago I ordered my usual meal, the Honey Toast without powered sugar and coffee. The Honey Toast came out burned, very black on the back and along the edges. I went ahead a tried a bite to be fair, but it tasted like charcoal. In all my visits to Babystacks locations I had never gotten my Honey Toast in that condition. I showed my waitress and she brought me a new order of it, only slightly less burned, but the center of the Honey Toast was salvageable. I went ahead and ate it in disappointment. I didn't have the time to send it back again as I had somewhere to be.   On my second visit on the weekend a few days later with my boyfriend my Honey Toast was okay, but the waitress brought out his food a full five minutes before mine.   On my third visit a few days later the Honey Toast looked a little overdone, but eatable. However, when I put my fork into the whipped cream I came out with a kinky black hair. I showed the waiter and he had my food remade.   Today I decided to give them one last try. My Honey Toast came out burned yet again. I pointed it out to the waitress, but told her not to bother reordering it. I'd eat the middle and call it good. I asked her to please let the cooks know because this keeps happening. My coffee was also served at room temperature, but at this point I barely noticed.   I'm one of those customers that hates, absolutely hates having to send food back. It's embarrassing and I don't want to ever appear to be a b---h, and I don't want to ever risk the ire of the people making and handling my food. After three out of four bad experiences here, I'm done. I will not come to this location again. It's extremely disappointing to come to this conclusion because I've always seen Babystacks as a restaurant with high standards. This location fails miserably.

3a6gbnzBa6ddB5iag_SXJQ.text: Babystacks is usually our go-to for pancakes. They probably have the biggest variety in town.  This was my first time at this location and like the others, it's quite busy. I NEVER eat at the restaurant because of how busy it is. Instead, we pick up and eat in the comfort of our own home :)  The Mr. loves the S'mores pancakes and I typically try different ones. I don't think you can go wrong with any of their pancakes. All that I've tried have been delicious, it's a matter of what you like and in the mood for. I think Babystacks has a pancake for everyone.  This time I had the Hazelnut and they were, of course, delicious. The best part is their home made whipped cream. It's delightfully creamy, sweet, and fluffy. I typically don't eat pancakes with whipped cream, but this one I can't say no to. I also tried a new breakfast item, since trying chicken fried steak recently for the first time (if you read my reviews, you already know), I've decided to broaden my breakfast horizons. I tried Corned Beef Hash and it tasted good, flavorful and crispy. Not really my thing though. I usually get Kalua Pig Benny here, it's really good! Hash browns were not my fave either, a little under-cooked for me. But the seasoned fries are awesome so I will stick to those. All in all, a great breakfast option, especially if you're a fan of pancakes.

jCSBXMgv29PAuz2hvGyP0g.text: I finally had a chance to check this place out with my husband. We visited on a Monday and there was a short wait to be seated, maybe 10 minutes. WR1kP0_ctZApjXAGGdjscA.text: If you're going to Vegas and coming in from north 95 or maybe want to get out of Vegas and eat somewhere normal, non-tourist filled, come here!    Easy off and back on from 95, it's located in a small shopping center but there's nothing strip mall about it... friendly staff, clean and neat layout, plenty of customers for a Monday morning, and a veritable plethora of pancake choices for the carbs-be-damned crowd.  Their main menu goes from the basic eggs breakfast to a variety of Filipino and Hawaiian inspired dishes.  Spam for breakfast... sure.  Chicken Adobo omelette... of course.  I went simple:  nicely marinated Kalbi ribs and eggs, offered tomatoes on the side instead of potatoes or rice. since I was saving my carbs for the peanut butter pancakes.  Delish...!   Hubby had plain eggs with chunky potatoes which he said seemed kinda Or-Ida type, but which his bananas Foster pancakes more than made up for.  Momma had ham and eggs with your basic buttermilk pancakes and hash browns.  Given there was nothing left on her plate, I'd have to say she enjoyed her meal...  Enjoyed it so much, I know we'll time our next trip to make a stop here for sure...  **they must get very busy at times:  there was a sign on the door, first come first served, no reservations and they won't seat your party until everyone is present so be forewarned **

kgdzzQFXy9GgHI0wQLmyBg.text: Great spot to hit for breakfast or brunch. Skillets or pancakes are awesome..service is always amazing! Deffo a regular spot for me

ubOOf-dTNTs-M-crzIEbuA.text: Breakfast is probably my favorite meal and Babystacks is definitely my favorite breakfast place in Las Vegas.  I've eaten many times at the original and second locations on Buffalo, and quite a few times at the third location that opened in Centennial Hills not too long ago.  Although I haven't tried the newest location in Henderson, I have no doubt the food and service meets the same high standard as the other locations.  As the name implies, the featured breakfast item on the menu is pancakes, and if you like pancakes, you have a great assortment to choose from (including Red Velvet, Cinnebun, White Chocolate Chip Macadamia, Carrot Cake, and many more).  At last count there are 18 specialty pancakes in addition to traditional, and you can have them as your main course, or you can get pancakes as a side to complement a different breakfast item.  Watch out:  they're delicious and the stacks are big!  Go with a half stack unless you're truly hungry.  But Babystacks does more than pancakes!  Their other menu items are just as delicious and also range from traditional fare including a variety of eggs cooked to order, omelets and Eggs Benedict, French Toast, crepes, but they also have a few dishes unique to the shop.  Be sure to check out the Kalua Grilled Cheese, the Portuguese (or Spam) sliders, or Rick's Adobo Fried Rice for starts.  Things to remember:  The North Buffalo location is tiny; the South Buffalo location is much larger and more comfortable, as is the one in Centennial Hills.  Also, they won't seat incomplete parties, so have everyone together when you arrive.  On weekends, every location I've visited will quickly fill up and a line will form on weekends.  Go early to be there when they open, or bring a book to enjoy during the wait.  Keep in mind though:  the wait is worth it!  Now go get your breakfast on!

eNf9Kb-4LgMPXnPVM-A-Jw.text: Had a great breakfast here. I had the Kalua pork eggs Benedict. It was delicious. The pancakes were very good too. The girls had eggs and cakes and they eat them up.  Get there early, there is usually a wait after 8:00a on the weekend.

NEp1YAFhlEj6H4ZrMA50RQ.text: I have been a few times now. This is a very popular location. Weekend/weekday early/midmorning there is always a wait. I dont think a wait is a bad thing in the resteraunt biz, good things are worth waiting for but me for this isnt that good. Its not bad either. Just an average breakfast spot with some times good and some times bad service.   For the resteraunt name referancing pancakes I was not impressed with the stacks. They were good but after ordering the white chocolate macadamia nut and receiving plain pancakes with a handfull of white chocolate chips on top with a very small amount of a fine crumble that couldbe madacamia nuts. Why bother?   I also ordered the HM1 omelette which I picked because it had cilantro however when I received it there was no cilantro. It was good just not what I was expecting.   One of the best dishes I have had there is the Kahlua pork benedict. I really like this dish. I dont know if the Kahlua pork is made in house but it's good. ZH7re145DdIU9crhrLEeIw.text: First time here with hubby and it's one of the best breakfast we had. We ordered the adobo fried rice and the skillet chicken (it had spinach, potato, cheese, herbs) both dish was amazing! Recommended and the staff is so nice..

bFZXV1O2gbVxTaR5pLls_A.text: The food was SO good!! My family and I decided to try this place while in Vegas and we loved it! Best breakfast at a restaurant we've had in awhile.

RCzhz4QJVCzFiQo2dK1Agg.text: Service: Excellent and courteous Menu: great diversity with Asian influence Speed: my order was out to me super quick Price:  very good deal Repeat: Yes and would recommend friends  I tried the spam sliders and were way better than my expectations!

H6rs_z_D8VLFYIVLJErlbA.text: Yummy breakfast! The food was delicious, just get there at the right time so you don't have to wait long!

A4ldfveTnwbVZNRDIgrV8A.text: Um, yes.  In a town full of overrated casual breakfast joints, this one is the real deal.

K-K9Ex9gteNAj7Hz6zHcQw.text: Extremely disappointed in the kitchen staff here. Does anyone know the difference between over easy and over medium eggs? When the egg whites are runny, that's more like sunny side up, not even over easy. It was taken off the bill and they asked to correct it, but it already grossed me out trying to eat it.

y-V0kFX1S2JUJzU31yVwrQ.text: Worst experience ever. We had a large party, and they quoted us a 20-25 min wait. Parties kept getting sat and we waited and waited. Turns out she was waiting on a table to finish and they arrived just before us. We ended waiting for 1 hr before we were sat. I don't mind waiting, it does irritate me when she quoted me longer to keep us.

YOm-PI3WGT0SY0wt3PMiFA.text: The loco moco , red velvet pancakes, and German chocolate pancakes are amazing. The service is great  and Monica is the best server.

OWRicL2kiA-iW5KUbnoLLg.text: Came here with family, and were told we would be waiting approximately 30-45 minutes. We waited under 20 minutes, which was fantastic. It was pretty busy when we arrived and they are only open until 3pm I believe. Our waitress was delightful with a smile and cheerful attitude. I ordered Portuguese sausage, over easy eggs, steamed rice with extra furakaki, and banana foster pancakes. Amazing, amazing, amazing. I don't find many places with Portuguese sausage and I liked it here. The BANANA FOSTER PANCAKES was the star of my plate indefinitely. Delicious! I do recommend this place to everyone looking for a variety of pancakes. It also has some Hawaiian and Filipino dishes, so it feels just like home for me. Great service, wonderful food, and conveniently right off Durango and the 215.

O6lobRfJ7DXr7zX0XdUIZQ.text: Food is good and decently priced. Service however is a hit or miss. 50% of the time it sucks but the other 50% it's good. Usually always have a line so be prepared.

i4xsiIBQO3YM0XzV9vGGeg.text: We love going here for breakfast! The only thing I would say is do not go here on Valentine's Day we learned our lesson this year it's was super busy and our food came out wrong ): this is the only time we have ever had a problem with them I would highly recommend for a fast cheap breakfast (:

bGnDy_QAjZ0224pKXrdfhg.text: We stopped here before heading back to California.  The food could not compensate for the behavior we received for not knowing about the split-check policy.  The manager, whose name we unfortunately did not get, but was wearing glasses, and a necklace with a circular ring attachment, was micro aggressive throughout all of our conversations, from when we placed our orders up until we attempted to make the check payment.   We understand how frustrating the events could have been, but this experience could have been avoided with making the split check process accessible to both customers and workers.   Anyways, the food was good, but wasn't worth the whole experience.   We appreciate how the cashier was more helpful in trying to help our table out. The manager, did otherwise and shamed us for not knowing of the policy.  It was unfortunate that we had to ask for corporate's number to be offered the possibility to pay for the bill. I've never been denied an attempt to make a payment...   We hope they get better machines that can process the split check process... please, administration, provide the resources... this will make business more group friendly.

jgJUE-Avg1PTBj-1yIR0aw.text: My husband and I enjoy going to Babystacks but we already know before we get there that it's going to be a long wait to get a table. This last time we went in was a Monday at 11 so we thought it wouldn't be a terrible wait, but after we got a table it still took us over 15 minutes to even get a server to ask for our drink orders. With it being 115 outside in Vegas, you'd think they would be considerate enough to at least bring waters. Then an hour went by before we got our food. It's always slow for seating and service, but this last experience topped the cake. Of course we'll be back in because the food is great and the prices are too. I'd just recommend that anyone who goes here doesn't go too hungry and to bring your own water for while you wait.

2s6lUVCbIZNHefg0_O_fNg.text: This is one our new favorite breakfast places to go to. Went there for the first time on Sunday, wait time was about 10 min, but worth it. Our waitress was friendly and the food was just perfect. We ordered the red velvet pancakes on the side and they were pretty good. I'm not a big sweets person but I would definitely order those again.   I really like their menu selection, it's not just pancakes. Definitely going back.

R_HGnuvUhUbCKLZupUHTZw.text: Good experience, my favorite place to get breakfast when I have out of town guests. My go to is the german chocolate stacks. Always a little wait on the weekends so pan for a 30-45 min wait

0smfi6BDfkkMskqRtehNvg.text: Babystacks Cafe is an amazing breakfast spot for several reasons.  First reason being...It's always slammed.  Unless your there when they unlock the doors, you're gonna wait.  That wait might vary..but you're gonna.....wait.  The second reason being that the food is awesome!  On the most recent visit, we were informed the wait would be 15-20 minutes.  I could feel the spike in my blood pressure, but this is Babystacks, and the food breaks the mouth, so we sat.  No less than five minutes later, we were seated and I was happy.  On this day there would be a coffee and a water.  The meal would consists of a Spam Scramble.  Spam is comfort food to me.  Eggs and Spam, rice with the delicious seasoning.  Oh, and add the garlic rice upgrade?  YES PLEASE!  To boot...you can upgrade to your favorite baby stack.  I dig me some of them banana foster flapjacks.  It's a cheat day.....BOOM!  Set your cell phone off to the side and enjoy your company cause a little Aloha time is gonna push kick da chest.  Chill.  It's all worth it.  When the food arrived and after asking several people for the Sriracha sauce it was everything I knew it would be.  Spam is yummy but attack the panny kakes while they are still warm!

JU8aVgmXD4dA4NbRYQqnoA.text: I love babystacks! My favorite place to go for breakfast and idc about the wait. The food is beyond delicious and the service is friendly. I always get the chocolate chip pancakes and either eggs with seasoned potatoes or the Portuguese/spam sliders with the seasoned eggs. The seasoned eggs and pancakes are the main reason I go. Breakfast here hits the spot.

IyCsgO2EbWATwSBIVYWh_g.text: Fantastic service, very polite & attentive by everyone (special thanks to Joshua). Great menu options, large portions and very tasty....and all very affordable.

sR_RXg3PIGcW15Oq3jv-vw.text: I love going to babystacks every time I visit my mom. It's conveniently located by her house and the food is always good. Sometimes it gets a little crowd so wait times may be long but trust me when I say, it's worth it! Wish we had a location here in Hampton Roads, VA!

a61g_EYe80TuqfEz7jiDMQ.text: Best breakfast! Great service and consistent yummy food snd delicious coffee. It always feels so cozy and comforting eating at Babystacks !!

FIPnSj3TGCiStD4uY3nUAw.text: Great restaurant and good food.   Bring a jacket because it can be freezing in there.   We asked our server along with another table to turn it down but they never did.   Pancake choices are numerous.

qZu4C6p5Hj0mwsihMdoMdQ.text: Awesome !  Pancakes are bomb. The kalua grilled cheese is fire. Highly recommend the red velvet and Cinnabon ones. I added strawberries to add some tartness on the Cinnabon for an additional fee. I recommend this location because I went to another and the pancakes were on the dry side. Only downside is that there's usually a wait and after ordering it takes a while to get your food.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side order of Cinnabon pancakes with added strawberries for an additional charge.

q7L5jKiOcuOxVFKB8SrJug.text: So I've been to a few different locations and this 1 seems to be the closest to me when I'm in town so I've frequented it more. I haven't tried various items, I usually stick to my fave German chocolate pancakes, Portuguese sausage, and seasoned potatoes. Everything is always solid. Haven't experienced any issues. Today they forgot my Portuguese sausage, but everything else was cool. Service is also always pleasant. Reasonable prices.

xB_JT-NBmaA3YUnIp9KJUA.text: I absolutely love Babystacks! So unique and the staff are so friendly! This is mine and my daughter's go to when we have our breakfast dates!

QmrhVHxmYN4qXSZuerYNXQ.text: Great and fast customer service! This place gets busy. We were seated and served very quickly and the waiters/waitresses were awesome! Our food  came out quick and was delicious! We got the spam and eggs with garlic rice ($1 extra, but is worth it), and the red velvet pancakes, which was delicious! They have a huge food selection...it was hard to decide what to order, but I'm sure everything is delicious!   Would definitely recommend this place! Will be back.

lVbYV3pAy9TIDDclHoxF_Q.text: All around great experience's here. The staff are always friendly the food is really good, try the Hash and garlic rice. The portion could be a little bigger but that's the sign of a good dish leaving me wanting more

R6VbfFpfmYTNAghVgpTvTg.text: We were seated quickly. The service was good and the coffee was hot. I liken this to a Shari's or Denny's- I think the rating is a bit inflated. We had the following: Red velvet pancakes, Orange Pancakes, Banana Pancakes, Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and chicken fried steak. My husband was not overly pleased with the chicken fried steak and more syrup was in order on all accounts. Those are my lack of five factors.

E5nqmBW0xAzmAztgzL8pqQ.text: I heard this location was opening up a few months ago and was pretty excited since it's right around the corner from us. We've been to one of the other locations in the past and liked it a lot. Naturally since it's a new spot they were really busy...but they have a lot to work on.  It looks like they run specials on the whiteboard up front which is cool. I decided on the cookie butter french toast and my wife had the biscuits and gravy. The french toast was decent but there was a lot of egg leftover on the sides of the bread and they basically just threw a huge scoop of cookie butter on top. It wasn't anything special and I can't say I'd order it again. My wife's biscuits and gravy was really good at the other location but at this one it didn't even come close. The biscuits were dry and the gravy was super plain, almost flavorless.   The whole experience just wasn't what we expected since we liked the other one so much. While the service was ok, not everyone was friendly and they seemed to be understaffed. We walked in and had to wait almost 45 minutes but at least 10 tables were open. They must have turned away 5 or more parties because of the long wait times. We'll be back in a few months to see what's happening but if you're a fan, I'd stay away from this location for a bit.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rocky Road Pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange Creamsicle Pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned Beef Hash w/ Garlic Rice

gA0YO-UgdUppITrHD1iE9Q.text: My gf and I love Babystacks she actually introduced me to it. I was born and raised in Hawaii so going somewhere with local 808 influences are always a plus.   We basically go to this location because it is the closest to our house. We avoid sitting at the bar  because they tend to forget about you there. Both times we sat there we literally waited 10 minutes just go get drink orders.   We have had a nice Asian girl (who is pregnant) twice in a row now and she is awesome! I have never had to ask for refils. I wanted kalbi and eggs and she checked to make sure it was ready instead of just telling me no they didn't have it because it is not listed on the menu.   I usually get the Portuguese sausage and eggs with garlic rice or the chilli moco with Mac salad.

hGeYursSiwJYaJdUdrXXfA.text: Awesome food!  We ordered the adobo fried rice omelet, mac nut pancake, red velvet pancake, chili loco moco and sweet cream crepe.  All tasted really good.  The chili tasted like zippy's chili and the adobo fried rice was filled with chunks of pork adobo. Once we walked in, it smelled like my kitchen when I cook breakfast!   Service was very attentive and we were checked on frequently despite the crowd.   Thrilled we live near this location!

maajCyhuURwei8K___7I1g.text: A must visit when in vegas! Cute place with great service and excellent food! The carrot cake and cinnabun pancakes are awesome!

QfIDQOrIfTD_fUK3g_mLLA.text: I have found that this is the best Babystacks location. Food is consistently great. I always order the spam scramble with garlic rice and a side of lemon ricotta pancakes. When I am thinking of breakfast, this is the place I turn to.

bSgu5QdD98Y4M2HT56ct_w.text: You're likely to have a slight wait if it's the weekend during breakfast or lunch - but WORTH THE WAIT. Friendly staff, great service, super clean and food comes quickly. Nice sized portions and food is Delicious. A neighborhood gem.

q9yLXnXnBd1Tj1or_Ax8xQ.text: My favorite breakfast spot hands down! My favorite dish to order is the Mexican skillet, the carnitas are so tender and they have the best potatoes and French fries. I usually order the red velvet or hazelnut pancakes but honestly, you can't go wrong with any pancake here. For lunch I love the turkey and avocado sandwich with French fries and a side of ranch (you have to try it). There usually is a wait time, but trust me it is worth it!

yP8pa-A-quD5QOalWzoyUQ.text: Love love love Babystacks!Always go when I have a chance. They have good there that would satisfy almost any kind of taste. I just wish they were open longer than 2pm. They do start early but sometimes your in the mood for that food later. Especially after being out all night and sleeping most of your day!

hLD_LUnMfnPHY8vG_lQsHA.text: Our server Lorena was the best server I've had in such a long time. The food here is definitely something to check out, and as a transient person, I have to admit that this is place is definitely fresh and unlike other places I've been to for breakfast food. The wait is a little long, but that's to be expected from how popular it seems to be. The food is great. Their food is sort of an American/Filipino/Hawaiian mix that is truly a unique combination. We ordered Lolo's adobo rice, Kalbi ribs, and the Nutella crepes. It was so good. I would definitely recommend this place to others. It's well worth the wait to eat here!

_8LDe6i1vKOErOop-bmGJQ.text: Love this place! Everyone raves about the red velvet pancakes but I find them somewhat bland. If you want an amazing pancake, try the cinnobun or my current favorite, the orange creamsicle! Orange flavored pancakes served with an orange drizzle, whipped cream and a cream cheese frosting/syrup. If you're not a complete sweet tooth like me, try the lemon ricotta cakes, they are huge and amazing!  The team here is very friendly and helpful too!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet creme crepes $7.75, $9.25 with strawberries.
