G7MKoktNytfKqT_J1lc_Cw.text: I really like this place, I always get the Ranchero skillet. I love the green salsa, it is a very delicious and filling breakfast.

YRLXI4VVcyBI5nEgY4q4jw.text: Great breakfast and lunch place!  The Ranchero Skillet is my favorite!  They make their green sauce there and it's amazing!!  Pancakes are really good too. The wooden benches are cute, but definitely not the most comfortable after a while. Try to get there early for breakfast, unless you don't mind waiting.

F2z7m4dF89SICa5Kk4hFlg.text: Service was ok. Wait was long. Their coffee is great! But the pancakes were mediocre. Red velvet pancakes were just regular pancakes with food dye and chocolate chips. The cinnamon roll pancakes were regular pancakes with a pinch of cinnamon sugar on top and (what tasted like) dominos cinnastix icing drizzled on top. The hash brown were a little mushy and bland. The place is pretty clean. Very noisy. Overall I could have made a better breakfast at home.

PXoY9KV9oXjTO6bDFJWMXQ.text: This is one of my daughter's favorite places for breakfast. It usually has a long wait but the sweet cream pancakes are worth it. I had a cowboy omelette today and it was very good. The veggies were tasty in the omelette and I polished it off with the pancakes. The coffee is good and strong too. I like the servers there. They are always polite and courteous and once seated, usually l  get fed pretty quickly.

91l3AzGxoo0IIzdSVHA9Bg.text: Baby stacks has changed my life. This is one of my favorite breakfast places in town. They had me at Portuguese sausage, eggs, and rice. It's a cute little spot and the staff is so friendly. I've been coming to baby stacks for at least a couple of years, I'm wondering why it's taken me so long to write a yelp on them.

i2bYtFaaFQwpRUE_mykmFA.text: This place is the bomb!!! I would go back again and again and again. I love there red velvet pancakes you have to order the red velvet pancakes. I also get the garlic rice and Portuguese sausage and eggs. It's the bomb!!! Some days I crave this place. Service is top notch and waiters are friendly. Again I love this place!!!

XapfFF7cDCFAwu1qFRVZPA.text: This is my second time eating at babystacks and I genuinely love vibe from this place...it feels like home. The service is great, specifically, our waiter who was really fantastic! The food is pretty good, but personally, I have had better. As most of the other reviews stated, the pancakes are the star of the show. I had the hazelnut pancakes which were good, but I wish the hazelnuts were incorporated into the batter instead of sprinkled on top. The whipped cream however, was absolutely delicious! I also got the Kahlua grilled cheese which lacked a little flavor, but was alright. Overall, still good and reasonably priced.

_8vhd7sqTR8Z49hw11KZxw.text: I've been here for breakfast many times and Babystacks never disappoints. I've only been to this location and the one at S. Buffalo, but at both restaurants, the service has always been fabulous despite the crowds at peak breakfast times. A fan favorite, as well as my own, is the red velvet pancakes which are rich and indulgent, but totally amazing. I also love their seasoned potatoes! My parents like to try new things off the menu every time we go and they've never been dissatisfied. I definitely recommend Babystacks but if you're going to come, come early! This place fills up completely by 8am on most mornings it seems, weekday or weekend.

rK5qTe9TzF_UvI9WqiWArQ.text: Baby Stacks Cafe is our go to for a late morning breakfast. They food and service is always great and consistent. Definitely give them a try for top notch breakfast and lunch selections.

37l2DTu4vmSSmbH-RewbVg.text: Back again...  we will just copy and paste the amazingness from before.  Did someone not know about the German chocolate pancakes???  Omfg they are sinful.  DELICIOUS.   Great service

waDPCV0mLQn34ug7X_jCjQ.text: My family and I have been here a few times now and they are great! The staff is nice and the restaurant is clean. Every time we come they are pretty busy but always give us great service and we never feel rushed or forgotten. Even better is their food is great! My sometimes picky eaters are always excited to come and eat very well.

lrzOM14jLzPSi3p7KU0ZEg.text: We are regulars at the Henderson location and Love it..... Decided to try this location..... It's a lot roomier than Henderson and Love the Island vibe in here..... Had the Kalbi and Eggs.... It was Absolutely Delish.... not too fatty very flavorful...

wYY24vgm-EzKjdsCIDeDDw.text: This place is insane. It is so dang good. The coffee is only ok and I still go here for breakfast all the time.  The pancakes are awesome and many of the dishes are so good that it is hard to try it all because you keep going back to your favorites. Only warning, the gravy is underwhelming. Otherwise this place knocks it out of the park.

ld66ikvwS0UMyvJKgDnqTQ.text: Very disappointed in this place tried to order a to go order I called for over a half hour and received a busy signal

3U-VFhj2on-iap0rm-5TtA.text: Loving coming here because the food has yet to let me down.  I bounce back and forth between two items. Cookie butter French toast plus strawberries or the two egg breakfast with red velvet pancakes. This is the only breakfast place (besides ihop) in this area so the wait is always abit long.  They give military discount!!!!! And the servers are always nice.  Coffee is to be desired (I don't mind it)  By far our kids favorite place to eat. Great for families. Don't be in a rush because they are busy. Take out is available.

P4u1y6H0Tp9v2CGW7zz9Sg.text: Food was ok. The price a little high for the food portions. I order a Nutella crape with banana it was $4ish literally it was a single small crape rolled like a taquito. My son order biscuits N gravy with sausage link. I felt like the lols where so small. I order eggs portugues sausage yup it was one sausage.

lyehXIvjiWZxEBnoo5y5Lg.text: Meh... it was just ok. It feels more like a cafeteria then restaurant and most of the pancakes are just too sweet. They are more like desserts then pancakes. The 2 times we went, the wait staff was polite and took our orders pretty quickly. To me however, the price was a bit high.  However, this place should be tried, especially if you have a sweet tooth!

w_SC8FtGNklYj12qak-fUw.text: Nice little cafe, good food, nice staff. We like small cafes that family owned and operated. This is one of those. We will be back!

mMpVn7vqPScjnAxipgN97Q.text: Found this place on Yelp.  Walked in and was seated at the counter for a party of one.  I tried the house favorite "Lolo Rick's Adobo Fried Rice" with small stack of pancakes and a side of corned beef hash browns.  The food plates came out with enough food for two people. I had to take half of it home for another meal!  The house special was just ok, but I will be back to try something else.  Service was efficient and quick.

hoLzWcNXNaCFkcJKEvBiEQ.text: I ordered the cowboy skillet and for some reason i got raw onions and bell peppers on top of potatoes with eggs and cheese. I was so confused as to why my tipping weren't cooked that I asked the lady next to me if that was how it was supposed to be served. Asked the waiter and his response was that he can take it back and have it cooked if I'd like.  Idk about this place, maybe it was a bad day

uem3XfPYMiYAXAkbFGb_WQ.text: Food was superb would definitely recommend for breakfast or lunch, high quality with reasonable pricing, highly recommend and will be back there again. Remember this place is only breakfast and lunch so they do close at 2pm.

Fob4rCYBoFiuKt-zDZD-Mg.text: The pancakes were very good.  The other items- meh.  Kind of a loud atmosphere to dine.    But the pancakes were great. I Know I said that once but it's the best thing here

C1bXll-7s_2cKpX6vmSHtw.text: Love it. The food is great the service is great as well. There alway a wait though so be prepared. My waiting time was about 15-20min but well worth it.

RglUWMlJIJo8HbrZKk-fbA.text: This is my favorite place to eat. It's everything I want in a place. Hawaiian food, Breakfast food, delicious. When I first walked in I was surprised by how busy it was. On a Thursday at 11:30, there was still a wait. No big deal, the wait was quick and the food was well worth the wait. Spam and Eggs, seasoned potatoes and Banana cream pancakes. It was truly a little piece of heaven. I teared up a little, thinking about how much I wish my dad could try the food, and how happy he would have been there. The waitress was nice enough to ask me if there was anything wrong and anything she can do to make it better, she was so so sweet about it. Its truly one of my favorite places to eat and a big selling point in me moving to Vegas

LH4QJ_xd16ipE0TASoTbnA.text: Came to eat for 3. They refused to seat us because we were still waiting for my 3rd friend. They literally had many tables available for us. So instead of seating us and allowing to enjoy a cup of coffee while we wait, they needed us to wait for our 3rd person. It's not like we were a party of 8! That didn't sit well with me. It's simple easy customer service that wouldn't have caused any issues on their end to sit up. But because of their "policy" they've earned this 1 Star.

p6oB5Y7yTKugvQeSCfBEoA.text: Worst place ever. Had my 8 week puppy in a carrier bag while she was asleep after she got some shots and was asked to leave after taking my order and my waitress brought another girl with her to tell me. That's fine I get it. I asked if she could make it to go. Then while we were waiting for my food she told me to go through someone else to get it and then was talking mad crap about me and my military husband in ground of us to everyone! Every employee was staring at us with dirty looks. She starting taking our drinks that were not empty and threw them out! She was really kicking us out of the table when she understood and were leaving! We finally just left and paid for our drinks to get out which we shouldn't have even done!! Don't go here because they are the rudest people I have ever met. All they care about is drama and money.

P9eKqKXnAMTwCnX1FgVwQQ.text: Babystacks is one of our favorite breakfast places! The eggs were perfect and the pancakes are soooo good! Blanca was our server today and was very friendly and always made sure our coffee was refilled. The only complaint I have is that the water is so gross. Its thick and tastes like it's unfiltered. Its undrinkable. Otherwise everything was perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AImN0f8GMuw44HcpqnI99Q.text: The best place to get red velvet pancakes to top off their Hawaiian special that's top notch and is full satisfaction. The wait is about only 30 min in that time you can go check out the stores that are nearby but don't come back late or else you'll have to wait 30 more minutes.

NpiZUM6Fx2LDAq3L2V3a2A.text: Prices are good but you basically get what you pay for.  Food isnt that good, they don't serve you much. People are nice, they only have one bathroom for each gender.

4TbFRYRc2Gy_2spexW_lZQ.text: We've been here several times for breakfast and often bring out of town guests. On weekends, you may have to wait, but it's worth it if you're craving good pancakes! The pancakes are their specialty, and for good reason-- their batter is excellent, and that's what makes an awesome pancake. Their fancy pancakes are just a further demonstration of how really awesome this place is. I can recommend personally the red velvet, cinnabun, carrot cake, bacon and buttermilk pancakes (I wasn't lying when I said we've been here several times!) Their other dishes are quit good too-- I have enjoyed their skillet breakfast and California omelet; by far I was least impressed with their benedicts, but we come here for the PANCAKES, and you should, too!

nHcAfQX993knZUrjINYPOA.text: Learn how to cook steak!!!! And don't serve half good size steaks and half flat flank carne asada looking steaks!!! Will never get steak and eggs here again.

B7IT52vZh1nisvngBuX8tg.text: I recently went to this location and seeing there was room at the counter, asked if my wife and I could sit there.  The hostess told us to wait until she could check to see if anyone else wanted to sit there first.  She then got busy taking care of customers paying their checks, then seating guests at tables but ignoring us.  No one else was seated at the counter.  After many minutes of being ignored, we left.  This hostess never smiled or appeared gracious towards customers, whether taking their names for the waiting list for taking payments. Definitely not good customer service!

X5dsPNMkMgudZTbUKMCnLw.text: Been to all 3 places multiple times. Rice always mushy. Mac salad no taste. Pancakes awesome!

Nt8Bi1hIvZwCisxnXVvqKg.text: The red velvet pancakes were great.  I went at 1030 and it was a 30 min wait for the table. They only give you a lil cup of syrup and if you run out its .75 for more.

OkRNR6fl3nZZYzs0dC-JDQ.text: We had a mediocre visit.  On my first visit, the coffee was weak. It took longer than usual to get our coffee and water.  The banana pancakes did not have a robust flavor.  My husband liked his omelette.  The cafe is loud because it is an open room. Our experience was just 'meh'.  However, I would go back again to give it another chance.

r0SK75pOkNkPEvNm8UIZ_Q.text: AMAZING!!! Sooooo good. Hubby and I took the kiddies and we all got something different and there wasn't a bad bite in the bunch. Seriously, red velvet pancakes are to die for. I am drooling now just thinking about it. PANCAKES PLEASE!

QEdpg_CSniyzzWytzj_yzw.text: This place is awesome. Food is delicious. Its a ma and pop feel. Great service. Every person so far has been very nice and quick.

fj0P0dyf0TI0fk5BcO4UAg.text: I don't understand why others have a problem with this place.   Excellent food, reasonable prices and extremely good service.  Everything we order there is delicious.  They get very busy so the best advice I can give is to get there super early.

9r5tMJdLr51WjNOOei7xUQ.text: My husband and I live across the bridge from this restraunt and frequent it quite often. It is sad to say though that I will not return again. Since we began going to here the service especially at the front counter has become atrocious. Yesterday I woke up to a charge from BabyStacks on my card for 07/15/2016 and I have not been to this establishment in 3 weeks. Now I will have to take the time to go to bank have them investigate the charge and point of sale date. This is very difficult when using a company card that has to be closed at the end of each month. My final complaint is when I arrived this morning to eat breakfast CASH in hand the place was moderately busy however I am one person and the entire counter area was empty. I advised the older lady at front that I would be happy to sit at the counter. She stated "not yet." I stood there for 10 minutes, single person looking at 8 open seats. This is not that difficult to figure out. I removed my name from the list and will not nor my husband return to here. It's not that great with the hassle attached. I also did have to go to bank and had to open case and close account because I am just not cool with their billing practices.

pZPFB3K23zcqeah7FDYWTQ.text: This place always takes so long to seat you, the service is never on point. If you go, make sure you have a ton of time to wait. On the up side, that food is actually pretty good, if you have all afternoon to wait for it that is...

gm0ZttSJyQFLbdkdMt5Ocg.text: What do you do when you are waiting for a table for two and there are 5 tables of 2 and 3 tables of 4 empty? Well, the explanation was the kitchen was backed up. Not good enough. They still could have seated you and gave you coffee, especially to the customers who were standing. I left, so I can't rate the food.

qLCkFa29r9fjqiHkUpu4kA.text: I was bummed out about this place.  Service was slow,  and people seated after us got their food before us. All around me people were enjoying their meal,  so I was hopeful. I got the red velvet pancakes,  my mom got the rocky road pancakes.  They took a long time,  and when we finally got them,  they were cold and dry. The rocky road pancakes had barely any syrup on them. The Portuguese sausage was lukewarm and ok, but not great.  We were starving, so we ate it,  but I won't be coming back. Oh well,  we tried it.

SkQJWTK3wDlkZ_RbKBnVlQ.text: Love love love ! I have heard so many great things about this place and finally stopped in to try it out! Our waiter was great! Helped us out a lot, we had so many questions about the menu but she was very patient with us. Food was great, pancakes were delicious. I will definitely be coming back !

xYXjyoC1eqXTRh1f3m_A6Q.text: Wow, this location is finally open after waiting for seemed like forever. Same old good dishes served on the other locations like Rick's Adobo fied Rice, Kahlua Pig Benedict and especially the Red Velvet Pancakes. They are still trying to operate as normal as possible but still the service is still good.

S-zELUfom4oVnA38eIGEww.text: Just ate here and will not be back. First of all the seating was uncomfortable,  the booths are hard wood. The orange juice was from frozen concentrate. Ordered a ham and cheddar omelet, seasoned potatoes and asked to have onions and bell peppers added to the potatoes. On the side I ordered the banana cream pie pancakes. The first omelet was burned and included onions and bell peppers. I  tried the pancakes while waiting for the re-order, they were bland and tasted like flour, there were two pieces of banana cooked into the pancakes. The second omelet arrives, again burned eggs, not very flavorful,  and I was unchanged to add cheddar on the inside. Needless to say, despite starving, I could not finish the meal. When on my last bite, after my boyfriend was done with his meal, the waitresses finally returned to the table to ask "was everything ok", not giving us a chance to answer, she disappeared into the kitchen. When we went up to the counter to pay, we were asked by the lady how everything was, when I gave my opinion and pointed to the almost whole breakfast that I had left on the table, she made no offer to adjust the bill. Then our waitresses walked up to the counter and started arguing with us that had we said something at the table, she would have adjusted the bill, then repeated herself in saying it, I walked out and left my boyfriend to deal with her. The whole experience was a gross fiasco.

jkC7MakUpC-7PuOr51utpQ.text: When we arrived we were told the wait would be 15-20mins then after 20mins we were called to be seated but the host told us he could not seat us until the 3rd person arrived so we would have to go back on the list and wait again once the 3rd person arrived - I have never heard of such a policy since we were ready to order all of the food -all ready have the 3rd persons order. We walked out and went to Mimi's where they sat us right away and served us coffee while we waited. Last time I was at Babystacks they messed up our order and we waited 20 mins for them to bring us the correct food and it was cold. Will not be going again.

MHMr5AFWGncZjXEtGe6QFg.text: I've been here a few times. The first time was great. We did have to wait a while for a table. After our first visit I can say the service is not the greatest. You do wait a while for your order to be taken and then sometimes the food is not consistent. The good is still pretty good though just van be very good or just ok.

B7s4Ks_Oa1dhd0buKVLZTA.text: Ya know, this was my favorite place in Vegas until today. We are frequent customers but I won't be back to this location after the way I was treated today. My husband and I are celebrating our 15th anniversary and this is where I wanted to go for lunch. I ordered my usual, rocky road pancakes. When they came, they weren't right. They had chocolate chips on them instead of the normal marshmallows. I sent it back and was sure to be nice to the server...after all, it wasn't his fault. 25 mins later, I STILL hadn't gotten my pancakes. My husband had eaten his entire meal while I sat there and watched numerous tables get their orders. I've worked in restaurants, the common practice is to fix a customer's order before working on new orders. I complained to the manager and all she could say was "there's a health inspector here and she's not letting us work." Really? Because other people have gotten their food, no problem. Then she offered to take it off my bill. Gee, how generous of you...SINCE I NEVER EVEN GOT THE FOOD! I walked out extremely pissed and will not be back

IfOG08eIMDN1N0jOe3byxw.text: Love this place!!  So glad to have one closer to home, went there this morning for breakfast. Service was fast and as always great. I had the piglet skillet and upgraded to the red velvet pancakes (which are to die for). Will definitely be returning!

RI5U1cfqP1iki6CrGErOAg.text: This place is great! Went for brunch with my boyfriend the other week- he ordered the adobo omelette and I got the Nutella French toast. Both were very delicious!! Lots of items on their menu. Definitely coming back soon to try the corned beef hash!

jhIDG_f6K9HbWM-ndATEtw.text: We love Babystack! So many pancake choices and they are all delicious! We usually get the bacon and eggs with seasoned potatoes and our favorite pancakes.  Friendly staff and clean environment. It is a popular place but we have only waited 15 minutes at the most.

HdH5biBpIAsKSRSlv7hzDQ.text: Great place for the traditional breakfast - pancakes, eggs, etc and also for the unique twists for the adventurous palate.  Kalua pig benedict - a traditional eggs benedict with shredded kalua pig on top instead of the ham. Super flavorful, I actually prefer this version. Adobo fried rice omelet - this is a monster! Maybe share with a friend and split some pancakes too. A generous portion of adobo fried rice wrapped in a very thin egg omlete. The fried rice is the bomb and hearty. Well seasoned and delicious. Also, so many pancakes! So many flavors! You'll have to make at least 5 trips back just to sample them all. Yum

rVoG6-mOPd2nfQfEnPFr1g.text: Decent food. Love the concept of having a breakfast place that has the general American breakfast options as well as a few hawaiian/Filipino options.   Love that you can get a side of specialty pancakes so that you can enjoy your savory and sweet breakfast.   Generally a burn em and turn em place. Quick service.

bhuUavBbNsi1s2fnVJzHaw.text: Mediocre overpriced food...charged me .70 for a side of hot sauce. Why stop there...you should charge for fork rental too

LepC48oK7ZB32lAyfq-2YQ.text: Went here on a Saturday morning for breakfast.  It was super busy and the tables were packed. They said it would be a 35 minute wait, but we were seated within 10 minutes.  Our waiter acknowledged us quickly and took our drink order and then was MIA for around 10-15 minutes.   I ordered the Honey French Toast and my partner in crime ordered cinnabun pancakes.  Both were amazing! The french toast had a huge dollop of fresh whipped cream on the top.  So yummy.    The ambiance was normal for a weekend breakfast place.  We were seated super close to a very annoying family of 4, but we dealt with it. Overall service could be better, but the food was delicious.

SREeU1UIyHUWxeMz2KEl4g.text: Had a great breakfast here Saturday. Walked in about 8:45, still lots of tables free. But by 9:15 the place was jamming and folks waiting for tables. Server was prompt & friendly.      We did not have to wait long for the short stack strawberry pancakes and lemon pancakes. Great light textures and flavors.  Twice our coffee was just warm but the third time was just right. This was our first visit and we are coming back for sure!  Anxious to try crepes and some other items.  The menu has several varieties of pancakes and egg dishes, including the chocolate chip pancakes I plan on trying soon.      My only complaint was acoustics....it was so loud conversation was hard to carry on.

8qD-w6Zv5r-z_w3bVLyDRQ.text: Comparing this to the other two Babystacks...it weighs a little less on the quality side.  I know it's hard for chains to be so consistent, but other chains do succeed...  The main things are -  The food seems to be a bit overcooked. If you look through a lot of the pictures, especially the pancakes, a lot of them are cooked or even burnt.  What boggles my mind is - why would the cook even serve them? Then, why would the waiter think those are okay to serve? Shesh...it's so bizarre to me.  We ordered the carrot cake pancakes and they were overcooked, but still edible. Yes, we ate them. I will praise them on one thing, the cheesecake icing is delightful.  On top of that, we had the Mexican Skillet and the Spinach Benedict.   Both were okay. Biggest thing for both of us were both dishes were very soggy. Everything, from the potatoes to the english muffin. It makes it to where the dish is not very enjoyable. I don't know if they were just sitting in the window for awhile or what.   The service was good - we went in past 12, so it wasn't very busy. Easy to get a seat and the server was pretty attentive.   To round it up - you have a lot of options to choose for brunch or breakfast in the Centennial area. If you're feeling a little risky, do try.

GN7ZuZ5TUDzb3rXaVJQXVg.text: My wife and I dine at this place at least once a week.    Great service and nice portions with a good price.   I'm more biased in ordering their Hawaiian/Filipino breakfasts more than anything else .  I often order the "Rick's Adobo Fried Rice" (adobo fried rice with shredded chicken wrapped in omelette) or the Loco-Moco (fried egg and hamburger patty on top of white rice smothered with gravy).   You have an option of choosing a side, which can also be any of their options of pancakes.  I am a big fan of the carrot cake pancake.  For a few extra bucks, you can order another side.  I normally order the Portuguese Sausage (cut into several pieces) or a side of Spam (2 per order) to round up my meal... I know this may seem a lot, but I was raised understanding that breakfast is the most important meal of the day.    Needless to say, I like this place A LOT.  I highly suggest anyone try this place, at least once.

FmKF6s6wQ69RmNsTocBkbQ.text: Had this place a couple of days ago, I saw it one night leaving smiths and decided to look at the food pictures on here (lol)... And my family just HAD to go, especially that it's right around the corner.  My mom and her husband had omelets and buttermilk pancakes ... I on the other hand had the Huntington skillet with hazelnut pancakes and THEY WERE SO GOOD! Will def go back every time I visit my parents. I want to try everything!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huntington Skillet ... LOVE
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hazelnut Pancakes (yummy)

cMWDrcpCgGxmUvQ3wtmsqg.text: Very impressed with the food and the pancakes are amazing!  Wasn't happy how the food didn't all come out at once or I  would have given this a five star.  Would definitely come back again!  :)

r5C7Rf0JK-OcM1YGEtIZYA.text: This location is a lot bigger than the one on Buffalo which is nice. The food is delicious as always and the service is also great and I always get my adobo fried rice. My only complaint is the old white lady up in the front wasn't very welcoming or nice either. No need to be an old grumpy fart to your customers for no reason!

ujR3o1fqaCG2GbtGCy96XA.text: Waited 20 min to be seated on a very busy Easter Sunday, but once we were, our food came out fast and hot.  The waiter suggested the bananas foster pancakes when I asked what was the best one there, and he wasnt wrong! It was a specialty not on the menu and it was really good.  My son had the white chocolate chip pancake and my daughter had the red velvet pancakes.  They both loved them.  This was my 2nd time here and I will definitely come again!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobo fried rice omelette
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas foster pancakes

yUo00qBQDxoBv_t4yCRAPQ.text: Came here for the adobo fried rice and was very happy with it.  Service was slow. The place was busy, but not so busy that you should need to flag down multiple servers for a water refill or the check, but that's what ended up happening anyway. Minus one star for (lack of) service. Would come back for the adobo fried rice, but I'll get it to go next time.

OFGnZL2Hdhk-JFGUAcS8Bg.text: The food is good like always, but the service at this location needs work. When we came in, no one acknowledged us and there were 3 other groups waiting. There were workers walking around and still never asked us if we have been assisted or greeted us into the establishment. The other 2 groups ended up leaving because they actually weren't acknowledged upon their entrance as well. And even after they walked out, there was no apology for the wait and they just looked at us and said 4 right this way. A greeting goes a long way. Even if you're busy, you should still acknowledge your guests and let them know it would be a moment. Very disappointed in the first point of contact.

SXSxE-E3spjg8ILsYVQkhw.text: I have been looking on yelp for new places to go and eat, being that we are fairly new to the area. I seen the pictures of all the different pancakes and had to come and try for myself! AMAZING! I had steak and eggs and banana cream pie shirt stack Great food friendly staff and decent prices ! We will definitely return

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V5bGpjBsldhRWWhecOTcWA.text: First off, this location is HUGE compared to the others. So, you have a good chance of getting in. But not always. Wait times here are longer than the others, both for the seats and the food. Even when there isn't many people inside, you will wait.  I have been here three times now, and I did a take out, and each time I have been less than impressed. Perhaps I will always hold the first location as the best, but really, this one is alright. The crepes here are not good. Chewy and bland, really a let down. The quality of the skillets and pancakes has been hit or miss. One time my stack was under cooked in the middle, very gooey.  Service is slow, and the benches are really not made right. They are not comfortable at all.  Overall it's a good fix when you don't feel like driving to another one, but if you are really in need, just make the drive.

qUEjIisaxboMdsmfiMoUmw.text: We seem to be the breakfast neighborhood as we have plenty of breakfast/brunch options within a 5 mile radius. This is one of the newest in the neighborhood and the 3rd location for Babystacks.   I got the adobo fried rice omelette- The adobo had good flavor and the omelette was fluffy and cooked right. You get a choice of side (mac salad, potatoes, pancakes) and I chose the macaroni which was fairly standard and decent.   Lemon ricotta pancakes- this I think is my favorite on their regular pancake menu. Its a bit different since these are thin pancakes, like German style pancakes. I like it because its a good amount of sweet and the light tang from a squeeze of fresh lemon on it is nice. If you like those Dutch Babys this is the pancake cousin.   Service was decent enough, but nothing standout. We had our drinks refilled and were checked on.    I hope that the quality of the food stays at this one as I feel the original location has slipped a bit in my last 3 visits. I'm glad to have another option in our hood.

Glt5aI66-BHYTNaf15ktuA.text: It's funny just yesterday I was telling a friend it's hard to mess up eggs but I ordered the Huntington Omelette and carrot cake pancakes. I don't know how the eggs were actually dry and hard to cut through with a fork...thats odd. I went ahead and covered them with hot sauce so they would have some flavor. The potatoes were cold and old. I didn't eat very many of them. I know what leftovers taste like. I did come in at noon so maybe I got the remains of the breakfast rush. The pancakes were good but a little unremarkable. I guess once you've had Stacks and Yolks nothing else will ever compare. I will not return but I will drive 30 minutes to go to Stacks and Yolks...their pancakes are HUGE. So much better than this place.

-jhE7btlZDKyoCM2Qp-eIA.text: Service was great but I had some issues. They brought me toast that was completely burned and presented it to me flipped over with the not burned side showing... Like someone wouldn't notice. Not sure if I'll be coming back. Wasn't bad, wasn't great.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt toast

j6jNsXEgGbqaugx2EOKkMA.text: Finally made it to Babystacks on a Saturday morning. The wait was not as long as you would imagine and it moved pretty fast. It was definitely busy though. Tried the Kalua Pig Benedict and my husband tried the Loco Moco. Everything was delicious and perfectly seasoned. Also split the Red Velvet Pancakes and they were also worth the wait. Not as sweet as I had imagined them being and a short stack was perfect for sharing. Looking forward to them opening their Henderson location. Will definitely be back and looking forward to trying more dishes on their large menu!!

9IvdUUv4QYfLDToZpDvjxA.text: Love this place good food and great prices be ready to wait a bit.But you will find out worth it.pancakes are the bomb!!!!!

nmN0noPpWzYYfkMiU2TeVA.text: Babystacks is a great restaurant. The food was delicious. I enjoyed the pancakes and sausage. Very good quality. The staff was fantastic and very friendly. I would definitely come back again! It's is a jewel in the heart of Centennial Hills!

BmfVJkS-TV7JfEDeUsHxQg.text: Dear Babystacks,  I did my due diligence by bringing my whole party of 5 in at the same time... Please do yours and sit people in the order they arrived. One of the girls at the front seemed a little confused after the other girl asked her why sat the party that came after us before us... And then laughed it off... Thanks- we have been loyal but we will be going to The Cracked Egg from now on!

j3Bme5mzUUHl9pldA8AM4w.text: Oh man!  What can I say.  We love this place.  It's or favorite breakfast spot of all time.  The wait is always worth it on the weekends.  I'm by all means not a pancake guy but I order their pancakes every time I go with a skillet. We haven't had 1 bad experience.

6sGBAuWt1FtmSx5eUNRayg.text: This morning the food was really good.  Babystacks was starting to become a hit or miss restaurant but this morning which was around 8am, we had a chance to sit down immediately and was greeted right away.  Bianca took our orders and answered all the questions that I had regarding the menu.  (I always have questions.) The presentation and portion was beautiful and the food tasted really good.  The restaurant was clean and it us reaffirmed this restaurant as a good place for breakfast.

3srgHeUod-H4dfxDRpF-Iw.text: FYI this location doesn't do Togo orders between 9am and 12pm on Saturday and Sundays. You can't even go in to order Togo. So if someone is sick and craving strawberry pancakes...Tuff. You MUST eat in the restaurant or wait till the afternoon. WOW. Babystacks knows customer service.

tY60zoKDzaGSJq2bIaZjGA.text: This is our go to breakfast place in Vegas. Mexican skillet is fantastic. Pancakes are on point. Also they make some great coffee. Sometimes on the weekend the service is lacking but the food more then makes up for it.

-V3y4pCHLnS91UuaVnCMAQ.text: Exceptionally bad service. The only reason I come here is because I cannot find sweet cream crepes anywhere else in town. If it wasn't for that fact I would never come here. On multiple occasions my wife and I have walked into their restaurant only to be given a 25-30 minute wait time to be seated. This would not bother me however there are more empty tables than full tables. It's upsetting because the food here is great. I will not let up on the bad reviews and complaints until the management and host staff is replaced. I will lose this restaurant as much business as possible until the business gets better.   Here's a tip babystacks...full waiting area+empty tables=no money.

TyKGzje6fGYhmA6fVO1XMA.text: I preface this review by stating that my main complaint, and the reason I shall never return to this business is based on one policy (well and other than the pancakes I find there food to be underwhelming).  Babystacks, at all locations, has a policy that they will not seat any customer until their entire party arrives. Under certain circumstances I could possibly understand this but I was so appalled by my experience this weekend and their response that I just can't go back there. So the first time this happened to me was approximately two years ago at the Rampart location.  I was meeting a friend there for lunch, they were busy, there was just two of us. She was literally about five minutes away. I went up to the counter and they refused to seat me until she arrived I was told "we don't seat large parties until every one is here" to which I stated "two people is a large party?".  By the time she arrived there was a wait, although there wouldn't have been had they let me be seated. But we waited and ate there.    Two years pass... till now, I admit I went back once about a year and half ago since then  friends wanted to go there. Last Friday I went there to meet a friend and her daughter who is 18 mo. old. It was about 10:00. There were a couple of people in the restaurant but it was not busy by any means and practically the whole place was empty. When I got there my friend was waiting, with her 18 mo old in hand. She didn't have to say anything to me I knew why they handn't seated her but I inquired of the host nontheless and was told we don't seat parties until everyone has arrived. Bad business policy, no one in the restaurant, you have a mother with a toddler (who anyone with kids nows is hard to do in a restaurant in the first place) and they are not busy by any means. I complained and the host asked if I wanted to talk to the manager, I said yes and this other female walked over. I thought she seemed pretty young to be a manager, maybe around 20 but it could happen so I proceed to tell  her I thought that was poor service. Only to find out (after I finished talking to her for about five minutes) that she wasn't the manager either and the entire time she was smirking without apology which again just made me more livid. By the time I finished talking to her and was told she wasn't the manager I was just too disgusted and tired to discuss this yet a third time with a party. In my opinion they should have a little common sense, if there is no one in the restaurant and it is unlikely there will be a rush of people i.e. it's not a weekend morning then why upset your customers by making them wait. So what if I went in and said it was a party of one - was seated right away and then hey I "run into" a friend who wants to sit with me - what then. This won't happen as I am not going back.   Okay enough of my rant - you get the picture. I will not be returning, nor will my friend who promptly left with me.  As to the food, the pancakes are good, however the rest of the food is just "meh" to me. They do have fresh brewed tea. Their potatoes are frozen, I asked and the waiter when I previously dined was refreshingly honest. So it's not like there is going to be a hole in life by not going back there. So from there we went over to Lulu's - which leads me to my next review...

lyeBfzG0U4m6J6Lh6EaGJQ.text: This place is worth their long wait. It's a small place and the food is great so what do you expect? Everything I've ever had here tasted great and the servers are always sweet as pie :)

RWLvsaVje4zPdJuDyGLcJA.text: great breakfast spot, happy its literally across the street from our house.  pros: pancakes are AMAZING! (except for the blueberry pancakes, they're a joke! plain pancakes with a few blueberries on top, wtf?!)  cons: servers are nice yes but service is soooo slow!  i like the decor of the original location, since this one looks cheep but the pancakes are made with love and thats why we keep coming back

XYA0zKcSI7hlPdqw0w6vag.text: So annoyed. Called today at 11:48 to order take out and "Julie" said they can't take to go orders because they are too busy. I don't understand why they can't take an order and if their kitchen is open. I didn't even mind waiting. Perhaps they need to change their info and state they don't do take out orders.

pTkFa0D_i6zl4T84w1LLwg.text: The very first time I went the buffalo location and I  thought it was just ok. I found out they had another restaurant on Durango and not only is it around the corner but the restaurant bigger, all of their staff is always pleasant but I thought the quality of food was better at this location!!

yVti-ezKNEswZB_5uC_3Ug.text: Food quality was excellent. I wish the restaurant was bigger to include the bathroom. The wait time was long but I imagine this is common due to the food quality and friendly staff. Mahalo!

BLnta_DOG5QOsORHapLacA.text: I have been anticipating to eat breakfast at this place but after having some HAIR strands on my eggs, it just ruined my appetite and my experience. I will never go here ever again or any of their other establishments.  Me and the wife just stood up with disgust facial expressions and excused ourselves, my wife felt bad because she can see that I was really disappointed....

aJ3MbDxs-ahOOLGBoGMeAQ.text: Rick's Adobo fried rice was the bomb!!! Great service. Support local anytime the food is this good!!!

pcZejk7pE_2tbcv6yJ68Zg.text: I love Babystacks. I've only had one dish here, the Banana Foster, but It was amazing I loved it so much. I hope this location gets more money invested into it because it has major potential. The only problem with this place is that it needs a better seating arrangement especially for those big crowds, but altogether the food makes this place.

sW5bIjYUc5lhLsnrtK1zNg.text: The babystacks selection is great.  Tried a few and they were all yummy.  Will come back to try more. The portions are good, and the food was delicious.

QLa4X7kLpS4hym8gA0UX6g.text: By far the best place for breakfast! The service is on point and the food is outstanding!! This was my first time trying this place, and I'm so glad I did!! I will definitely be back!! Preston in particular is a wonderful server! The wide variety of pancakes will leave you indecisive, they all sound great! I can't wait to come back and try some more! :)

xVqRo4U9vHC3mIdRAkA3Fg.text: This place is super overhyped. Potatoes are dry. Pancakes are half-assed. We ordered a few popular half flavors and they're not that special at all. Hash browns are bland, as well as their meats (spam, sausage, etc) Everything was just meh, not worth the wait.

Eep0iLi2pRF04Nf6a1pfeQ.text: LOVE this place! Best pancakes ever! I don't even bother thinking about iHOP anymore. The red velvet pancakes are heaven and the banana cream pancakes are soooo good too!  I'm Filipina so of course I order the Lolo Rick's adobo (I get the eggs on the side) and honestly it's better than any adobo I can make. The kalbi ribs are also my husband and my favorite.   If you come here on the weekend, there will always be a wait but trust me, it's worth it. And the wait is never really long either.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hOJ534QKIrZPsWvH041y5w.text: What can I say about this place that hasn't been said before? It's amazing.  Every few weeks I'll treat myself to a very rich breakfast and this is one of my favorite places to visit. The place is alwaya packed so you might wait a few minutes before being seated but don't worry the wait usually isn't more than a few minutes.  The cuisine revolves primarily around pancakes but there are other options. Some even have a Hawaiian/Filipino take on them like the Hawaiian eggs Benedict they have on the menu. Easily some of my favorite eggs benedicts in Vegas.   Pancakes here are perfect and not dry like other places. You can get them standard or upgrade them to any of their different options. Most people I know like them upgraded with the red velvet batter but I prefer them with strawberry topping on top.  Very casual atmosphere and the casual setting is very welcoming. Every server I've had is super attentive too. Definitely check it out if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and gravy
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of strawberry pancakes and a Mexican scramble

s9QujdlxWq7C9pmkoBBlSA.text: I had breakfast several times at baby stacks before they specialize in pancakes , this morning I tried something different and this morning and was pleasingly surprised they make corn beef hash that is the best I ever tasted bar none !

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I had the senior special and I upgraded my pancakes to the cinnabun pakes for a small fee I&#39;m stuffed .under $8

ETEWKowOh8Rif9yAa6WOsQ.text: Love going here for breakfast. It gets super busy late morning so I do suggest going earlier if you can. They have so many options to choose from & we've tried about half the menu so far. They place is also pretty clean & the staff is very friendly. They even have a cute breakfast bar on the side of the place in case you want to be out of the crowd.

v4uSoBAeneUmIieb5f7HMg.text: Baby stacks is a place I frequent at least twice a month if not more for breakfast. The pancakes and the French toast are sooo good. Before I heard about Babystacks I was an IHOP kind of girl and their flavored pancakes are way too sweet. The pancakes at Babystacks are perfect! Sweet but not overly sweet. The butter/cream/ice cream concoction that come with the French toast should be bottled and sold! Give it try you won't be disappointed.

fntKXD_F-T_HS4bzD7gQOw.text: Josh was my server today and he gave the BEST service! He was taking care of the whole front of the restaurant on his own and kept his cool with a positive attitude. I am a server myself and I found his work ethic impressive. I would definitely come back again since the food was also delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0nBolluYmdp2C_l7ZihA3Q.text: We moved out here a little over a year ago and go to this Babystacks regularly. We enjoy it better than 2 other locations we tried out here. The food is always good and the staff always friendly!

XM0hFlcKHJGDpPQIyElarg.text: The lemon ricotta pancakes are soooo good. We've always had good experiences at this place. I always mention Babystacks to my neighbors and friends if they are looking for a good breakfast option.

N4JNpHnH5x3EjIay17dCzw.text: Food is always great here. Very quick service as well. I am beyond obsessed with the Orange Creamsicle Pancakes. And the Hawaiian Benny, Perfect combination of sweet and salty. It comes on Hawaiian rolls, spam, smothered with gravy and topped with furikake. Deliciousness!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalua Grilled Cheese had a good flavor but was kinda dry.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange Creamsicle Pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian Benny

htmJk88MsDD-IWtIpyzi3A.text: Great place to have breakfast. Great food and service. I had the country fried steak. WOW it was great...

jEJ5ipNgFyGTQcMZ4J0Lnw.text: This. Was. So. Good. Honestly. I had the veggie omelette which comes with potatoes AND pancakes. It was the perfect size. Big but not overwhelming. I upgraded to the s'mores babystacks and oh my goodness. Heaven incarnated onto a plate. My best friend got peanut butter and banana ones and also was in love.   Our server was amazing. like I said, food was incredible. I think it's my favorite restaurant now. I love a good cheap, hearty, homey breakfast place. There were like five parties in front of us for a wait but they got through them so quickly!   Only thing is I wish they had espresso drinks: lattes, cappuccinos, macchiatos, etc. or even iced coffee! The bottomless refillable coffee is nice though, so I can't complain about that. Overall, great, delicious time.

pPCIRwv1Ic5Ohpx0Pnc7Rw.text: Whenever we fly to Las Vegas, our family always has somewhere new to take us. This was one of the new places they wanted us to try and after eating here, I went back to Hawaii and told all of my friends and family where to go to eat!   The staff here is friendly and attentive. If we weren't too sure on what to eat the waiter ( I forgot his name ) was very helpful in recommending what to eat! They also kept coming around and asking if we needed more drinks and if our food was alright. The service was amazing!   Next, the food! I loved every last bit of it! We ordered what we wanted to eat and we all shared our food so we could sample a little bit of everything. I'm very happy to see that they have some local Hawaii favorites like spam and Portuguese sausage!   Overall it was an awesome dining experience! I'm glad I have someplace I can go if I miss the food from home!

Qcxif_GFAy5BrwQu9BQl7Q.text: YUMMMMMM love their food especially their corned beef hash! Their staff are friendly and even though there is usually a short wait time, because the food is sooooo good, it's well worth it!

woMfBkR3eAtTUGivuNdD8Q.text: This was not a good breakfast.  My husband and I split a omelet breakfast.  The sever did not bring an extra plate nor offer to split the meal in the kitchen. The hash browns were barely cooked.  The coffee was not touched up.  The best service was provided by the hostess as she was pleasant and offer us to get drinks immediately.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KQsCajPx3YJywcWpWw-qEA.text: Wow!! Just had the most amazing meal here!! I got chicken fried steak and eggs with a German chocolate short stack. Wife got Adobo Rice meal with red velvet pancakes. I highly recommend the Adobo Rice and either of those pancakes! I swear it's like the best restaurant in Vegas! Great service, dope music and amazing tasting food. Coming back here every chance I get.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jY4EVMlfezv_cncHli2u5A.text: This place gets a three star because of the waitress who took care of me. From the beginning I asked questions regarding the famous adobo omelette. I ended up ordering it and opted out for the red velvet mini pancakes.   The adobo omelette was a huge disappointment. Given, the owners are Filipino, the adobo was horrible. Filipino adobo is based on, garlic, vinegars and black pepper with a touch of soy sauce. This omelette tasted more like shredded chicken over rice and tossed in Kikkoman Soy Sauce! Tasted exactly just that!  I couldn't even proceed to eat it even after adding ketchup!   The server asked how I was doing and told her I didn't want to eat the salty soy sauce chicken omelette and she offered me something else. I told her I would pay for it and to get me the loco moco. I have to admit, the gravy on the loco mock was good. I paid extra for the garlic rice and the patty on the loco moco tasted good as well!   Service provided made the experience well after a bad start. When back in the area, I will be back to try something else on the menu. It seems like their pancakes are the actual business.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very good gravy and good patty.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobo Omelette was a huge disappointment and the Loco Moco made up for it. Filipino owned but failed on the adobo.

lcoFOSQ-wXa_qCNDxkiEtw.text: GARLIC RICE!!!! That's the main reason I had breaking here. I know what you are going to say.... why would you have rice for breakfast? Because it's garlic rice...that's why. Just go to Babystacks, order the rice and you will understand and thank me later. But actually, the different variety of pancakes are good too. From bacon pancakes to red velvet to traditional...you can find it there and then some. Stop by and check it out

0ATq2GA6uTByCl27qRlxCA.text: I visited the Durango location during lunch. I ordered the Lola Cora's corned beef hash and eggs with a side order of turkey bacon. My order did not meet my expectations. My hash browns and corned beef was dry and over cooked. After asking about my side of turkey bacon, twice, I received regular bacon. So I sent that back and received three pieces of overdone turkey bacon. I've heard nothing but good things about this restaurant. I was let down.

JQ7CAnW9rC5UDWKCIzNK1g.text: I've been here a few times and I haven't had anything spectacular but the food is pretty good. Having said that, I haven't been too adventurous. They have everything: omelettes, spam scramble, kalua pig benedict, red velvet pancakes, etc. You name it, they got it. And it does look good, but I personally like a light breakfast so I usually get eggs. Their skillets are my go-to order.   Special shout out for the lemon ricotta pancakes - OMG. They were delicious. I unfortunately I didn't order this so I only got one bite. My sister would only let me have one bite of hers lol. It was really good. I thought it would be heavy but it wasn't at all. It was fluffy & light. The cream cheese syrup was dreamy.

c3DWkB3eUOYU_IdSHKsfOg.text: This place has the best pancakes ever!  This is our new breakfast place. They have a waiting line, however the wait isn't as long as they say it will be, which is good.

Etad4IzfiwrgeU30u2uv9A.text: Eh... Their food is decent but you feel like you are eating on top of other tables.... if you have to get up to go to the bathroom, you're bumping into 5 different tables just to get up. The waitress' are so busy and take forever to refill drinks so thats frustrating. They are also so busy and their waiting area isn't much of a waiting area so it's not even worth it to go here on a weekend anymore.. You try to pay your bill and you're having to move constantly to get out of the way of the hostess seating people and then you lose your place in the long line of people attempting to pay.

c2ChWnRHyfcy-nkRXCZHZQ.text: This place has the best bananas foster pancakes. Everyone goes for the red velvet. If you don't try bananas foster, you're missing out! The staff is friendly. Better seating for little ones would be a nice upgrade. We moved out this way from Henderson a year ago and every other Saturday we order breakfast from Babystacks. That says it all right there!

ZUNRIRBOc76OTYvJDRAxaw.text: My hubby loved the red velvet cakes and I had the bananas foster cakes which were awesome. Quick, speedy and friendly service.

GqwdSlP7dr48JmT5iEp3tQ.text: Strengths:  The ambience is very cheerful.  It feels like it's always spring in there, even if it were the dead of winter.  The space is plentiful and well decorated.  The TVs are a nice touch.  It's clean and has an overall pleasant atmosphere.   The food was delicious, living up to the expectations set by the other two locations.  The bacon was thick and crispy.  The garlic fried rice was an excellent complement.  The hazelnut pancakes had a well-balanced flavor, and will be a hit for Nutella fans.   Area of opportunity:  The food came out a little late, so there needs to be some fine tuning with the process.

wH9OO7LMgX1KwDbVrzXe8A.text: I'm the biggest supporter of Babystacks, have been eating it for years, recommend it to anyone who will listen...  the food really is that good.  Today though my Babystacks love affair might have ran its course.  Was seated as soon as I walked in, no wait which is great, usually there's at least some wait.  Server brings me some coffee, I order, start waiting for my delicious breakfast to arrive...  reading some news articles on my phone I notice a few parties arrive, they've got to wait around 5 minutes to be seated, so I've been seated and food ordered easily 5-10 minutes before they arrived...  coffee cups empty, no big deal food will be out shortly so I wait, it is getting a little busy so I leave the staff alone, not too bothered at this point...  5 more minutes go by, party that was seated after me gets a full spread of food and refills delivered to them.  I start to look for my waitress, maybe my order got jumbled up it happens...  few minutes go by nothing.  Coffee cup still empty...  approach the counter and ask if maybe there's a mix up, people that were seated long after me are well into their meals and I've had an empty cup of coffee in front of me for 10 minutes...  lady is real blunt, "sir your food it coming we are busy".  I say "Yeah I get that but those people sat down 10 minutes after I ordered and they're halfway through their meal, maybe there's a mix up with my order...  she gives me a stop bothering me look, says she'll check on it so I go sit back down...  see her call the waitress over, they have a conversation, while they're talking another waitress brings my food...  coffee cup still empty, no offer to refill...  at this point I'm playing a game to see how long it takes someone to refill my cup.  Food is room temp at best, bacon is cold to the touch...  my waitress comes over to ask if everything's ok, I say not really...  well is there anything I can get you?  Umm yeah coffee would be good since I've been sitting here with an empty cup in front of me for the last 20 minutes...  eat my lackluster $20 breakfast and go to pay...  lady says that'll be $20, I had already set my card down with the check, she stands there with her hand out I point to where I had placed it on the register, she scans my card and just tosses it on the counter.  I'm no body language expert by any means, but you could tell she was being passive aggressive by the way she just chucked it on the counter...  I'm standing there with my hand out to take my card back and she just throws it at me like she's dealing black jack on Fremont street.  By this time I'm past the point of pissed off...  "Is there a problem?" I ask.  She gets a look on her face like she's trying to hold back a fart.  I say "Look, I've been here 100 times, never had this bad of service...  is there a manager I can talk to?"  She gets this kind of fuck you, yeah I'll get you the manager kind of condescending tone...  brings the manager over and it's the same one who brought my food to me when the original waitress didn't...  I'm a pretty loyal eater, I have my spots I love and recommend, this Babystacks has always been one of those spots, but today they lost a customer...  pretty sure it won't hurt their bottom line, just feel really let down by my experience there today...  I'll be sure and let people know about Egg and I or the cracked egg from now on instead of Babystacks...  also wanna point out after reading other reviews I'm not the first who's had problems with the old bitty in the 1982 rimmed glasses that works the register.  Might be time to make a move, a hostess' job is customer interaction, she might be better suited washing dishes or something, customer service isn't her forte.

q2p_Jy-p17bUpIkS7Mb7EQ.text: This Babystacks was pretty busy but still didn't make me wait THAT long.  The server my party had was nice,  very welcoming, and most of all very open to sharing her opinions with us. Their specialty pancakes are for the most part amazing.  I personally love their red velvet pancakes.  The cream cheese icing they have on the side acts as a syrup.  I feel that it compliments the red velvet pancakes so much more than regular maple syrup ever could.  The Portuguese sausage was fair at best.  It was a little undercooked but that's my only complaint.  All in all I would love to go back.

cxgopM9x021OVxcdgtns_A.text: This is the most delicious breakfast place in Las Vegas. Everything from their biscuits and gravy to their pancakes is absolutely superb. Anytime I've gone I haven't had to wait more than ten minutes, even during the busiest times. The staff is very attentive and friendly. Can't get enough of this place!

YnC64ELSSPdf7SO4hU87iA.text: Good breakfast place. I was there just this morning. Service was fast and pleasant. Cowboy omelette was a little over cooked on the outside... browned. Cooked ham, fresh onions and green bell peppers tasted good. The cheddar cheese seemed a little processed. Hash browns were good, but there were a couple of dark specs that were from scraping the griddle in there. They made for some nasty tasting surprises. The omelette was supposedly made with 4 eggs. They must have been small eggs. I have to say the amount of food was good, but over priced. $9-10 for two egg breakfast is beyond reasonable for the amount of food served. They benefit from lack of competition and are always busy.

RTeNpKwYMBAu1eDlizr3Zg.text: Cookie butter French toast is a must. The Huntington skillet is also a favorite.  I feel that this location is better than the other one, as this one is larger, and the cookie butter French toast is plated better.

CPUB2nxKKIQhFPvYvwuD9A.text: I love Babystacks!! The food is awwwwwwwesome and the service is terrific! Sometimes there is long wait on a busy day but it's worth the wait. I live in the area and waited along time for Baystacks and I'm exstremely happy they've arrived!!The restaurant itself is vibrantly decorated and gives a very positive environment to eat in If you're feeling hungry for breakfast, you can't miss on Indulging at Babystacks

Recently opened location by my house is convenient but I would go to any of them just to get a taste of heavenly goodness.
