We are definitely going back again to try other items on the menu. We're gonna bring the kids next time.  Finally a good islander spot to eat. They even play island reggae music too!

MjG6V4JC9NOwgrzLsa6h9g.text: Great place to bring the family for breakfast. My kids love the pancakes. The Kalua Pig Benedict taste like kalua pig back in Hawaii. The breakfast burrito was large, cheesy and very filling. The corned beef hash was good. We also had cinnabun pancakes, rocky road pancakes, and smores pancakes. All were yummy.  A variety of pancakes to choose from.   The prices are very good for the quality and quantity of food.   The coffee is okay. I prefer 100% Kona coffee, so I'm pretty particular about my coffee. I drink my coffee black, so the taste and strength is good.

qPEuZNMGd-xP7ntafo55Hg.text: The red velvet pancakes and the Rick's Adobo fried rice omelette are amazing! This place can be extremely busy on Sundays.

Dpk7Q4uwpF0wD1s5dfevsg.text: Amazing! Everyone is so friendly and helpful and the food is amazing. Best pancakes of my life!!!!

n_wEJod21h-6U-ydjG4S6Q.text: agreed to have a little lunch date with my best friend today and drove all the way from summerlin to try this place out. wow! this place has an at-home feel to it and a modern look on the inside that i loved. the menu consisted of many options from pancakes to crepes to omelets. was most impressed with how patient the staff was when my friend chuckled and told me this cafe closes at 3...& it was 2:25! always hate being 'that customer' but the server was a delight the whole time. 10/10 would recommend!

zKz2XCBkFFrjs_crD3LxMw.text: Stopped by today for lunch as we saw this new location.  The restaurant was not too busy and the layout is fine.  The waitress was friendly, but scarce at times.  The ranchero omelet was great with nice green salsa.  My wife really enjoyed the carrot cake pancakes.  Overall:  very good.

jWXu3gsd5JD1-N2V60KKAQ.text: The only thing appealing about this place is the restaurant name. My wife ordered the skillet with "chili verde" and it was horrendous!  Initial cup of coffee was cold. Pancakes tasted like metal. Waitress was rude. Nothing spectacular about this place. Mechanics garage cabinet by register?  Very disappointed and will not return.

JfBkuw3Ykub5MKXoM0X3uQ.text: This place has everything I love! The service is super friendly, the food is always consistently delicious (Rick's Adobo Fried Rice!!!), not to mention the creative selection of pancakes (Cookies & Cream, Red Velvet, & Cinnabun... Yes please!). One of my favorite spots right now.

EmqejHf9g1uvyl5GsE3Aeg.text: The food at Babystacks is amazing! I hear their wait is long, but we go around 12 and it isn't so bad. Their breakfast burrito is delicious and just the perfect size and let's not forget about their pancakes. The red velvet and carrot cake pancakes are so yum and the cream cheese syrup makes them even better! My only complaint is that they bring everyone's food out at different times. They really should bring it out all at once, so that everyone's food is hot and can be eaten at the same time.

KtUlAgvgqGJ3IjlZDyGKfA.text: My boyfriend and visit here often. The service is always fast and friendly. You can't go wrong when you order their red velvet pancakes, the best you'll ever have! If you don't have a sweet tooth they also have amazing skillets, my personal fav is the babychick.

GP4akmEe_lNHPYYRwkK04A.text: Had the Piggy scramble. It was the best! Had it with wonderful Cinnabum pancakes.with it. Five stars all the way.

OqMMNNAAocbEXnKicuEQuQ.text: Food there is always delicious  BUT I went with my sisters and one ordered carrot cake pancakes. They came out burnt so she sent them back and a girl came back WITH THE OLD ONES and says "see they are meant to be this color" to try and prove my sister (the customer!) Wrong. My sister even explained it's not the color, it's the taste. I don't know if I will return after that stupidity.

vOuiUAyVoW5VZSMFwOInkA.text: Took the little one a few times to get the French Toast. Great staff and quick food. The french fries are awesome with that seasoning they use.

LJpIkufLy91Fdc_kSolYsQ.text: OMG that was the best French toast I have ever had. We need one of these in Tucson. They put the whip cream on the side which was good. Service is great. Everyone helps each other out. My coffee was never empty. All drinks were filled all the time. . My grandson got the pumpkin pancakes they were wonderful. The bacon is great. We will make this a regular place every time we are in Las Vegas.

1yh6K61v832XEbCIQByh6Q.text: The food is good, service is friendly, prices are excellent and portions are decent. They messed up on one of our orders but got us potatoes while we waited and didn't charge us for it. It was great and we will def be back but it doesn't beat the cracked egg.

NUOAwbiOaMa8f4C4vEli7Q.text: Our morning would not be complete with this awesome meal. We did take out this morning .There was something for everyone on the menu. I had the Loco moco with a side of banana and peanut butter pancakes. The portions were perfect. The staff was very friendly and did their jobs with pure awesomeness! Thanks baby stacks! See you again soon!

SmO9xVIJztQpSWO037g7Iw.text: Great pancakes.The downside is that their traditional egg breakfasts are really sub par. Also a bit pricey for breakfast.

TolAbn5IlPC2CcSeJ_EN6w.text: I have been to the other locations and neither one of them were this dirty. We waited for approximately 30 minutes before we were seated. The table we were seated at was not wiped down as there were still fresh water rings on the table.  My daughter found a piece of hair inside the napkin with the utensils. I asked for new utensils, this time, when my daughter opened the napkin, there was a piece of rice stuck in between the tines of the fork.  We were so grossed out. I ended asking for plastic utensils instead.... by the time our food arrived, my daughter already lost her appetite. In fairness,  the waiter was really nice,  that's the only reason why I'm giving them 1 star.

Nd5p5AJnHH_a8JxjbUnj9g.text: We came here on a Saturday afternoon and there was a short wait, but we didn't mind because we have heard great things about this place. All of the food on the menu looked great. My husband I ordered omelets and pancakes. When we got our food, my omelet was not correct. I asked for no peppers. I flagged down our server and let her know what was wrong. She immediately ran to the back and within 5-10 minutes I had a new omelet. I didn't mind waiting because the omelet was great! The only negative part of our experience here was cashing out. We were at the register for a little over 5 minutes before we got cashed out. The host told us it would be a minute, but it took a lot longer than we expected. Overall, we will definitely eat here again.

Hv6z9T2xPWrUuvc4-iry2Q.text: 1 star for management, 5 stars for our server. We get there yesterday morning and are told it would be a 20-30 minute wait, which is normal for this restaurant. Because of the size of our party, we choose to wait outside. 35 minutes have passed and we are still waiting outside and we're starting to wonder what is going on. Shortly after, a woman in a white dress comes to ask if we have a party of 10. I said yes and she said that they've been calling for you. Not thinking about it, I followed her in. She went off to the side to talk to another girl, and I said "Wait, you don't even work here?" She said no, I just saw you and your family waiting for a long time from inside. I thanked her and said it was appreciated. I went up to an elderly haole woman behind the counter and gave her our name.  She was surprised that we were still there. Apparently they had just given up our table. I said, did you even go outside? She said yes we did. And I thought, wtf? Another non-working customer just came outside to grab us. If it wasn't for that other customer, we would probably still be standing outside one day later as I type this. So stupid. Don't lie to my face that you came outside when you didn't. Despite that Haole's ignorance, our server made us forget her and made or meal great. Get someone else to run the front.

gUFqC-3l4r4nzI9Y49Amyw.text: I just want to first point out that I have eaten at all of the Baby Stacks restaurants in Las Vegas and this is the worst and most inconsistent in terms of service. The host staff is awful. There have been four separate occasions where my husband and I have witnessed the host team seating parties out of order. It's not for any apparent reason either as it once was for a table of 2 which was the same as our party. We are not the only ones to have noticed this. This past weekend we saw it happen to another party who got extremely irate. They just seem disorganized and dishonest. They are also not very friendly as you come to expect the host staff to be from other places. It's a shame because the pancakes here are amazing! Try the red velvet pancakes! Best I have ever had. Not super sickening sweet, just perfect. They also give you fresh whipped cream.The coffee is also pretty good in comparison to other breakfast spots around. If you get a chance definitely check the place out but if you want to enjoy your dining experience all around go to one of the other locations...

VYZ_-MCDGONRxYssCa8ADA.text: I will never eat here again. I got corn beef and hashand it was like eating cat food. My friends toast came out burnt and 20 minutes after we ordered. The butter on the toast was just a squeeze butter. The chicken fried steak was absolutely horrible. It was just bread. Then to top it off as we were checking out the hostess didn't understand the fact that I wanted to do half cash half card. She just charged it's all on to my card. Every one was VERY disorganized.  I've heard some great things about this place. But my experience was very shitty. I will not be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef and hash.

HN5Una3PwQNtfK9p6StihA.text: This place is amazing!  We went today for the first time, it is clean, friendly, and the food is delish!  Our waitress was fantastic, and we will for sure be back! I suggest you go, be prepared for a wait if it is on the weekend, because it was packed at 11 am on a Thursday!  Yum Yum Yum!

8rs2MngRcDUH9isN3ZOTiw.text: Went here for breakfast with some friends after our Race for the Cure... We were starving! Got seated quickly (within 15 mins... We were expecting 30 mins) and our orders got taken quickly. I ordered a two egg breakfast with garlic rice and carrot cake pancakes... I was excited. Needless to say, 40 minutes after we ordered, my friends received their complete meals and I received greasy garlic fried rice and some Luke warm eggs. My other friend that ordered eggs also noticed his weren't very hot as well. When I asked where my pancakes were, Jamie Lynn our waitress informed me they would be right out. I ate what I had, and everyone finished there meal.. And guess what? My two (yes... 2!!!!!) carrot cake pancakes showed up... Close to 1 hour after I originally ordered them and after other tables received various pancake orders. Needless to say, I wasn't hungry. I would never return here, nor would I recommend this place to anyone - unless I hated them. Poor service, subpar food and overall a disappointment. I had been wanting to try this breakfast joint, but I would much rather get better food and service at Divine Eatery on Hualapai... Or at IHOP on Centennial. I will never return or recommend Babystacks again.

69gzs330T6ZKLKqgh31k5w.text: by far the best experience and best breakfast place ever!!!!! OMG the banana cream pie pancakes are to die for. the servers are super friendly and the wait time was less then expected but definitely worth the wait! definitely recommend this place!!! you wont be disappointed

GdC5qaJFrbqK6Cl3UkXV-Q.text: This place is horrible! Let me first say that I have gone to the babystacks on buffalo too many times to count and I love it. The food was always exceptional, as was the staff. I didn't like how cramped it was, however, so I was happy when they built this one. So let me tell you why I despise this location. The first time my fiance and I went here he ordered a coffee that had been forgotten for a good 20 minutes so we had to request another and didn't receive so much as an apology. Then I ordered the Cinnabon pancakes, which I've had many times, without pecans because I am allergic. The waitress said oh okay no problem. Guess what came on top of my pancakes? Yep, you guessed it, pecans!! So that right there did not make me fall in love. BUT...I decided to give it another chance. We went again a few weeks later. I ordered the cookies and cream pancakes and made sure it didn't come with any nuts. I was assured it didn't. When my pancakes came out I saw a stray nut sitting on too of the pancakes...it wasn't exactly hidden folks. The waiter apologized and took them to get remade. Let me just let you know that I  am deathly allergic to all nuts; like throat closing, hospital going allergic. The manager came by to apologize and promise me that my pancakes were being remade and she would supervise. They finally come out after my fiance was done with his meal. I start eating them, and they are pretty darn good, then I just decide to flip my pancake over and what do I see?!?! Another freaking nut on the bottom of the freaking pancake!!! Are you kidding me?! At this point I'm almost in tears. This is my life, like it's kind of serious. The waiter kind of laughed and took them away again. I'm sorry, is the possibility of me becoming seriously ill or even dying funny to you?! The manager gave me some bs and just kind of danced around it. I don't really know all I heard was wah wah wah. I wasn't just some disgruntled customer who didn't like something. This should have been taken a lot more serious than it was. Needless to say I will never set foot In this building again. Their pancakes are pretty freaking good, but not good enough to be my last meal!!

4gGDoaHV75hDkb8pBzKAiQ.text: This place is amazing.  Yes, its full, but its worth it. The food is delicious, clean and nice place.  Cant wait to come here again. Red velvet pancakes are the best.

yNuIgOWXzw0R9RJ17nkx8Q.text: No wait and fast service and they are on top of it! Ordered the biscuits and gravy and the gravy was on the sweet side for me and the biscuits weren't the greatest. Also got the loco moco and again nothing special. Maybe we'll try the pancakes next time.

CtJGgI6I8Vkzeis7d77XxQ.text: I was just going through my check ins and saw I did not review Babystacks!!  This place rocks; I think there is something here for everyone!  Pancakes, real good pancakes, can't wait to eat here again on my next visit to Vegas.  Sorry, it's been a a couple of months since I went here, but, if you are thinking, how good can pancakes really be; wait no longer, get yourself in here and get some.  You will not regret it.

jEmokqsVO-X_HRRkW6Dr-w.text: First time here & I guess we should have had breakfast. Maybe breakfast is better but their lunch menu is sub par. Chicken avocado sandwich came much later than the test of the food, the bun was stale, chicken was hard & dried out & avocado looked like it had been scooped a while ago. We sent it back & they took it off the bill. Club sandwich was just OK. So a 1 and a 3 average to a 2. Disappointing.

-jHEwF_XXPnkEbyVlI4MwA.text: Never been disappointed! Service is sometimes slow only because they're always so busy but they're friendly so to me it doesn't matter! Food is fantastic especially the Nutella pancakes!! Yum!

WsGq5njapJ89PYTPEa7bKA.text: I don't get it. The food is just ok. We had 8 people and 6 of the 8 had pancakes of some variety. The 4 people that ordered other items with or without pancake got their food. The pancakes came out 15 minutes after the other food. Get it together and serve everything at once. The Oj tastes like it comes out of a box (like cocktail mix) or shelf stable juice. GROSS.

bjYsjUiED3Mt_CsuIOpq2A.text: Have not eaten here and wouldn't. Walked in early on a Sunday morning and had to exit as quickly as we entered. There was plenty of seating available but the odor of grease was so nauseating we had to leave. My husband kept smelling his clothes hoping the odor hadn't stuck to him.

WwiOdPYBSAemXdPxUvxHRw.text: The food is amazing but when it comes to seating it's ridiculous. They're so precise about all of your party being here I couldn't believe it. It's so inconvenient. I only had one person missing because she was parking and the lady almost didn't want to sit us. Terrible.

LGftEDcyYRcfKTEVqU1aXQ.text: Amazing food ideas all around. I always have a very hard time deciding what to order because everything look s soooooo good,,red velvet pancakes n spam sliders my top 2 picks. Im proud to bring family from out of town and my local friends to this joint.

D6gPigVdzfcuwA-pJjljRA.text: They red velvet pancakes! That says it all- when friends come to visit they get a kick out of the menu selections of pancakes!!

Y3zM5O25LMRxrmdBGvVT8Q.text: This location is less busy than the others and a lot larger. They always have very friendly and prompt service. Also the good is delicious! Very creative pancakes and their seasoned potatoes are yum!

5ohtrwza1-C08a8WaYtuVA.text: I have gone to Babystacks often and I enjoyed the food and the service.  Today I went with several family members from out of town.  I bragged about the service and the food to them.  All four of us ordered our food.  Two people sat next to us at the counter and ordered their food after us.  Every one in my party except me was served their food as well as the people next to us.  I waited several minutes and our server did not come by, everyone was enjoying their food and I had to flagged down the server to ask about my simple order of french toast.  She quickly told me they forgot my order and I asked her to cancel it, she walked away and NEVER returned to us.  Then she sent another server over to ask me if I was sure I wanted to cancel the order and I told her, yes I want to cancel my order.  She proceeded to tell me, they forgot the order and when I asked how they forgot but remembered everyone else's I was told that french toast takes a while to cook, mind you the lady next to me ordered steak and eggs and still got her food in timely fashion.  Then she said to me like she was doing me a favor that she would take it off my bill.  I was truly upset at the extremely poor service and will not be returning.

9Gk7aA07IzF7YTfojyftSA.text: For the most part this is a good place to eat. I love their food. It really is nice to have many types of pancakes to choose from. Their specials are always fun to try. Sometimes services is a little slower because it does get busy. Prices are a bit higher.

GbnzfycSIAwDsY-W__LXnw.text: I don't have any complaints about this place, everything was delicious! Our food was great and so was our server. I ordered the pineapple pancake special and my daughter had the carrot cakes, both were moist and full of flavor. My husband ordered the Mexican which we had no complaints about. The only reason I didn't give a perfect 5 stars is because the wait for the food was a little long and not everything came out at the same time but other than that I would recommend this place and I will be returning.

YO1mpsW5Om6AIyLrnwxASw.text: Having been to all 3 BabyStacks in Las Vegas, I'd say this is a very nice building and location compared to the other two. Food at the original is still the best, but this location's is of good quality as well. Great when you just have to have some Red velvet pancakes

4tti8Dxc_dNXkkeoXb7yaA.text: Really good food but every time we try to go here way busy the need to open it up in a bigger place or another one but its worth the wait great food

N9G4XpJR7tc8FOYK3r8SiA.text: Best breakfast place in vegas! Best food, best service, best prices! My favorite is the Portuguese sausage and eggs with a side of orange dreamsicle pancakes!  I would go every weekend if I wasn't worried about getting chubby!!

ppbxebSi1dasH3riizTWwg.text: This place is still the best breakfast place in Vegas! I love that the new location is in centennial and it's HUGE!!!!!! Like wayyyy bigger than the first two locations. They're still working out the kinks as it is a larger store. They've got a new special, COOKIE BUTTER FRENCH TOAST!!!! It's the new craze that everyone's been drooling over! It tastes amazing and it's such a huge portion that I can't even finish it! The cookie butter is sandwiched between the toast, topped with their homemade whipped cream and pie crust crumbles!!' Are you drooling yet kuz I am. They got banana foster pancakes, I was hesitant to try them because I didn't want anything too sweet but wow it's amazing, it was the perfect amount of bananas, caramel and whipped cream! Service is wonderful as ever, very attentive servers. The hosts are friendly and welcoming! Thank you Babystacks for opening up in centennial! I can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The board !
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cookie butter French toast amazingness

Wonn_ev_DlJLoQH5ZF7tYw.text: Went there   today for the first time. I had the spinach Benedict. It was good! Service was good and prompt. Teamwork observed. Seating could be more comfy. Booths, or a little more private. Tables seem pretty close together. But overall; it was enjoyable!

Rfq_pFCaysQQX--pefoMEw.text: If you have not been here yet RUN do not walk!!!  Go now!  (Unless it's past lunchtime and they are closed.)   We attempted to eat here on a weekend morning, but there was a line going out the door so we didn't even get out of our car.  Yesterday, a Wedsneday, my daughter and I decided to drop in.  The place was very plain.  I guess I was expecting it to be fancier, but it's not fancy at all.  Our waiter was very friendly and helpful.  The menu had tons of items on it.  Everything sounded so good, it was hard to decide what to order!   So, we each picked something to share.  We ordered the pulled pork grilled cheese sandwich with macaroni salad, and a skillet with scrambled eggs, potatoes, green sauce, and whatever else they put in there.  OMG...... everything was so amazing!!!!   We could totally understand why it's packed on the weekends!   The prices were reasonable, and the portions were fair.  My only complaint is that they are not open for dinner!!!

vXnne8Vtc6g55DAGNm0MOw.text: Pancakes were great. Worst Loco Moco I have ever had. Hamburger patty just hockey puck like. Rice was dry and kind of stake. Staff did not seen to care. I won't be back.

ShaJESV9-3rZ_Su0_cNqzQ.text: Island Fresh meets Vegas Request!  The surprise on my face when I opened the menu and saw some of my favorite dishes available: Portuguese Sausage and eggs and even Spam Eggs and Rice. With a side order of their delicious Red Velvet Pancakes and CreamCheese Syrup... The perfect start to my afternoon (considering I have yet to make it there before 1130am).  The environment is moving but not too busy with the constant Hawaiian Reggae tunes playing in the background. The staff is friendly and helpful and the location is conveniently located to not have to worry about parking. My only gripe would be the size of the location making for a sometimes unwanted wait time. Otherwise, great food for a good price!  Update: Had the cookie butter French toast... Amazing!

KoE4kWp4sXY9Wj50PY91lg.text: The menu itself is no joke and neither is their food! Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day and these guys nail it. Probably my favorite place in Vegas to serve eggs benedict. The price is a little higher than average but the kind service makes up for it. The place is a tad bit small so may feel crammed at times with the layout. All in all if you're an early riser go check this spot out!

Q9Tu28BvqgAw9QsXCtE1ig.text: Service here is a bit on the slower side compared to other breakfast places in the area. It will take some time for you to get a seat and even more time to get an order taken. So if you are on the run, you might want to come early to have more time.  I had the cookies and cream pancakes. They were good, although slightly too sweet in my book. My dad had the senior breakfast with eggs, bacon, and pancakes. Didn't look that amazing- actually maybe IHOP or Denny's wow only with a higher price tag.  I'm not in a rush to head back there, but I might give them another chance later. $7.95 for 3 pancakes/9.95 for 6 on most of the special pancakes.

C1QncSj66Ba_Zc2BInkbFQ.text: My wife, sister and friend stopped for breakfast. Everyone enjoyed their meals and some of us had a few complaints. My friend ordered Nutella pancakes and a side of spam. Her pancakes seemed a bit dry for her, the spam was delicious. My sister had banana pancakes, which she loved. My wife had wheat French toast and she liked but not loved. I had a BYOWN skillet, scrambled eggs, peppers, mushrooms and potatoes with a side of red velvet pancakes. I wish my food was a bit warmer and I also thought the pancakes where sort of dry.

XElRpiv1EdkzJIInr0DW9w.text: Came here with my hubby and two young kids. I wouldn't describe our interaction with the hostess warm and friendly. When we asked for waters, they were giant cups-which was fine for the adults, but way too big for two little kids. Not to mention they didn't have lids on them. Of course one of the kids spilled their water. The cups were too large for them to handle. My son loved his pancakes, but the rest of us felt the food was just okay. We were unimpressed with our visit there.

lSAvl0jUP9sy4Y9jtvJCEg.text: Me and my family come here often! Their pancakes are so good. I got the banana foster recently..LOVED IT!! I usually get the red velvet pancakes but decided to try something diff. The portugues sausage with rice and eggs are my go-to!! Last time i went they gave a small portion..literally 6 small pieces of sausage. I was pissed. But overall, food is good and service is great!

uGpRVxEMM2X-Je9VFykDAg.text: I wish I was more of a morning person so I could enjoy breakfast more often. I've been here a few times and it never disappoints. I ordered a skillet and it was great. The service was good and my coffee cup was never empty. If you're looking for some good food, look no further. My only request is that the music in the restaurant be a little lower so you can hear your server and the people with you a little better.

TTZQs9PeoLSQ2RbHTXLlTQ.text: I wish I knew what the hype was all about. I've been in and out of the valley for years and had always wanted to try this place for the Red Velvet Pancakes. I hate to say but I was soooo disappointed!  The neon color in the inside was the first concern and then they had such a strange taste; nothing like red velvet in my opinion. Our omelets and skillets were either really salty or had zero flavor. I will say the seasoned potatoes were good and the sourdough toast is alright. Overall I would suggest The Cracked Egg over the wait for this place.

RDMn4ce8ySrTkDyQwv2eyw.text: Went there for lunch on a Sunday which meant it was pretty crowded.  We got seated and it was pretty warm inside.  Got our drinks ok, ordered, and it was getting really warm...asked the server why it was so hot in there.  Response was, "Oh, the a/c is broken". What!  Why don't they tell you that before they seat you?  You think as a courtesy they would tell you that instead of just trying to get your business and make you suffer in the heat.  Got our orders and when they brought the butter packet for my pancakes, it was melted and literally dripping out of the packet.  How healthy or appealing is that!  Will really think twice about going back there again when there are alot of good restaurants in the area...

Iaz0jXTIqdB8u7kgjfVoLQ.text: Go To breakfast stop! We bring any Vegas visitor to Babystacks. The pancakes are amazing and highly suggested! Wait times can be long so arrive early or after 1100.  Don't miss out.

PVyOxDh5oEkcf4kXjQqXAg.text: Great breakfast food.  The portions are generous and the food is delicious.  The cookie butter French toast is amazing.  This is a must try for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rocky road short stack
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The kids love it!

Qr8_heE7PcFyuJNs3KDLTQ.text: We really enjoy this mom and pop style breakfast place, the crepes are awesome very large portions are a plus. The service is on the decline, you shouldn't have to wait 30 mins on your breakfast anywhere. My only other complaint is whenever I order my steak and eggs, despite my temperature request (medium rare) it comes out well done. This place other than these two issues is a great choice for the centennial community.

0qeWF-bHI9wvudT-v3zKaA.text: I've been here twice and it's not all that. First off the wait time is pretty long. Even during the week. They won't seat you until all your party is present. The restaurant is really small and seating is tight. The tables are very close together. The prices are high for mediocre breakfast food. The pancakes are small in size! The best thing about this place is the hazelnut pancakes with nutella. I must admit that it was very tasty! They do offer a military discount. However the old lady cashier is not friendly at all. Not sure if she's the owner.

KUyZ664Gdb3fWNnKqdGxsw.text: The food here is pretty good. It's always crowded and stuffy inside but it's a nice place for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey toast

QsOrinCafOlCs2HE24Tzqw.text: My wife went there today with her friends. Another bad meal. She ordered scrambled eggs and hash browns. The eggs and hash browns were not cooked enough. This place just can't do anything right.

0crSq8neM-Paxgrn9Fzcog.text: Got the spinach Benedict and tried a bite of the banana pancakes. Both delicious, awesome serving portions, I mean huge portions, but so good! Can't wait to come back again!

lmIRsfTL2l8sJr2JUKzlbQ.text: I have been to this Babystacks two times now. I assumed that my first time coming was a fluke and that maybe they were understaffed that day, but today I returned to find exactly the same scenario.  When we (party of 2) arrived, there was only one person at the front counter ringing people out and no host/hostess. We stood there for about 2 minutes until another patron walked in front of us and signed herself on the sheet. As she was finishing up, someone else walked up and took our names down. We asked if the counter was first-come, first-serve or if you also had to wait for that. The host told us he had to ask the other parties on the list wanted the seats or not first. He never asked anyone and the seats remained empty, along with several other empty 2-person tables. About 10 minutes into our wait, a group of 3 guys came in and sat themselves at the counter. Nobody stopped them or even glanced their way.   When we finally got seated, they seated us and the party before us, which was also a group of 2, in two separate 4-seater tables. There were at least two smaller tables on the other side of the restaurant, and I am certain they were already cleaned, because we watched them clean them. Why seat us in the bigger tables and perpetuate the incredibly long wait this place always seems to have?  The only saving grace of this place is the quality of the food. It is very good. If it wasn't, nobody would wait as long as you have to at this place. However, they need to make some serious changes to the way they send out orders.   When we finally got our food, about 20 minutes after we ordered, neither of our sides were included. They were going to be a few extra minutes. After we had both completed our main breakfast, still no sides. I got chocolate chip pancakes (which are just chocolate chips on TOP of pancakes, by the way) and the other person got toast. When they finally came out, the toast had definitely been sitting out. The first time I came, the situation was exactly the same, but the waiter had apologized and said the kitchen was behind. Understandable, but apparently their kitchen is ALWAYS behind. They seem to need more staff.    All the while, I never got a refill. The table behind us was seated after us, had their order taken before us, had paid, left, and been reseated well before we were able to leave.   This location really needs to learn how to manage their volume. It's never NOT busy. They need to staff accordingly.   Speaking of staff, everyone is very friendly and nice, but it's not enough to make me want to go back when there's Rachel's Kitchen in the same parking lot and a plethora of other breakfast joints just 5 minutes away.

nc1_5yscJuivv9xWL2x5OA.text: BEST BREAKFAST PLACE IN TOWN!!  Great service and great food! Wish their restaurants were just a bit bigger in size.  They would still make a killing!

UwVPzvLCAMwlfnqmisQYkg.text: Alvin was our waiter and he was great! Very kind and attentive. The reason I'm giving it only a 3 stars is because the biscuits & gravy were cold, as if they'd been taken out of the freezer. He took them back and in less than 30 seconds come back with them. The cook just threw more gravy on top, that was still cold. The eggs were raw but the buttermilk pancakes were great. I won't be coming back.

c_T86gNrjfuNBXu4DXjX5w.text: Oh man I don't know why we haven't tried this place a lot sooner! I got the red velvet pancakes and they were fantastic! Our son got a short stack of chocolate chip pancakes and he loved them (the whipped cream tastes homemade and was his favorite part). My husband got the adobo fried rice omelette and a short stack of the cinnamon bun pancakes & he was very impressed. Our food came out quick and fresh. Can't wait to come back and try the Eggs Benedict!

6Mq62nXAWIOa0d5W-34qqw.text: This cafe Has excellent food, the service is amazing, and you can't go wrong with all of the breakfast food to choose from. The wait is a little long but still worth it, a 10/10 recommend for the family to go to on the weekends. The pancakes are absolutely my favorite thing there such a big selection to choose from.

QeTY1KrsYuz4vdQNQ6qPlw.text: My husband and I love going here for breakfast! It's not usually packed when we arrive but by the time we leave it's a very long wait. Food is always good, there's a lot to choose from too..so be prepared to drool over everything on the menu. Great service all the time!

CciKKwqJBvEMqAIhL_gduw.text: When will I learn that red velvet anything is not good. The hash browns where ok but the eggs were bland. They do have good pancakes otherwise.

x5ejVQXK69kpurgLOTtiow.text: Stay away. Worst breakfast ever. Staff is very rude. Very slow service. Would rather eat at McDonald's

lkphQ1foX-nunBgbJAlCjw.text: This Babystacks location is really good for a private breakfast or one-on-one talk in the morning because not a ton of people really go here! Probably because it's just way too far from everyone else! Inside, it was clean, warm&inviting. There was really chill music playing; the atmosphere just gets you in a mood to relax.   Customer service wasn't bad for us, there was no one in there and they sat us down right away and gave us menus. They were a little bit slow walking around, but it wasn't a big deal. Plus, any time I needed something, I made a point to wave to them and they would make their way over! They were all super friendly :D   The food was pretty good, I had the Cookie Butter French Toast. That was absolutely delicious. It was warm, crunchy and perfect. Next time I should bring a banana on the side because it seems like it would go well with it. However, it was super sweet, so if you're eating it, you gotta have a sweet tooth, my friend!! My friend told me to order a side of the Red Velvet Pancakes, and I have to say that I'm really disappointed in them. To me, they don't taste like red velvet and the 'cream cheese' is odd tasting. Maybe I'll order at another location to see if it tastes different, but it was just a really big letdown for it being a famous item.   It was a fun, cheap, and relaxing experience to eat here and I will probably visit again! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. red velvet pancakes :)
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. that cookie butter French toast though..yum yum!

dqYeNqiNoXCBPXMWZt0jlA.text: Had family in town visiting and this was our departure breakfast.  We had a late start so we arrived about 30 minutes before they closed. The place had few tables left from what  I am sure was a busy breakfast service.  I have never been a fan of sweet items for breakfast such as pancakes or waffles so I was hoping for someone else to order one of there delicious choices Babystacks has to offer, and I could sample.  Bacon and eggs is more for me to start my day but I do love a good omelet to start my day.  SO that what I did. A build your own where you could select a cheese, meat and two veggies.  I ended up making a selection that was much like a "Denver Omelet" and try the seasoned potatoes and wheat toast.  this is a meal that will never let me down.  When the meal came out my omelet was a little small for my eyes but it would do the trick.  So with everyone selections I was able to try the crepes which were sweet, fluffy and delicious. I was able to try the s'more's pancakes as well which was more of the same.  Good but too sweet for me.  Next time I hope some one orders the "Red Velvet" pancakes everyone has been raving about.  As for me I might be more adventurous and try the portuguise sausage.  It has been awhile since I have tasted these and if I remember right they were tasty.   After looking on Yelp there are apparently more than one of these places in Vegas.  If you have tried one you have tried them all.  I will probably stay close to home and not seek out the others locs.  No need to burn the gas.  2nd visit   Ordered the Lolo's Adobe fried rice special. This specialty dish is an omlette with shredded chicken and fried rice stuffed inside and garnished with green onions.  The filling with chicken and rice was a little salty for my taste mostly because of the heavy soy sauce marinade of the adobo.   I was also able to try the portuguise sausage this visit.  Not very impressed, it tasted like hills hire farms ring bologna.  I have had homeade portuguise sausage which had a nice spice to it. This had almost no flavor in my opinion.

V0QYTjpIGkJxqoQ2Jrydjg.text: This restaurant is my go-to spot for breakfast with friends and family that are in town visiting! Babystacks has a variety of scrumptious pancakes - we usually make sure everyone gets a different kind so we can all share. It is common for a crowd inside but the food is well worth the wait!   They used to split checks by pairs without issue, but now only split a check in half a single time. When we go to Babystacks with groups larger than 4, that can be quite inconvenient.  Bottom line: the food is delicious, worth the small wait you might experience during a lunch rush, and best enjoyed with 2-4 people in the group.

ScC2YouQ-kCWDSOGl9vvMA.text: Stopped in for quick breakfast. We were seated promptly. Service is good. They have a large selection of pancakes ranging from red velvet to oreo. The portions are large so unless you're very hungry, sharing is a good idea. They are a fan of spam so if you like that,  many choices. It's not a traditional breakfast menu. Has intl flair such as kalbi with eggs,  kahlua benedict, etc. We had the breakfast burrito and it wasn't large compared to the omelettes. Coffee was ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_qLKXSkZU4K0WTqxD3-Ufw.text: I discovered Baby Stacks 2 years ago.  I moved to Minnesota to then realize how much I miss the delicious, mouth watering menu at Baby Stacks The logo they have is really simple and inviting. At this location is big and personable. The staff is friendly and professional. The menu has a nice variety which I'm very fond of.  My favorite item to order here is the Mexican skillet So flavorful.  The potatoes are nicely cubed shaped, which compliments the entire dish. On top of the perfectly golden potatoes cubs is the shredded pork. The shredded pork is  moist, breaks apart simply. Paired with jalapenos, and eggs served on top. On the side fresh Pico and sour cream and a side if buttermilk pancakes.  The hot tea is yummy served with honey.  When its time to pay the bill you go to the front and pay.   I recommend this establishment.

LGRo66nNt2DvbrE-HzwXog.text: The service was good, food was up quick and everything tasted great! The prices aren't bad at all but there are always a ton of kids which isn't exactly what my hubs and I want to hear when we end up there trying to cure a hangover.  The red velvet pancakes are more of a dessert than a breakfast. I like the peanut butter banana pancakes the best. Enjoy!

a0_yIfIS7kERzwW_VGPfvA.text: The person up front taking names needs to pay more attention because we were told it could take up to 30min and an hour past, so I went up there to check and it turns out she "accidentally" skipped my name so I had to wait another 35 min if I decided to stay. I don't know why they couldn't do any accommodations since it was their fault. I just left to another different breakfast restaurant instead.

8t6NjiGvaf6yS_R6wu-J4Q.text: The food is so good here that I get babystacks every time I go to Las Vegas. I got the turkey avocado sandwich (sorry if I didn't say the exact name of the sandwich) and it never disappoints. My usual go to is the carrot cake pancakes but I decided to change it up. The fries don't come with that much seasoning so if you like the flavor you should ask for some extra. The sandwich is fresh and especially good on sourdough toast. The meal comes with a pickle so if that isn't your thing then I suggest you ask them to not include it on your plate. Waiting time to get seated is a little much sometimes usually around 30 minutes but can go over very quickly. Food is served around 15-20 minutes. Worth it though!!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Z2U_juAnfSEKY4gja9PkgQ.text: Love this place! Always busy but worth the wait! Everything on the menu is awesome but my favorite is the Adobo Fried Rice Omelet and the Nutella Crepes! YUM!

Oq7M0Q-P_UZA-tT_R5Fnew.text: This was my first time going here and my last. I called in my order so I could just run in and pick it up. Mistake one. I go in thru the mobs of people there waiting and tell them i have a pickup order. I get a ticket only to wait in another 2 mile long line to pay. Really? Why don't they have a separate line for take out orders? I sat in line for a good 10 min while my foods sitting there getting cold. I get it home and yep was cold and disgusting. Not sure what the rave is on this place but it was first and only time coming here. Maybe its different eating there but I think I'll save the money and go elsewhere.

AyzzlNuLFvUKHFmTnCltpw.text: Loved this breakfast and brunch place!    FOOD:  I ordered the banana cream short stack and mmmm it was so delicious. I got this instead of the regular banana stack because I enjoy having fruit inside my pancakes, not just on top. I am so happy I got this. The custard and whipped cream that they drizzle on top went perfectly with my pancakes. I didn't even need syrup.   SERVICE:  I'm a picky and very indecisive eater but my server was very patient and answered all my questions. He didn't rush me nor did he look annoyed (even though he might have been). :-)  INTERIOR:  Cafe looking set up. Very casual ambience. They have a tv in the corner where they played the World Cup. My boyfriend really enjoyed that.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmm banana cream short stack pancakes and baby chick omelette

oAlPgxEuOJKF_McBw4KNtg.text: Came here on a Tuesday before the crowds and grabbed a spot at the counter. I stayed a while and watched it get busy at lunchtime. The wait staff was friendly, although they stopped checking on me after the first 30 min I was there. It was hard to get my drink refilled!  Spam fried rice with garlic rice was delicious, especially with a little sriracha on the side. The banana cream pie pancakes were to die for! Just about melted in your mouth and wasn't overly sweet.  Will definitely return to try the adobo fried rice and some of their other pancake varietals. But it may only be on a weekday... This place gets packed on the weekend with lines out the door!

QRV5IiRyi9hos5JUCUQNDw.text: I've always heard great things about this place. The first time we came in we waited awhile (as expected) but what threw me off was upon walking in, you literally have to fight to get your name on the wait list. There is no order, no organization, no one there to greet you. The "hostess" is the same person who is running the wait list, seating people and bagging to-go orders. On a busy Saturday/Sunday, that's just not reasonable.   We came in with the whole family this past Saturday. Busy, again, as expected. We were quoted 30-35 minutes for a party of 5 with a highchair. Waited close to 50 minutes. The hostess was not friendly whatsoever and once we were finally seated, argued with my mother-in-law after she requested an extra chair.   I will say, the service afterward was prompt and food was definitely good but just that initial first impression kills it all.  For a place that represents Hawaii - they don't show very much Aloha.

2TmUAovnmKdSD-3c0uPmkQ.text: The food here is unreal! My boyfriend and I popped in on Christmas morning while visiting family and boy we are so glad we did. He had the chili omelette and I had the piglet skillet. The staff was friendly and accommodated all of our special requests. We will be returning anytime we are in town!

p9KN1oqUsyGvPOLfO_xaKg.text: Went for the first time yesterday. The food was excellent and the Portuguese sausage was awesome! Love the choices of pancakes. I highly recommend the Red velvet stack! IHOP better step up their game!

eMfbScGSyEm248Xk0UCGcA.text: Disappointing. I ordered an omelette which was over cooked and dry. I should have sent it back, but unfortunately did not have the time to wait for it to be remade. The host and server were both friendly and efficient. But, since the kitchen thinks it's ok to serve a visibly brown and dried up omelette I will not be eager to return.

BCKGxMdUwDRfyyh7EzBfpg.text: Hi. What's up.  I'll keep this short and sweet. The food is whatever. It's not bad. It's just kind of there. It's breakfast. You want some breakfast? Cool. They have it.   Service? It's also kinda just there. Doing it's own thing. My only beef with this place was being told the wait would be 40 minutes... my friends and I then walked down to the dollar store to kill some time. After about 20 minutes, we returned - just in case they called us early. This home girl at the front was like, "Oh, we called you like 2 minutes after you walked out." Uhhhhhhhhhhh!?!   2 minutes and 40 is kind of a HUGE difference. Only annoying because we then had to wait longer than usual for another table to open up. She then also had a group (same party size) seated before ya despite them having showed up after.  It's chill. I got fed. It was fine. It was 3 stars. K, byeeeee.

cxEj0qCR6Ek1jY29CFaTbQ.text: I had no idea this restaurant was owned by a Filipino family until coming in and seeing adobo, spam, and garlic rice on the menu. I was shocked in the best possible way! They blend Filipino (and Hawaiian?) flavors and favorites into traditional American breakfast items. Very unique.   It's a no-frills with delicious food sort of joint. Very affordable ($8-12 ish) for a huuuge meal. You'll def have baon :-)

5NzxCoM00jQFE9vXbTO60g.text: Been here twice now.  I like it, almost a lot. The service is pretty good.  Big glasses for drinks and really delicious pancakes.  I hated their home style potatoes and will remember to get hash browns.  My husband got the chili moco and he liked it.  I got the country Benedict and I liked it but I hated the country gravy.  It has a really strange sweet flavor that was not good with anything.  Luckily the eggs and biscuit were well made and it made the dish not horrible, I just had to scrape some of the gravy off.  We will probably be back and I'll try some new things to see what I really like.

sCKVOkoX28D1_9vH8p0VsA.text: We come here at least once a week. The food is good. Pan acts are wonderful. The staff is sooo friendly and hospitable. They take such pride in what they do right down to the cleanliness of thier dining room. If you like your eggs with runny yolk order them over easy.

8DjP7sjREzcBv7hFLsT9vw.text: Went to Babystacks the other day for the first time.  I had family in town and they were in the mood for pancakes so we gave it a shot.  The wait time wasn't long, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the food was done right.  I liked the menu options for pancakes especially, and ended up going with some Nutella/whipped cream concoction; which was very good.    The only thing deterring me from giving 5 stars was the lack of options of what to have with my pancakes.  I was really hoping for a milkshake or cappuccino, but the only coffee option was coffee and cream.

8tBFCrjVG2nRHjYD-snFow.text: I ordered take out and to my surprise the cashier asked "would you like to add tip" i was stunned..tip? For what? I think its kind of inappropriate to ask for tip for a take out order. And the food portion is small now for the price...wont be back...

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H4byCNk5wJ91WLnnuNT2oA.text: Planned to have just normal lazy Friday all American breakfast but wow! Menu selections are fantastic. I have to really make a hard decision. End up with Lolo Rick's Adobo Fried Rice Omelette and the unwrapped version. (See photos). This is shredded adobo chicken meat. It's super delicious. Option sides are seasoned potatoes, hash browns or pancakes.  Great customer service, friendly & attentive.

-_c3U97SsrvjBIMzB-5XUQ.text: Service was slow to non existent.  Pancakes were rubbery, hash browns under cooked and watery. Over all not a great experience. Asked for more syrup, it never arrived. Asked to speak with a manager, after walking around for two minutes the host brings up our server, who says she was the manager, when I complained about not receiving the syrup she just said " I dont recall you asking for any, sorry". That was it. Will not be going there anytime soon. For being as crowded as it was I thought " we hit the jackpot , new breakfast joint" . Boy was I wrong.

xWLQLW0yFDSqVX0abrJ3sA.text: My go to breakfast place when we have guests in town. I love the island menu and it makes us feel at home. My favorites are the different flavor options of pancakes. Did you know you can substitute a pancake in your meal ... now you do! You're welcome! The only thing that keeps me away is the long wait. They don't take advance reservations and your WHOLE party has to be present before they seat you. We go prepared.

1vhg-Hpp7Ez3k3OO2BvB2A.text: Be sure to check out their specials menu on the board as you walk in. I got their Matcha Green Tea pancakes (special) and they were out of this world! Almost licked my plate! Strong match flavor, which I enjoy!!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Matcha Green Tea Pancakes (on special)

tBWpI1yIyhqGrZZZdPNqwQ.text: Pretty good food. Has one bathroom each for men and women clean.  Seating took some time but worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lola&#39;s Adobe

Rw8BCd6B7_mUBaAlQUfXsw.text: Randomly came across this place, after having seen and heard about it from friends, after our child's soccer class Sunday morning... we were informed of a roughly 20-30 minute wait, which was about what we expected for a Sunday at about noon. They actually sat us within 15 minutes, so I really have no complaints there.   The service was good, attentive and responsive. Definitely busy, but again, expected for a Sunday afternoon.  Having no expectations for what they would have on their menu (other than pancakes), I was pleasantly surprised by their offerings. Essentially any kind of pancake and topping you wanted, crepe or French toast as well. We ended up getting lemon ricotta pancakes, hazelnut pancakes, and something on the other side of the menu that tugged at my little Filipina heart strings, Lolo's Adobo Fried Rice Omelete: chicken adobo, fried rice, all inside an omelete.   The Lemon Ricotta was soft and subtle - the lemon flavor rather eases its way in like an aftertaste, but was not as robust as I would have expected. The Hazelnut was what my Nutella-loving heart was after: Nutella, whipped cream, and crushed hazelnuts, which added a terrific crunchy texture to the mix. I additionally added bananas, which I highly recommend for a balanced sweetness.   The Adobo Rice Omelet: it brought me home. It felt like a home-cooled meal that my mom would have made me, and I was so glad to have stumbled across it. I honestly didn't need the potatoes that came on the side.   Overall, portion sizes were huge, decent service, good prices, good and varied selection sure to make each member of your party happy.

fTOMPK7LwutRujwZmq5Mkg.text: Yum!   Every kind of pancake flavor you could want, but the food is good, too.   The place is PACKED on the weekends, so plan ahead and get there before you are starving, as you are almost guaranteed to have a wait. During the week, is pretty low key and the place to be.   Come hungry, and leave happy.

tnoxp6H1f4yGuyf0wfztzg.text: So good. The kalbi beef with the garlic rice is amazing and their red velvet pancakes are to die for. Even when they're super busy, the service is still great and everyone is so friendly.

0sHsnJSbzRNQ5H30MwzgTg.text: Food was okay, could have been hot - not lukewarm.  Busy place and this could explain service delay but overall, service was good.  Not sure if food quality would warrant another visit.

vf8Vg0MP8cmJm64s-5H64w.text: We weren't very impressed with this place. We were hoping for some good breakfast but what we ordered wasn't very good. We ordered the Ranchero Skillet and Kalua Pig Benedict. Both just didn't have very good flavor and didn't give us that wow factor. Pretty disappointed with the great reviews we read.

tafuvsX5QLH6hZWQd-l-fQ.text: So fast forward and the wife and I go to the Durango location a few dats ago cause when the food is on it's great but this time the service was a fail!! Epic fail on training your people. I'll be back one day once I'm over it but please get your training better fir your servers to read and see if a customer isn't happy so they can go that extra step to make the experience the best!!!

VGCqfxHgrv7U5dvrAPlWMA.text: My fav place to go! Great customer service food is on point every time!!!   They have a variety of brunch food and a variety of pancakes too!   The crepes are also delicious  can't go wrong.

mZCuBBJ82OGsKx4xNYD_YA.text: I was so excited for this place and it let me down. I ordered the chili omelet, but was expecting hearty, homemade chili. I don't think that's what I got...I'm pretty sure it was chili out of a can and it would take a lot to convince me otherwise LOL. And if it was in face homemade, then maybe try a different recipe because it was extremely bland and for that reason I didn't finish it all. I tried adding salt and hot sauce and nothing helped. It was also a bit cold, so. Maybe I will try this place again and get something else but in the meantime, two stars.

NyRh6KBsfgvGU8Zj-P-amg.text: We came here for breakfast and noticed they had Loco Moco on their menu, I love Loco Moco!!! (hamburger above rice, egg, and smothered in gravy) and it was disgusting. It honestly tasted like powdered eggs, over hard rice and an AMPM frozen burger patty. They skimped on the gravy and it wasn't the right type of gravy. If you're going to offer it on the menu then cook it right. We also got pancakes eggs and bacon and that came out decent. Still waiting for a exceptional breakfast spot in the area

bAKJVLZSfFBib46csLjHMg.text: Nice local place for breakfast. They have some yummy pancakes here. Love that they're from Hawaii too. They definitely show you much aloha.

7bM7y0gQLc_NNxRdUrTzHg.text: First time here with hubby and it's one of the best breakfast we had. We ordered the adobo fried rice and the skillet chicken (it had spinach, potato, cheese, herbs) both dish was amazing! Recommended and the staff is so nice..

c7ByBStn4L9dnzcTSmxV2A.text: Hawaiian style breakfast. Spam and eggs, spam sliders. Not bad at all. Don't come with groups larger than 4. There is only one table for groups 4+ and they will sit everybody else before that one table clears.

xnveFOCP0ay0x2ShrX1iTA.text: I have been coming to babystacks for the past 6 years. Recently babystacks made a change in policy where you cannot split checks. I can't begin to explain the inconvenience this caused the party I was with. On top of that, I drive 25 minutes to this location because I've always had a good experience and the food is great. But another reason is because it is military friendly. Today Krissy told my entire military party that she couldn't give us military discount because they had already gave us our check, although we hadn't even paid yet. I'm not looking for a handout but I will always support a small business, especially if they're military friendly. Not splitting our check is inconvenient and annoying, but to then deny military discount because we didn't announce we were military before ordering food is absolutely absurd. Again, I have been coming to various Las Vegas babystacks locations, but this was the last time and I will not return again.

_o7By5j4RqMJaxj0CQdfQg.text: We enjoyed a Saturday morning breakfast here. The blueberry pancakes were simple and DELICIOUS! My boyfriend enjoyed the S'mores pancakes as well. The service was great! Our server was so friendly. And multiple employees came by repeatedly and offered to refill our coffees. It was very nice.

BXPTUkaPEzYHajOPH9eTJQ.text: Been here several times with the family. Red Velvet pancakes are the best! You usually have to wait 20-40 minutes, but it's worth the wait. I highly recommend eating here. It's clean and has friendly staff!

-W-BLDhwBrYoTc0OuZnwhg.text: Great food, fantastic service. Good prices. Hard for me to recommend places so highly, but I have got to say we will swing in here anytime we come visit the in laws.

SNwgixVKeOBCyFkYWjaEcA.text: Terrible gravy, eggs are no Bueno, this place needs to be cleaned and douched. Waiters are very forgetful. Probably won't be eating here anytime soon. Waitress was very nice. However, her hair was in her face. And they all look sloppy.

WdrZe4aUO6CAMv36uRO2WA.text: It was good food, it was great service, really fast even thought they were slammed.  I think this place is good but I wouldn't pick it out to go again when there are other places in Vegas that are MUCH better.  Nothing wrong with this place, just nothing really stood out.

3-E4d6qx8Bfam7jgUlgsVQ.text: Absolutely fabulous we loved every bite everybody should try this place and we will be back thank you so much

AVLoznsbSLJ3rm5Tc4547A.text: We walked in the morning and were immediately sat. The service is amazing! Austin was very attentive and quick. We ordered the Mexican skillet and Lolo Rick's Adobo Fried Rice! Absolutely amazing and will be back for more! Highly recommend.

EyCYWfoFSwW-Or4xdG86cA.text: Great combination of flavored pancakes and hawaiian/filipino fusion comfort food like adobo fried rice. You better try the red velvet pancake as it is their best pancake with their signature sauce. Short stacks comes with 3 smaller pancakes.  Egg benedicts with hawaiian flavors like kalua pig will be on my list to order next time. Adobo fried rice wrapped in egg is huge for those who have big appetite.

vKUf86L1scRTScBvwzYa3g.text: I ordered ahead for pick up the first time I was put on hold for 10 minutes and nobody picked up!!! I hung up and called a second time and finally got some service put my order in and they said it would be about 30-35 minutes!!!! Totally understandable... I live about 20 minutes away anyway showed up and they didn't even put my order in or nothing!!!! It's like they didn't even care or anything!!! Never going back there again!!! Didn't even offer me a free meal or anything for there mess up!!!

mGtJiPGBW4PjAu8cmw4q0Q.text: Friendly service and big menu. The bacon pancakes were great. They top up the coffee regularly and have a creative menu. Would definitely go back.

ul3I0_ia90BYXvQ41GCB2g.text: This is my favorite breakfast place. Their red velvet pancakes are amazing! I can't believe some people don't like them. I also love their seasoned potatoes. Everyone always complains about the wait time. Expect to wait on the weekends unless you go right at 7 which is what  I ALWAYS do. I always go early , like right at 7 and never have a problem. It is over priced but I'm willing to pay for it just because the pancakes are so good. I don't even live in Las Vegas but when I come I always go to baby stacks.

Yt3JMWV0x9TwmyajEIiE0Q.text: I am a Big fan of this place.  Love the steak and eggs with a side of the custom pancakes; favorites are bacon, cinnabun, cream sicle and lately the German chocolate pancakes.  Also try the garlic rice side instead of potatoes.

ogljdoztpHBVjHRn8UJ07Q.text: Love this place! Get there early or be prepared to wait. It's small, so seating is limited but it's worth the wait. I have never had anything bad there, and the service is always great! We go every couple of weeks, it's the only place we go for breakfast!

A6ldtUPTqyy9JTgYdlgxGg.text: Has the ranchero omelette and it was awesome!! The wife had the country fried steak and was one of the best I've had. Will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Me and Sammy

ffhoku9vE-zOYjVGdwg13Q.text: My order was prepared wrong so they took it of the bill, but then still charged me for the side that was supposed to be part of my meal. I find that tacky. They should take the time to get my order right the first time and then at least make it right when they don't. They do have a great menu, if only they could just prepare as requested.

ipDTUQYjsgM90FgaImrmQg.text: This place DEFINITELY lives up to all the hype. The food was amazing, the service was amazing. We had Felicia and she was so incredible! My husband and I had been kind of avoiding this place cause it's always pretty busy, but I'm glad we stopped in today. Highly recommend going here and they offer a military discount!

GOyfNB0Bd8k99_e-EIBdEA.text: We have been here a bunch of times and each time has been a wait. Waiting is understandable. I mean, if it's busy...it's busy. One can't control the wait.   The bad part about waiting and waiting is...you'd expect your food to be spectacular. So sorry, but it isn't. They do have a spectacular option for pancakes. I won't lie...I sure love their banana fosters. However, it is what it is. Nothing spectacular. You got your bananas...you got your foster. Lol.  The lolo Rick's adobo fried rice has failed us each time only reason we've been back a few times and ordered the same thing each time is because we were hoping each experience was a fluke due to the business. Dry, bland, and the distribution into the omelette seemed poorly executed. At the beginning of the omelette it's all rice then when you get to the end then out comes the meat.   Kids order typical.spam and eggs so nothing much to review because it is what it is. Spam...and eggs.  They don't seat you unless your entire party is present. So even if you're waiting on just 1 person, sorry...keep on waiting and watch all the people who have come way after you being seated to then having to wait for a table to open once your 1 person arrives.   Overall, I think this place is highly over-rated. However, I would.pick this place over an Ihop or Dennys hands-down despite cheaper options on said restaurants. But since we aren't much of eating out for breakfast kine of fam anyway, it isn't a type of place we'd become frequent customers regardless. It has to be something really spectacular to turn us into breakfast folks. Service has also been slow. Slow for refill, slow to even ask for our drinks, slow to order, just slow.  It is a great option to have this place up in the Northwest for those who are into breakfast menus, though.  Definitely kid friendly but because this place is always filled up and the lobby can get congested....skip the stroller. Enjoy!

wWbIVYDtJuJoytsFBhLFKw.text: It's a long wait and they're only open for a few hours but the food there is sooo good. They have many different types of pancake flavors. Red velvet is a must try! I always get the chicken adobo fried ride so good!  it makes me feel like I'm back home in Hawaii. :)

3wdNE_Nb_T4rWcSSHNW77Q.text: Worse! Food! EVER!!!! The wait staff is ok but the food is probably the worst food I've had since living in Vegas. I tried giving them a "second" chance at another location but I was still disappointed! (My entire party was disappointed) someone even asked "whoever recommended this place can not choose breakfast for a loooong time for choosing this place!!!!!!" Go if you've been starving other than that there's IHOP or even McDonald's is better!

1sMYF3gFRgm41G0Ue47ymg.text: A really good place for early morning breakfast. We got there around 7:30am craving breakfast food.   HIS & HERs: We had random cravings so we ordered a few things to share. We ordered the WHITE CHOCOLATE MACADAMIA NUT PANCAKES, the ADOBO FRIED RICE OMLETTE, & the CHICKEN SKILLET w/ a side of CINNABON PANCAKES. We're fat, I know.  Everything was extremely good... My only qualm was that there weren't really white chocolate chips infused into the pancakes. Previously we ordered the red velvet pancakes, which were perfectly infused and I still highly recommend! The adobo fried rice was also really rich and satisfying. Wasn't too fond of the skillet personally... not as flavorful, but wasn't bad. And if you're into it, they also have sugar free syrup, which we were really happy about! Overall, definitely will return when we have an early morning sweet tooth! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobo fried rice omelette with hash browns, and white chocolate chip macadamia but pancakes!

SL7pe6ODjNLLJxJ0GNki3A.text: Each time I'm visiting Vegas, I always stop by BabyStacks! It's one of my favorite breakfast spots here. Inside it's homey with a family feel, and service is always great. I usually have to wait a bit each time I visit though, at most half an hour.   The red velvet pancakes are the best I've ever had- nothing else comes close! It's not super sweet, and there are chocolate chips in the pancake itself, and the cream cheese drizzled on top isn't sweet either. They're perfectly moist as well.  If you're hungry, the chicken adobo fired rice wrapped in an egg is also bomb too. It's pretty heavy though, so you may go into a food coma afterwards haha.   Last time I was here I got the steak and eggs, opting for the garlic fried rice. Just a forewarning- they don't go easy on the garlic here! It was satisfying until the last bite.  I'll be seeing you guys on my next Vegas trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes, chicken adobo fried rice

JCuKpzlGoODZEkWlX8BmSw.text: YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(129/365) "Babystacks #3"  Checked out this spot which is in our hood and seems like this location has consistency issues. Luckily for us, we didn't run into any issues with our orders. Babystacks is known for having Hawaiian style breakfast items influenced by a well known spot on Oahu, and If I see comfort foods like Adobo Fried Rice Omelette, and Loco Moco, You better believe that's what I'm goin' for!  Our server Mike (who was also one of the managers) was great the whole time, offering suggestions, checking up on us constantly, and even took some time to chat with us and even after our meal, invited us back to try the Cookie Butter French Toast, one of his personal favorites, Which I've already made at home a few times...;)  Wifey ordered the Hawaiian Style Breakfast Sliders with Portuguese sausage, eggs, and cheese on Hawaiian sweet rolls and added on Bacon Pancakes with maple Syrup and I decided to go with the Loco Moco with a side of their popular Red Velvet Pancakes. They also had a Kalua Pig Benedict which sounded good but when it comes to anything benedict, I just do it up at home, because I have come to the conclusion that no one here knows how to perfectly poach an egg! (at least in all of my breakfast experiences here)  Wifey enjoyed her sliders and I thought my Loco Moco was pretty good. Both the Bacon and Red Velvet Pancakes were delicious, But my faves are still Du-Pars and the Sweet Cream Pancakes at 50's Diner. Wecome to the neighborhood Babystacks!  ALOHA!!!  Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/   \uuu/  4

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Podagee Sausage,  Eggs and Rice with a side of Red Velvet Pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Adobo Fried Rice Omelette
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside

oqFDxYIkGzmaCOFBkfnjMw.text: Love their breaskfast.   I could eat everyday here since is just less than a mile from my house.  They're  pancakes are divine .  When we have bras fast here we prefer to go on weekdays ,  weekends are just too full maybe an hour or more wait.

BDh8cSY8ECl-fNYsS871lw.text: Love me some Babystacks! You might have guessed what their specialty is by now. You got it.. It's their cakes'. Let me tell ya---they're slap your momma good! There are more than a dozen of cakes' to pick from. Options include: Red Velvet, Rocky Road, Chocolate Chip, Bacon (yup, you heard that right), and lemon ricotta (Lemon Ricotta is my absolute favorite). If cakes' aren't your thing, they offer other items like skillets (layers of potatoes, cheese, eggs and other toppings) , specialty items that feature SPAM, Garlic Rice, Portuguese Sausage, or Kalua Pig Benedict (another personal favorite).  Service at this location has always been great. The atmosphere is nothing fancy. However, their fresh cakes' and local ambience hits the mark in my book.  Warning:  Even though this location is larger than the one in Summerlin, expect to wait on the weekends (even if you arrive at a reasonable time for breakfast). The wait will be worth it and I'm betting you'll return again to try another one of their specialties.
