Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs and potatoes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. TV for Sunday football fans

AqQnIQtF-APUiGmIEf0JXA.text: Great place when you go there will be a wait I have never got lucky in no wait but love there pancakes especially the bacon pancakes

qgnA29_Gn_x3tXvUbmTUVw.text: Best Pancakes in town. Expect a 15-30 min wait time, worth every minute. The other options besides pancakes are just as good.

-FkHVOoTflL-LdfKHGMuyQ.text: Expect a bit of a wait, no matter what day or time you arrive for breakfast, brunch or lunch. This diner is popular with locals and tourists alike because their pancakes are da serious bomb and they have a globally-diverse menu.  It took us quite a while to make our decision as there were a number of menu options. If you're from the Islands of Hawaii, you'll enjoy the island spin on some of their offerings (the loco moco, Portuguese sausage, spam, rice, etc.).  This sunny morning prompted us to order Mexican huevos rancheros and Korean kalbi ribs with eggs and rice, with bottomless cups of steaming coffee.  Hubby remarked that the huevos rancheros were some of the best he's had over the years (and he's finicky about those)--he said the tortilla was crispy, carnitas well seasoned, eggs cooked perfectly and it all melded together into one tasty dish. The eggs on my kalbi dish were also prepped as ordered, the generous scoop of rice was topped with furikake seasoning and the kalbi had a nice easy  flavor, although a little too chewy for my jaws (dang that gristle). That still didn't deter me from finishing it. My dish came with a side of their short stack (which we upgraded to the scrumptious banana pancakes sprinkled with pecans). Lot of food for breakfast, but since it was the stick-to-your-ribs type of meal, it carried us through late afternoon before we were hungry again.  I'd been wanting to try this location and it sure delivered with tasty food and good, attentive service.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi beef ribs with over easy eggs, generous scoop of hot rice with furikake seasoning.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos rancheros, crispy tortilla and eggs to perfection.

m6qqfS0hIiM9QLFBipgJtQ.text: Babystacks is where its at and is by far the best place for breakfast on a sunday. The worst part is everyone knows it and its long waits to get food But the wait is well worth it because the food is awesome

TYyhtpsyQvENlYSImfJhbA.text: Wow after trying the well known red velvet pancakes here I can officially die a happy woman. I am not normally a sweet tooth kind of gal but holy moly these pancakes had me at first bite! They were so so yummy. They were moist and perfectly sweetened. You didn't even have to use the cheese cake frosting on the side.We also tried the Oreo pancakes they were also very delicious and moist but the red velvet is where its at.  Now the normal breakfast omelettes, eggs, skillets, bacon, sausage, etc. is your typically breakfast nothing too special. I got the scrambled eggs and the corned beef hash. The eggs were good, could have made similar at home but the corned beef hash was wayyyy to salty. I took a few bites and then couldn't finish them, yuck.  This place is well worth it if your coming for pancakes but be prepared for a wait. Oh and they won't seat you unless your full party is there. I will come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes, over medium eggs, and corned beef hash.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oreo pancakes, Little piglet omelette, and potatoes.

WS0Ih2pUyO8Wn4x3zreu9A.text: I used to love this place until today, my cup of cocoa had a hair on it l, and I asked the waitress to please change it in a very nice a polite way, and what she did was roll her eyes at me and walked away without even let me finish My sentence. I wish I know that lady's name to tell her manager about her behavior. We walked out and will never be back there again.

OvxoZNEwEBc0jxbOh8Jv1Q.text: It's such a treat to have a Babystacks on the Northwest side of town! Definitely is it one of the best dining options there is in the area.   Baby Chick (Skillet) $9.50 - Mmm-mmm! This is one tasty skillet that has mushrooms, chicken, spinach, and cheese. On top of all that are two eggs cooked anyway you want -- I ordered mine sunny side up, which would've been perfect with some rice on the side. Originally, this comes with potatoes, but I skipped that and saved my carb intake for the pancakes.  The skillet is also served with a side of two buttermilk pancakes, but I requested the Red Velvet pancakes instead -- always a good choice!  Service - We didn't experience any wait time, but the cafe does get busy in the AM. Best to come here early if you want a seat. Even though it was busy, our waiter did a good job taking care of our table.   Overall - Babystacks Cafe is a great place to sit down and enjoy a filling breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baby Chick.

w9io5rzqjXYTMmsKPwFESQ.text: Love that Spam is used in a lot of the menu items!! Loved the Spam sliders. I also enjoyed the Spam breakfast burrito! Loved the rice or macaroni salad option too. So glad we discovered this place. We will be back.

8zpevdqiUms9gQVzzeohoA.text: Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day, and this place does it the best! This place is always packed by 10 am on the weekends. One time we had to go someplace else for breakfast because it would have been a 40 min wait. I'd say it's worth the wait, but eat a snack before hand!   I went here with a friend and got the Cowboy omelet which was amazing. The eggs were cooked just right without being too dry. The cheese was melted perfectly and everything inside the omelet was cooked well. I also got a side of the red velvet pancakes which took longer to come out. It was worth the wait though because once it came out, I couldn't put the fork down! I looove red velvet and these pancakes lives up to its name. It was soft and fluffy and not too sweet. I was given a side of sweet cream cheese glaze which wasn't overpoweringly sweet like some can be.   Our waiter was very friendly and would keep me updated on my pancakes to let me know that I'm not forgotten. She was very patient with us as we kept asking for a couple of minutes to think about our order as well as catching up. She also knew the menu well and suggested some of her favorites as well as customer's top choices. The restaurant itself felt like most breakfast places, which makes it feel homey.   I will definitely plan to come back when I visit Vegas! I really want to try their Hawaiian dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cowboy omelette. SOO GOOD!

bZgsRxubcZZ_0PI0v2WZiQ.text: Came in to show my sister what I thought was going to be an amazing breakfast. She's visiting me from Hawaii so figured she would like it here. First she ordered scrambled eggs (shelled eggs) we for egg mix from a carton. So then we decided to ask for over hard since they wouldn't give us fresh eggs. Well guess they don't like it when they are proven wrong. So they burnt our eggs. Our potatoes were so hard that my kids couldn't and wouldn't eat them. Ive been in the industry for many years. The server decided to question me and tell me that I was wrong and they were using shelled eggs. Right!! Especially with that bright yellow color on the eggs.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. By burnt eggs.

DPsANEB8hqUxWihvwodSMw.text: Service (several days ago) started out so unfriendly that I felt as if my presence was a bother to our waitress.  She rounded our table so quickly when taking our order, I felt as if I was at an auction of some sort.  I asked her what the WiFi password was and she told me "I don't know, go ask the people at the front"??!  Okaaaay, let me just do your job for you.  So, after standing in line for some time, I asked for the password which isn't a secret and is literally posted on the cashier stand for everyone to see.  On top of that, it is the easiest word to remember - breakfast.  AND, the cashier was kinda unfriendly too!!  Really dude?  Ever heard the phrase, treat others the way you want to be treated?  I appreciate friendliness just like you probably do.   However, something must have happened after that.  Maybe the manager could see I was ticked because different staff started helping us, and I didn't see the original waitress until we were about finished.  At that time, she seemed to have gotten the stick out.    Food is pretty darn tasty though, so that's a plus... So, just appreciate the good service if/when you get it.  There are at least 2 good employees vs the 2 bad employees that we had the pleasure/displeasure of dealing with that day.

fZPflJmIl7oCb4Qk06tE0A.text: Today I was in a hurry (what's new) I stopped in to grab some breakfast.   I told my waiter "Santos" I was in a hurry had 30 min to order, eat, pay the bill and get to appointment around the corner.    Santos  Was wonderful.  I ordered vehicle skillet coffee cream honey and the pancakes that came with.    He put the order in, zipped me my coffee, breakfast came quickly, he took my card to the cashier so I could eat my breakfast and cleared my tab for me.  He brought me the receipt and checked several times before I had to go if I was ok.   I tipped him and thanked him for taking good care of me.  Breakfast was also delish.     It was wonderful to have someone take of me when I was in a hurry.  I'm not their only customer  Again thanks a lot for everything.

LdRoHq2CtawNo3-CLq3ZYg.text: If you love "designer" pancakes come to this restaurant.  All manner of sweet treats heaped on pancakes.  My friend loves their Bananas Foster pancakes.  I am more traditional.  If you are going to have egg dishes on your menu you should know how to cook and serve them.  The country biscuits sounded very good.  If you like tan flour gravy with a few sausage lumps served over biscuits so hard you need a steak knife to cut them, you'll love this dish.  It was not hot, the gravy had a "skin" on it.  The seasoned potatoes were diced and smothered In Paprika.  I'm not sure they know what seasoned potatoes are.  This dish was mediocre at best.  The price wasn't.    The service left much to be desired.  They smiled through their incompetence.    If you want fancy pancakes eat at Baby Stacks.  If you want breakfast, go somewhere else.  A frozen egg would be tastier.

Idxn7IQ1JQWrKpHQaifgvg.text: Our server was amazing, very attentive and pleasant. I probably would have ordered something different next time. I had the corn beef has and it was a little salty for my taste buds. I also had a side of macadamia white chocolate pancakes. I would have liked the white chocolate morsals to be melted instead of whole pieces. But the pancake itself tasted fine.   My hubby had Hawaiian bene and he said it was a bit to saucy with small portions. He also had the coconut pineapple pancake but the syrup provided was not regular syrup and was too sweet.   May come back to try something else.

Ef2WK2bEdNX7qa8Wh7-Kxg.text: Great service was my first happy spot. Good sized portions and a good price. Then you eat and it's delicious. I got the BLT and it's one of the best I've had. Not stingy with the B at all. My cousin was with me and devoured his pancakes and breakfast plate. Big surprise was how yummy the Portuguese sausage was, it's like an extra yummy smoked sausage cooked perfectly with crispy edges. Definitely a great breakfast or brunch spot

h7ezRfatd0MAwsWjKfLERw.text: Great food! Great service! Delicious is an understatement. My go to comfort breakfast is Adobo Fried Rice Omelette or Portuguese Sausage. Pancakes are always to die for. Skillets and crepes are out

Qsy31TR_mSfpiElkA70umA.text: I love Babystacks!   I've surprised (and a little embarrassed) to read my review from 4 years ago, but yep! I've been having breakfast/brunch here since that day.  I came here with my family (party of 6) and there was a bit of a wait... 30 minutes. It wasn't that bad, though! They were going down the waiting list pretty quickly. Plus, it was nice to spend sometime in this summer sun (no sarcasm intended. Today was a really cool summer day in June).  Before we knew it, it was our time! We our server was Allie, and she was the sweetest! She was exceptional and very quick, and the other staff was very nice as well. She took our drink orders very soon after we were seated. Shortly after, she took our orders and was very patient with us. My family was visiting from the Bay Area, and didn't know you can upgrade your Babystacks to a flavored pancake until the minute it was time to order.   My mom and I ordered the Pork Belly Tocino and eggs. It was pretty good. Homemade I'm assuming. I was excepting that bright red, sweet, and slightly charred Tocino. I've been craving! Sorry, it was good but not good enough to satisfy my Tocino craving. My mom was thrown off, too. LOL  My brother ordered the Country Fried Steak and Eggs, and he's a picky eater but damn, he cleaned his plate! Guess it was good!  My husband and I think my dad ordered the Corned Beef Hash and it looked bomb. They changed it from what I remember. Before it was the fresh corned beef hash and this time it was canned corn beef (wish I prefer).  My sister ordered one of the crepes. I always thought the crepes weren't enough to make me full, but the serving was big enough for two!  Service is always great here.   You'll always have us coming back!

uBIvUEhHOftt48fetFF16Q.text: I wish I had looked into this place earlier because I see it all the time but didn't know it had Hawaiian style breakfast! I ordered the Kalua pig eggs Benedict and it took me right back to cinnamons over in Kailua. It was SOOO good! I'll definitely be back

Rs27VsSwl9j4Evkz58WBTg.text: I love it here!  Friendly and quick service, meals come out fast, and everything tasty.  We had two skillets today, the Huntington and the HM1.  Both were delicious as they came with great flavor, eggs cooked to order, cheese, and two buttermilk pancakes.  Even though it was closer to lunchtime, you can't go wrong with a great breakfast.  It was busy, but everything and everyone made it look like a well oiled machine.  Now that I know that weekdays aren't as crazy as weekends, I know when to return.

IsTUDk-d5cyxAiU8aE2RdQ.text: This is a decent little cafe. I ordered the chicken fried steak. It wasn't bad but the gravy could be better. Overall it is a nice cafe. I enjoy the pancakes they aren't like most these ones are heavier than they are light.

0VfnHvgePCU22LEl9dzEgA.text: Love pancakes?  Then this is the place for you. They have everything you can think of when it comes to pancakes. Fruits, sweets, or traditional buttermilk are all here. If pancakes aren't your jam, not to worry. They have a wide variety of breakfast foods as well. I fall into this category, so I went with the steak and eggs. The steak was good, the eggs were perfectly over easy, and the breakfast potatoes were just yum. The sourdough toast was toasted perfectly where it wasn't too hard and destroyed my mouth. Crisp outside with a tender inside. Excellent job. The wait staff was friendly and were sure to keep you happy even when it was busy. Overall a great place for breakfast when you just don't feel like making it yourself. Make sure to get there early though because you may have to wait a little bit when it gets busy, especially on long or holiday weekends.

jEJcPRNUtsB9WW3ZZsSHJg.text: The service here is TERRIBLE!!! The food is amazing but the service is horrible! I've waited over 10 mins on hold for pick up orders multiple times.   One time, I was given the wrong order and was not compensated for the error. (I was told it was my fault for not noticing the error before leaving) The manager is not friendly or accommodating. It's a shame they have an opportunity to be an impactful community spot with great food but they fail to seize that opportunity. Shame.

YI3fermT6uRm7KsTgsEl0Q.text: I love Babystacks.. We primarily do take-out since the wait times are usually about half an hour or longer if you come during peak hours (especially on the weekends).  Love the adobo omelette (pour some soy sauce on top), loco moco (with an over easy egg), cookie butter french toast, banana foster pancakes are my absolute favorite.   They only have one register so the wait to pay can take long. The longest I've waited was 15 minutes behind 2 people. The first party was splitting checks and it was incorrectly split which took a while for them to figure it out.   Otherwise, great brunch spot!

i-V1koNxVEzfCqyfzkLuPg.text: Stopped by here while I was in the area and so glad that we did!   Came on a Saturday about mid morning, and place started getting packed shortly after.   Food: -red velvet pancakes: so good with the sauce that goes with it!  -sweet cream crepes with strawberries: delicious! -omelette with chicken, mushrooms, spinach: was just ok. -breakfast potatoes: ok -hash browns: ok Didn't think much of the potatoes or hash browns  Service: -staff is nice and friendly   Definitely recommend coming here!

jvyB944OLDQv-00dpTs_pg.text: We have Never been to this location.. there is another location in Vegas (Buffalo) and It was equally awesome there. A little smaller on the inside, but yielded 5 star service.  We came for the pancakes today.. can you say Amazing!!  We got the Red Velvet Babystacks as well as the Hazelnut Strawberry Babystacks  which also included my favorite Nutella drizzle   Josh was minimally interruptive, yet very attentive to all of our needs to ensure the optimal breakfast experience.  It was rather cold inside, which slightly took away from the warm and toasty indoor expectation, granted it was already very cold outdoors.

pfsYur-irEjkvh06eMnbsw.text: Excellent breakfast! If you love pancakes, you've got to try this place. Definitely a place to go if you are a pancake connoisseur. They have so many different types of "babystacks," from traditional to red velvet to cookies and cream to banana foster.. and that just scratches the surface. They are one of the few places to serve crepes, and the nutella crepes we're amazing. They also have a variety of traditional breakfast options, omlettes, skillets, and much more. They offer some unique Filipino choices, which I will definitely try next time.   Our waitress took great care of me, my wife and three kids. The service was quick and timely and the food came out hot. They offer a military discount as well! It gets really busy on the weekends, so if you go, get there early! They have quite a few locations in the valley, so definitely give this place a visit.

bZi5Ok7W3htYdjVQMJoEGg.text: Just was in here at this babystack.... Reason for one star is due to had hair in my local Moco and not one manager came out to talked to me! Never coming back to this place! Sucks sucks no I have to go some where else for breakfast

PbcyxZG4K7muURtIds9wNA.text: Worst babystacks experience I have had ever! I dined in at this location on 7/23/19 along with two other people. I only give it a 2 stars because we were seated almost immediately. When I sat down, I started to feel itchy. I just thought it was bread crumbs or something left on the booth that I was in. I kept wiping down the booth underneath my legs. I felt uncomfortable pretty much the whole time I was there. Towards the end of my meal, I kept feeling the itchy feeling. I wiped the area on my leg where I felt what I wish were breadcrumbs, and I got 6 red ants on my hand. I immediately stood up and looked at the booth I was sitting in and there were ants all over it. When I stood up, I saw ants all over the bottom of the table, the booth, and the floor. No place should be open if there are ants in it. When I paid my bill, I told the lady at the register what had happened and she said she would tell the busser to clean the booth good. I would have talked to the manager, but I was so in awe of what had just happened, and I had to go to the store and spend $10 on Benadryl gel for the ant bites because it was so itchy. Here are some photos of the bites when I first got them and today.

Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e1RA-TMa3vkMJV8C8CvWBw.text: I always love coming to babystacks! The service is always great and the food is delicious. Do your self a favor and eat here!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry short stack

DCUr3v2sjMYzCE2yNTfgKQ.text: A good Breakfast spot if you like eggs omelettes and pancakes. Skillets are great and they have plenty of delicious pancake options.

elbZW9Fh1KEQCuFWpRHXJg.text: Amazingggggg breakfast spot! Two egg breakfast with a side of banana foster pancakes! Amazing food and amazing service!

Xj7BVyGhRCONcDGXlMbATQ.text: Great breakfast food here. Usually always busy but service is pretty quick. They have a lot of different pancakes to choose from and their piglet skillet is great (potatoes, eggs, ham, and bacon)

pJDuWtUVfWC2WU9SSIKqYA.text: Everyone knows no matter how awsome the food is, service is what makes or breaks a business.  Ummm, everyone except Babystacks Cafe that is. Yes, the food is great. Had the honey toast (french toast), which was proportioned just right. Expect to wait, wait, wait....and wait for every aspect of dining out. Seating, beverage service, ordering to receiving your meal is Extremely frustrating! especially when the staff seems so uninterested in providing even bare minimum service. Where do they get these servers? Im sure they are friends or relatives of the owner who probably think no matter how awful a job they do, they won't lose their job. It's a real shame, since the food is great....

doEvLld3dD8kfyqMwUGlTA.text: Love the menu here! The option of spam as a breakfast meat reminds me of my childhood. The selection of pancakes and side items is a welcome departure from the norm. Wish the hours were longer, we sometimes get here too late!

_Eg3qb7HdRsQMFRzuT9wXA.text: Slow service, but the food is ok. Nothing to write home about though.  The seasoned potatoes are better than other breakfast places in town.

ThVRNNZ3LrH85l85MRIgJg.text: My husband and I had breakfast here this morning and the food was exceptional, great customer service, decent prices and very clean environment. We definitely plan on coming back here for breakfast. Also, come early! They get really busy.

5NRPsW4a3RwVz0s8I4MMZw.text: Really pretty good coffee and the choices of pancakes was silly. Great family brunch today.  The single nutella crepe was awesome.

qbaKRTrwDm7o2m9lo2jcSA.text: Prepare to not be hungry for the rest of the day! Portions are huge and the food is delicious

jGu4Nyl-NpDS3QVAUSzg1Q.text: Place is close to where I live so breakfast here is very convenient. My wife and I eat here about once every few weeks. They have gotten our to-go orders wrong multiple times. They have one dish that has spam with eggs and spam in the eggs. I am not a huge stickler, but they seem to get this mixed up themselves when preparing it. Food is good and hostess are nice.

miF_pBHTz0gWXqY4HkCEjA.text: I've eaten at their other location on Smoke Ranch, it was fine. This place was so disorganized it's hard to believe they're still in business! We were the only customers in the place, it took 10 minutes to get a water, milk and tea. We ordered 2 hamburgers and one breakfast. One hamburger and the breakfast came out, it took about 8 minutes to get the second burger, which was very mediocre. .???  What's going on in their kitchen? Later in the day, I got sick from the food. Cross contamination is my guess. Go elsewhere. This place does not have their act together.

-rchtGxHfRVU1ediCtcu-w.text: I really want to love this place, but the two times I've been here was rather disappointing.  The red velvet pancakes was ok, the adobo fried rice lack flavor, 2 eggs, rice and 4 links for almost $9 is a bit overprice. Overall the food and service is just okay. I think the hype got my expectation high.

gj-gaglD6U5zswptXw6hAA.text: By far thee best breakfast cafe in Vegas. Prices are reasonable, atmosphere is friendly, and the service is great. Love, love the different variety of pancakes and the Nutella crepes is my favorite. The portions are always more than enough. Recommending this place to everyone!!!!

gkhh9Avi5ek-qs-gSNXSVQ.text: Got to the place around 1015am and it was busy (a good sign). Walt was only 30 minutes. Food was out in about 15 minutes and the selection was great. All in all the food was delicious!

ye4J8q7USFym-rdNG4iDeg.text: I tried both the original place and this one, Got the Mexican Skillet, the pork was kind of dry but with all the extra salsa and sour cream it help it a bit.  I would come back though, it was good. It was my first time being here since I don't live in Vegas, but it reminds me of a breakfast joint in California.

LtTfxQ7ZMvfBHNC4RkHaSA.text: Man babystacks Is just amazing !!!!! :) that guy chris with the glasses and the amazing smile was leaning tables like crazy today I dined in and had a cookie butter French toast and the service was great my coffee was always full Vincent was so nice to us   I also came backed placed a to go order and that young man with the nice hair is always on the rush and gives everybody a nice smile and attitude   The place is organized and way bigger than the other locations I will be back :)

erc7k1juZxsqYWtPUq5o6w.text: Get on the list and shop for 20 min in the strip mall on sat and Sundays. After 130pm it slows down.   They have a great Hawaiin vibe, with Asian backround, so its so good!   Kalua Pork benedict is to die for, the pancakes are ridiculous and amazing creations.  5 star breakfast, always a wait on weekends!    5 STAR RECOMMENDED!!

dwDGd01UArj-Ojids5celw.text: The food was great, no complaints there. Price was on par with other breakfast places. The service was really bad. If the service was just ok I would have rated this location 4 star maybe even 5 star. It took almost an hour to get our food, family of 4, we maybe had water refilled twice. I will admit the place was rather busy at the time but I've been to other breakfast places before when they were slammed and didn't get the type of service I received here. I would probably go again but not a Saturday or Sunday.

H_9EKv6roE9XFap6y1_wRA.text: I've been looking for a great crepe place for quite sometime since I moved to Vegas. I was surprised to find this one in my area of town. Although the restaurant is small it reminds you of a family owned business. I ordered crepes with nutella and strawberries. First the waitress brought out the wrong meal but had no problem taking it back and my correct crepe came in less than 10 minutes. When I received them they were delicious! Perfect crepe texture and fresh berries. I defiantly recommend this place. This is a popular breakfast spot, especially on Saturday morning, so get there early or plan to wait in line for a long time. I think the wait is semi-worth it but I gave it 5 stars because if you walk right in and sit down your food comes out fast, and delicious.

H6sybT1i1ATdjsGMVNSlag.text: The cinnabon pancakes are off the hook son! My family loves this place. Go early to avoid the looooong wait. This place gets stupid busy on the weekend.

1zbMGbMbSdS74kzpAskaCQ.text: I am never disappointed with this place. The food is always amazing and the service was very good. This definitely is my new favorite breakfast place. I've ordered different stuff every time and it's always very tasty ! No complaints. My favorites are the sweet cream crepes with strawberries and their skillets.

8fhU8QrR58hTWTEcyRGtpg.text: Meh. I don't really see what the hype is about this place. The food is ok. Nothing to write home about, but not bad either. The pancakes which seems to be their "claim to fame" didn't taste any different than the ones from IHOP or Dennys. Sometimes I think people just assume that a place is good based on the wait. Kind of like a placebo effect. The atmosphere feels like a cafeteria. Really bright lighting. The seating is by no stretch of the imagination comfortable, it's extremely loud, and tables are super close together. Don't plan on having any sort of conversation with your dining partner. I've been there twice now and the service wasn't great. Here's what bugged me both times. I like buttery pancakes. Both times, I get a stack of pancakes with ONE of those little pats of butter that comes in a foil wrap - like the kind they serve with bread at other restaurants. And one tiny little shot glass sized container of syrup. Both times I ask for extra butter and syrup and the waiter literally comes back with ONE MORE pat of butter and another shot glass full of syrup. Come on guys! Is it really that expensive to bring out a little dish of butters? Really, I'd prefer a little container of whipped butter like most places give but the pats will do- just don't be so damn cheap with them. You should get at least as many butters as you have pancakes. 3 pancakes = 3 butters. The last time we went, first my drink order was wrong and they also brought me out the wrong omelet. Granted the waiter was apologetic and took care of it, but still. Oh, and they only serve Pepsi products- blech.

IghL4uAB7H8I81nFLhVPiw.text: Red velvet pancakes? Yes please! This is a diet-busting, calorie nightmare and was super sweet, but I LOVED it. I finally get what all the fuss is about. Because of the sugar overload, I can't make this an every day or even every week stop, but definitely a place to keep in my back pocket for a treat! Prices were reasonable, the place was clean, and the server was nice. No complaints and nearly gave it 5 stars. Just not quite there. Almost....almost.

-PtSKR9gqw8TbEB3ItTNXQ.text: You will most likely see a line when you arrive, but it moves fast and this place is worth the wait. There's nothing like a good breakfast and that's exactly what you're going to get here. Wish I had a picture to show, but I gobbled it up too fast.

S5qQHWguYB2g9P0E9LoS5w.text: I've been coming here once in awhile since highschool and I would like to say the food never disappoints! My friends and I stopped by since my car was getting serviced at the dealership. We got settled very quickly. The server, Austin was great. The best bang for your money is getting a custom skillet. You have the option to pick your kind of meat, vegetables, cheese, and how do you want your eggs. It already includes seasoned potatoes. Even though I didn't get exactly what I ordered, it still was good. Service was fast and attentive.

U3hUJd1wB_dv0x8938wLew.text: Went in with a huge group and got taken care of quickly, food was delicious as usual!!!!! Great customer service.

bQ4w-sRl55g9nwyNfr3ApQ.text: We loved everything we tried! The strawberry syrup is fresh and delicious! Kids love it! And the service was great!

mtF-TvVZUXYgHw9jj1Pf1A.text: Pancakes are amazing! But the omelets are sooooo food! Wish they were open later then 2:00 pm

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy!

Nw2mZ0xjLjUWoNU7_Ls6Tg.text: This place fucking blows. This is my third time here because my dumb friend likes the red velvet pancakes. Every time the food sucks, the service sucks, and I'm just pissed. Everything was unseasoned and my hash browns were undercooked. My eggs, hash browns, and sausage tasted literally all the same. Not to mention my glass was empty the entire duration of my meal. And they couldn't even clear the trash off the table. How hard is it to wait on a table when you are a WAITER.

aWoBexFqAHN5D26eXlXgoQ.text: One of our favorite places for breakfast when we are lazy. The Wife & Kids get there sweet tooth fix and I get my Hawaiian fix on! Garlic rice is an awesome option!

tQDgoEScbppEuih-foO7FA.text: The pancakes are to die for. Delicious. But don't come here for coffee....the coffee is awful! Very watery and low quality. But, I keep coming back because of the food (the Nutella crepe is very good too). Only 3 stars because, for me, a good cup of Joe in the morning , is essential.

c8k9e1sRmWOZvzfthsL0mQ.text: Average at best, and the service is always slow. I'm very disappointed that they will no longer be serving the Orange Creamsicle pancakes. If you get one of the sweet pancake opinions I suggest getting a side. The pancakes are very rich!

WaAXmfQ8VYRnE-Z9ewspnA.text: Have heard about the Red velvet pancakes..gave them a try. Big let down. Pancake was very dry, even after syrup. Was only able to have a couple bites.

7u_Ykn2uhLKnsdqmyCE_pQ.text: Absolutely my favorite spot to meet with friends and family for breakfast! The service is impeccable and the food is a beautiful array of classics and orginal modern flair. They also offer you a to-go cup for your beverage when you leave. The hospitality is friendly, but they treat you like family. The Cracked Egg use to be my favorite until these guys came along. A must see and eat!!

woaevmkEHXxRFgTlUS-_Cw.text: I really enjoy this place. The food is good, I usually have great service, but a few times when they're slammed it's a little off. You can try just about anything on the menu and its be awesome. During the weekend mornings, they're pretty busy, so expect to wait a little if you try and go.

xieep1hTH39GEedMjzf4Pg.text: My wife and I order the skillets with scrambled eggs, delicious.  My 2nd favorite are the nutella crepes, We've found that instead of waiting anywhere from 15-45 mins for a seat, just call ahead and have them make your food for you for pickup.  All three times they've had my food ready within 20 minutes so by the time I got there it was ready.  And it tastes just as good as if you sit in the restaurant and eat.

XCCX1yxC1D7HBH4J1BR_UA.text: Late Saturday breakfast. Although there were a number of people standing outside the wait for 3 of us was 25-30 minutes.  Ended up taking the counter which was fine. I had the German Chocolate pancakes. Wow!!!! Daughter had the Red Velvet pancakes which she said were great.  Her finance had the strawberry crepe which looked really good. Shared the biscuits and gravy with delicious seasoned potatoes. Great service, nice atmosphere.  Can't wait to go back. Huge menu with lots of choices.

qGryDaVSRmVqGp2Cup4kzg.text: Pretty tasty....great portions.  I would eat there again for sure.  It is busy, so call well ahead for your to-go orders.

7CLX7e4uVcHUtL4IEC3BPA.text: I have never given a bad review before; the food was good, our server was nice. I was in a party of 6 we arrived at Baby Stacks with half our party. I asked to be seated but a rude woman named Julie told us that the rest of our party had to be here even though their were available tables. She then gave us an attitude and seated 3 parties on the available tables and here is what upsets me. Two of the 3 parties said the rest of their group will be arriving shortly and she then said that's fine lets get all of you seated. JULIE allowed not one but two incomplete parties get seated at a table with no reservation just walk ins. When the rest of our party arrived we ended up waiting 45 minutes and Julie was extremely rude to everyone in our party she didn't give us an estimated wait time all she said was when a table opens up will seat you, but she didn't she instead seated 3 smaller parties, then when she finally seated us she yelled my name, threw our menus on the table and didn't even look at us, Didn't mention that our server would be with us shortly or anything she instead walked away and left the building. I don't know what her problem was but you alone JULIE are the reason why I will never come here again

4o9WtjDWg226zCLC0RFLZA.text: A $10 meal is a fair trade to finally be rid of Babystacks in my restaurant wheelhouse. My family and friends have suckered me into eating here so many times. Simply an epic fail on making over medium or poached medium eggs. Service is always polite and personable even when missing the mark on attention to detail.

dhCSFJarBo-51SpmkdcWjw.text: TERRIBLE SERVICE; I  LEFT. When I arrived I had to wait while cashier took care of 3 customers bills at check out. They have no one to seat a potential paying customer. They just let u stand there until cashier is done & then, she'll seat u.  Then, once seated, I sat there drinking my coffee & was ready to order; however,   3 different employees came by & told me " your server will be here in a minute" as I continued  to wait & waIt while waitress gave refills to customers seated next to me, eating, & ignored me. I got so fed up, I got up & paid for my coffee ($2.70) & left. WILL NEVER BE BACK.  This is no way to do business. Have enough help to wait on customers.  And, probably, sever would have been highly offended if I had ordered & left without tipping.  Vegas is a tipping town.  But ONLY if give Good service!!!!

T792YhQuIwTodvNOz4PFxA.text: When we're in Vegas, we always hit up this place.  The wait is totally worth it.  They have large portions and it's not too expensive.

PGP-upVEpMpYWkhijJhcqQ.text: Excellent food! Excellent service! Babystacks is the best breakfast establishment in all of Las Vegas. The chicken fried steak is one of the best I've had in 20 years being in Las Vegas and the seasoned potatoes were very tasty. The cowboy skillet is awesome!

Rz-qgf77xV_xsDS1QZyX_w.text: Feels like a nice home cooked meal. Everyone was real friendly. Food is affordable and their selection is bigger than normal. Definitely a place to try if you live in Centennial Hills.

vE6Gc3odWJuIdqVMh6fpFg.text: This is a Sunday regular for us. The food is absolutely delicious. And the service is nice. It's a bit crowded because they are so popular, but that doesn't bother us any. Tip: They are very busy Sunday mornings so expect a wait, and they won't seat you until all the members of your pay are present.

RegEv_IGtrH-ESRWe-xkHw.text: Unorganized mess. My daughter likes chocolate chip pancakes so we stopped here. The lady at the front forgets about us somehow even though I watched her put my name on the list. The food is great but this lapse in service is unfortunate. That is what I am basing my review on. Never again.

x1fyaPRFHg0t1vSz3bfJPA.text: Great service, friendly staff. My coffee and water were always full and my omelette and short stack were yummy.

hi_JtnipnbcS8BuygSrVjg.text: 2 people I respect and learned to love worked here and said DON'T EAT HERE! The acting manager doesn't understand English. Ignorance is bliss here!  She went from one table speaking English well to no Bueno with complaining customers! Rude lady who doesn't care to fix! If u complain she will tell you.. YOU CAN LEAVE!

u-1Re1C85JFfOVS73NvesQ.text: Just meh.  The hash browns were kind of gross.  Pancake selection was pretty good though.  Crappy cafeteria seating.

I48qiPpwmGlW8I9uByTcPw.text: I seriously don't know what is the deal with this location because the summerlin one is great. BUT this one needs help and I am so bummed that after all the anticipation of them opening in Centennial, this location has turned out to be a serious disappointment. First time I ate there it was take out and  I ordered the strawberry pancakes and may lightning strike me dead if I did not get home to find a freakin shortstack of plain pancakes WITH TWO STRAWBERRIES CUT IN HALF!!!!! AND THAT WAS IT FOR THE STRAWBERRIES IN MY STRAWBERRY PANCAKES!!!  Second time ate in. Ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes. BURNED BURNED BURNED! Ya know for a pancake place this place SUCKS! I don't know if it's poor management or lazy chefs or both but geez! I'm not sure I want to go for the third times a charm factor.

wCWOwiw4UhjLFlP6zIUszQ.text: They are open today but they are not taking customers.  How do you expect to run a business if you're not taking customers?  Plus, they didn't even give a reason.  They just said they're not taking customers.

UtFsXpU2AEWnAWRrOyrz2w.text: Costantly good food. I have been there 4 times and have yet to be disappointed. Large menu  of both sweet and saver foods. They close at 2 and be prepared to wait but it's worth it.

UGX8MKxeBk5y6KnEoj28uA.text: Our definite go to spot for breakfast on Sunday's. So convenient and so good. If you get there before the 9am rush you'll get seated right away. Anytime after that there's a hefty wait but that's just because it's so good. Everyone is friendly and the service is quick. They also just recently started splitting checks if needed.

Ut3MAHh7INMGpAJbbdvJNQ.text: I am a huge fan of babystacks.. i pretty much always get the same thing .. Portuguese sausage and eggs can't go wrong with this dish.. the sausage are sauteed in a skillet with a little bit of burnt edges which is just how I like them. Eggs over easy with garlic rice.. perfect breakfast. I know they pride themselves on their pancakes but that doesn't draw me here .. they are a little stingy with the syrup but that's just my opinion.

Gm8cFyQjkUTTp2_ddDoEzw.text: Service is great!! Food is even better!! I got the red velvet pancakes and a skillet. The food is great!!! Took my family here that is visiting and everybody was happy!

nCpIhqyV2jajcmDk7GMHJA.text: I just want to start by saying I love babystacks cafe! Their red velvet pancakes are out of this world!  I was so excited for the centennial location to open, but what a disappointment:-(. I understand being overwhelmed but making people wait for 30-40 minutes on a Sunday at 12, when not even half of the restaurant had people seated was crazy.  At one point there were more employees in there than customers, and they just could not get it together.  There were at least 6 people standing at the food pass window.  And when we witnessed a girl pick food up off the counter (with no gloves on) and put it back on the plate, I really thought I was gonna be sick.   My advice, if your not staffed, and properly trained, then don't open.  And clearly they were not ready.  I can't promise I will or won't go back. My favorite is the smoke ranch location, so I may just keep driving there, or I will go back to the cracked egg.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You can see no one is seated in the restaurant!
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Like I said, the red velvet pancakes are delicious!!!

v7uaGE6VFknKYdEATKsaXA.text: Food is so delicious!  -Cookie and Cream Pancakes are amazing!  -Also tried the Kalua Pig Benedict and that was very tasty. -Adobo fried rice was good (per husband) -Service was mediocre, our server messed up our bill because it was split. -Didn't bring out the kid's meals first and my youngest got his meal last.

4fQ7LoKMO7YH6DhqnwgkcA.text: Food --------      [Taste] 3 out of 5: (Chili Skillet ordered with Carrot Cake Pancakes)  Food tastes of a decently cooked meal that one can cook for themselves at home. It's honestly pretty bland and needed to be spiced up with a lot of Tabasco. By the looks and taste of the dish, the cooks are very inexperienced. The carrot cake pancakes were so overcooked they were brown and had the texture of a Frisbee. The chili tasted like canned chili, microwaved and put on top of the skillet. However, the food was  definitely edible enough to finish the entire meal.  [Presentation] 2 out of 5::  Very simple presentation on a plate. Nothing fancy. I'm used to way better presentation at competing, similarly priced breakfast restaurants. Again, it seems the cooks are very inexperienced, or have little direction or guidance from the owners.   Environment ------------------  [Seating] 2 out of 5:   Very uncomfortable seating arrangement. Tables are too close together and wobbly. The staff also doesn't seem to understand how to seat people. There are plenty of open tables but people are still waiting in line. Booths are pretty much non-existent. The existing booths are straight-up hard wood with no comfort cushions or padding.   [Concept] 4 out of 5:  You can't go wrong with a breakfast joint! People that love breakfast can be loyal patrons if you get the right people designing your restaurant atmosphere and concept. Pancakes, eggs, bacon, sausage, coffee, everyone loves these things.  [Service] 3 out of 5:  Service is OK. There doesn't seem to be any "type" that the restaurant hires. All really good restaurants don't hire everyone that puts in an application. Good restaurants hire the right person for the job and the concept of the restaurant.

2BSd6q48yh811UR-caF1uw.text: Almost every weekend we get nutella crepes & their BLT to go. Not only is the food delicious, but they are always kind & courteous. They even take the time (even though they are always swamped) to open each box to ensure the order is correct. Everyone who knows me, knows I rave about Babystacks. Highly recommend!

FZSXvqBX0Ki2Cx1mnH_q8Q.text: This place is amazing! The food was delicious and made to order, the service was awesome and the vibe is chill. Definitely coming back again!!!

AAIB14zBoqG4K9UVqhR9SQ.text: I've been there twice now and they won't sit you if you don't have a full party, which I can understand if you have a big party but we had a party of 3!! We were waiting for 1 person. So my wife and I sat at the bar we wanted a cup of coffee while we waited, I asked on of the bus girls if we could have coffee so she walked over to the hostess and told her and she shook her head no, we waited a few more minutes and no service we were ignored. I will never go back to this location.... They are very rude!!!

xNITZnYmVYURarJoHavf6Q.text: I have eaten breakfast here many times and at different locations and it is always good.  I have tried most things on the menu and they are all tasty.  The seasoned house potatoes are the way to go, fried properly and well seasoned.  The only breakfast item that I found mediocre was the biscuits and gravy, but then again it is extremely rare to find a restaurant that makes proper biscuits and country gravy.  The pancakes are also all delicious. Great breakfast spot.

a8J0OMexDjEAPgUk2VjfNw.text: This new location in the northwest is probably the most spacious one of the other locations.  I like how Babystacks has a variety of not just your average eggs and bacon breakfast dishes.  They have filipino and hawaiian style dishes as well.  Their pancakes are fantastic!  I've had the regular, red velvet, and banana pancakes.  All were perfect and just the right size!  I've also had the Portuguese sausage with eggs and rice.  I like how they cut the sausages small and semi crispy (just how I like it) and it's not greasy.  I've also had the adobo fried rice omelet.  That dish can probably fit two people because it's so huge!  The only thing I didn't like was the garlic fried rice.  I wasn't a fan of the onions.  Other than that, this is an above average breakfast/lunch cafe!

BsTOIfHNa8AfRbZMKsRUwg.text: I was told by a buddy, and fellow Yelper, Baby Stacks was the bomb and couldn't wait for the Centennial location to open so I could give it a whirl. We slipped in on a Sunday morning about 9:00am and were promptly greeted by smiling personnel, but were told it would be a few minutes. Although it was relatively busy, about half of the tables were empty. We were finally seated and were made to wait for beverage orders and then again made to wait before giving our breakfast order. The party seated after us and seated right next to us was taken care of first. I opted for the Chicken Fried Steak, which is listed as Country Fried Steak on the menu. It comes with eggs, like you would expect, but you can opt for garlic rice instead of potatoes. What? Garlic with breakfast? OMG! Awesome! The meat was cooked to perfection and the breading was fantastic. I would rank this among some of the best CFS in Vegas. I ordered the eggs over-easy and they were a little on the runny side, so keep that in mind when ordering your huevos. My meal came with a choice of bread, which included buttermilk pancakes, or an upgrade to any speciality pancake. I chose the bacon pancake. Bacon baked right in. Everything is better with bacon, right? The Mrs. opted for the red velvet pancakes with the cream cheese syrup. Wow! It was like dessert for breakfast. I am sure there are healthier choices on the menu, but if you are going to do it, you might as well do it up right. The food definitely lived up to the hype. The service, not so much. We'll just chaulk it up to working out the kinks during the first week. I will definitely be back and can't wait to see the looks on the faces of the Breakfast Club when they bite into the specialty pancake of their choosing.

OEmAqRuozAeeFIMONbOlAg.text: Giving this business one star because they refuse to seat incomplete parties even when there are over 10 tables open. I am on here all the time so I asked for the owner as I was attempting to have a business meeting, the hostess told me the owner was there. Blanca (who is not the owner, just a waitstaff) comes out and presents herself as the owner. They precede to tell me that they are not allowed to seat people even with 10 tables and the bar open. Know at this point I was less upset about the seating and more about the lies. They still refuse to give a phone number for the owner. What kind of business owner does not give a complaint number?

AgMXiBBmF1O6vmizY-DsGA.text: Always a long line... so be prepared bit it's worth it in my opinion. I love all the different kinds of breakfasts they offer. Hawaiian, american and filipino.  The red velvet pancakes are amazing, spam, eggs and rice is a winner... haven't had anything bad except a couple times my pancakes were a little tough and over cooked

jeQ1jujNEUDMi64DwUp2yQ.text: LOOOVE baby stacks! Love the atmosphere and the people here! Great food.. I always get the loco moco with chilli.. YUUM and cinabon pancakes.. Can't go wrong!! Will ways come back here!

2OeEpD37h-Qum2KUlUQ_Wg.text: Delicious food. Great service. Something on the menu for everyone. Less then $10 a person. Very laidback. Will definitely be back.

Tp3mob3vAr5jIMHiHScZpw.text: I'm so glad we came here. The husband and I only have one day off a week together, so we occasionally enjoy a nice breakfast out. But, I've gotten to the point that national chain eateries don't impress me anymore. Additionally, our daughter is really finicky and breakfast is not her favorite meal. We've eaten here twice now and have enjoyed our meals. The pancakes are fluffy just like they should be. The kahlua grilled cheese was to die for. And, our  daughter loves the spam and eggs with an extra serving of rice instead of potatoes. Yay!

TPKDgXn-Kj3jzU0G_ocntA.text: Great tasting food! The banana cream pancakes are stuff dreams are made of :) gets really busy on the weekend & service can be slow at times. We've eaten here more than 4 times & each time the food was good but service varied. Give it a try but be patient - depending on the day! Go early for quick seating!

AifnorKodg31H31Z0WH41A.text: Best breakfast place ever! We come here at least once a week and love the staff and food! It's always busy so be patient because  it's worth it. My favorite is the loco moco! And of course the red velvet pancakes. :)

LbamBBmfCkjp01Pbz_ZkGg.text: Smoke Ranch & Buffalo location: Food is great but the host staff doesn't know how to correctly manage the seating or wait times. We went with family from out of town, party of 8, was told 45-50 minutes, which was fine - but after over an hour of watching 2, 3 and 4 person parties being seated repeatedly we left. We could have been seated easily within 20-30 minutes when another large party left. Although the food is good, it'll  be a while if we ever go back :( We went to another breakfast establishment nearby and we're seated within minutes because their staff is aware how to manage the seating chart.

lXquF7_CtTjaN-OTHpmDvw.text: This is definitely my go-to breakfast spot. The Nutella crepes, red velvet pancakes, fried adobo, the breakfast potatoes, everything is amazing. I've had literally almost everything on the menu and it's always been perfect. Is there a wait? At times but it's bc this place is awesome and word is spreading. Do I care? No bc it's totally worth it. If I wanted fast food, I would go to a place specializing in fast food; just saying. Also, there is always take out if you don't want to wait and unlike some other breakfast places that shall remain nameless, they know exactly how to prepare a take out order; meaning they line styrofoam containers with tinfoil so my hot food doesn't sit directly on the styrofoam and cook to it which is a huge deal. So basically there is absolutely no reason you shouldn't be eating here. I'm going to end this now because it's Saturday so I'm off to have breakfast at Babystacks like always.

NcJBGDYyBONsEnS385yHnQ.text: Stopped in @ 7 am Sat. morning. If you arrive @ 7:15 get ready to wait. I got right in & had bacon & eggs. Very good breakfast & good coffee & service.

U_z_E4TkurBGW7-lsInnfA.text: Good breakfast food. Was so excited to get a breakfast place in our neighborhood and was happy this place had more seating than the other location. We typically do our family breakfast thing on the weekend which is always packed so we started doing our orders to go. Worked great until they stopped taking takeout orders until after 12pm! Completely ridiculous that a restaurant which is only breakfast fare would limit their hours like that. I have small kids so it is difficult to take them to crowded places and wait 30 minutes for food. Guess we will just have to take our business to Mimi's Cafe who hires enough staff to handle their rush periods.

R-oQr3hBMEzPX84XreWDLA.text: Love this place! Great variety of different types of pancakes as well as other breakfast options.

2xWgCmEkwnwaygv9HKHepA.text: Before I lived in Vegas, I always made sure to come here whenever I'd visit. Now I go any time I want Hawaiian breakfast, or pretty much any time I am in the area and am hungry. So I guess I come here often. The service is always amazing, and of course the food is always great. I'm from Hawaii so whenever I eat here, it seriously is like I am back home.  My go to at home, and here in the mainland, has always been portuguese sausage, eggs, and rice. However, when I bring friends here I always tell them that anything and everything is good because I have never had anything here that I would not have again. Whether it's the pancakes, crepes, meals with rice, omelets, ANYTHING! Also make sure to try their strawberry lemonade. It is also delicious!

iw-lo4zYr4ko8KRbNYtB4g.text: My good friend and I always head here when the "out to breakfast" big takes us over. All the unique flavors and slight island flare makes this little morning spot hard to beat. I love their German chocolate pancakes when I'm fighting the sweet tooth, the lemon ricotta when I want to be a little more tame. But let me tell you GARLIC RICE!!! Oh my, sooo good and so much garlic!!!! I will never say no to These babies!!!

HtId0CmVERFwnXjNnLml2Q.text: Babystacks is our go-to local breakfast spot! Everything is truly amazing - from their pancakes to their Hawaiian/Filipino inspired dishes. Some of our favs include the red velvet and cookies and cream pancakes, the mexican skillet, spam with garlic rice and the loco moco. While they're usually busy especially on weekend mornings it's so worth the wait!

IpMSfwUpPvmyqky-cMmG2Q.text: ZERO STARS is more appropriate in today's visit to this location. We were looking forward to this breakfast BUT got a server name SHAWNI who got to our table with a sour face with no good morning greetings whatsoever. You felt right away she's not friendly figured having a bad day already so I let it go.    She took our order with attitude, fine ... she punched our order on a kiosk annex to us literally few feet away and I had to make sure the order we got had the famous red velvet Babystacks pancakes. So I asked , " Excuse me could you please check the pancakes we ordered are the red velvet." She didn't even come address us back to the table just her head turned and said with an attitude, " you got the buttermilk so do you want the red velvet? With such contemptuous attitude ... really?!?!? and came back to our table flailing her hands to us and said "next time you order you need to say you want the red velvet." Are you effing kidding me?! I let go of her attitude initially but this time I couldn't and shouldn't let this one go!!!! I had to ask, " are you having a bad day? Cz you are not friendly at all from the get go? If we were first time customers and not know the difference it is your job to explain your menu & any upgrade." I had to ask for a Manager because she was just plain RUDE !!!!  Is this what this place represents? Are their employees not trained properly on simple customer service?!?!   A manager name Blanca came and tried to appease us, but it was too late, our morning already ruined what supposed to be a good birthday breakfast.  It was VERY DISAPPOINTING to get a HORRIBLE server because they are the forefront of the establishment and gives you a negative vibe of the place. Customer Service is so important and this SHAWNI so lacks of it and shame goes with the management as well to tolerate and keep people with no business waitressing if they don't want to serve then they shouldn't be in hospitality job!  CUSTOMER SERVICE breaks or makes a business and I highly suggest to the owner of this establishment to work on that and make it a priority to train their employees well.  NEEDLESS TO SAY WE WILL NEVER COME BACK TO THIS PLACE AND DEFINITELY MAKE SURE TO TELL PEOPLE & FRIENDS TO GO TO THE BUFFALO LOCATION instead who has excellent customer Service and much better tasting food than this Durango branch.

7QxE_tREfGuKTou8-SqhUw.text: This place has the best pancakes in town. Hands down. It was worth the 45 minute wait. I got the banana pancake and I was impressed. Super good!

You can order the senior special for kids, and it's just enough food for our 5 yr old. I usually get the southwest skillet and it is delicious! We will definitely be back!

pVySmQoy-5vSVDRCMiTW5Q.text: If you haven't tried their red velvet pancakes, DO SO NOW! Delicious! Not once have I been disappointed, I love having breakfast here with my family. They also have the best French toast ever!

G0yGQ0_QsuQHt2AS120f4A.text: My favorite breakfast spot in Vegas. Have been coming here for years so it's about time that I've written this review. This location in particular is my favorite, they're always the busiest but we always get the best service here. I like this location because they're always consistent. No matter what I order or who I get as a server I always leave full & satisfied. Since me & my bf regularly come here we tend to order the same thing each time. I usually get the Portuguese Sausage with two eggs or loco moco with garlic rice with red velvet pancakes. Most recently we did try the Marble Crunch pancakes. Haven't really eaten much off of the breakfast menu but their Turkey Avocado BLT with their french fries well done is something that I've enjoyed as well. I definitely prefer breakfast here over Denny's or iHop where I feel their food is overpriced and never that good. They also play "feel good" music and as busy as they always are we NEVER feel like we overstay our welcome which allows us to dine comfortably.

dT49IuyhW7ggV9Txgpnz1A.text: After hiking at Mount Charleston with Terri R. and Mel C., we decided to stop here for breakfast.  I didn't know there was a northwest outlet for Babystacks.  It proved to be a good place to go.  I have never had Spam until today.  When I looked at their menu and saw the Specialties section, the Spam Scramble popped out and I knew I had to order this.  Along with this, I opted for the two pancakes you can get instead of toast.  I ordered the Orange Creamsicle pancakes that come with orange syrup, whipped cream, and a small container of cream cheese icing.  Breakfast was great!  Spam is just like cubed lunch meat.  The Furikake mixed in gave the scramble some extra taste and the rice was good.  I didn't finish the rice because I wanted to have the healthier food--the pancakes with orange syrup and whipped cream.  As others have mentioned, this is a large restaurant and they have a large waiting area.  The three of us opted to eat at the counter where there was immediate seating.  Service was great.  My coffee was refilled several times and they were there to refill water glasses, too.  This is a good option for my hiking group to stop for a late breakfast/lunch while we're still hiking at Charleston.    This was a tasty breakfast made better because I enjoyed it with two friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The section with the counter seating.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange creamsicle pancakes.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam scramble.

yEIHa2VSEMGQuxeme2VBwA.text: Funny enough, we live right smack in between both Babystacks Cafe places.  We finally decided to take the jaunt in the opposite direction and visit the location on N. Durango!  Place is super busy for breakfast on the weekends.  Especially on a Sunday.  So church goers beware.  You may be in for a bit of a wait in your Sunday best.  Luckily for the wifey and I the wait was only about 10 minutes that day.  Place is nice and lively, and seems a bit more spacious than the other location on Buffalo.  Actually it seems a lot more spacious with the high ceilings and more tables.  I like the colors, actually makes me want to drink coffee and eat breakfast.  Menu here is just about the same as the other location.  Breakfast and lunch items galore!  Nothing in short supply.  I skipped my want of Rick's Adobo Fried Rice (hard for a Filipino) and went with something else out of the menu.  I chose the Ranchero Omelette ($9.25) - four egg omelette with an entire Ortega chile and chicken, topped with fresh green salsa, and pepper jack and cheddar cheese.  Also came with hash browns (love mine well done), and two buttermilk babystack pancakes (of course!).  Omelette was of good size, with lots of chile and chopped chicken on the inside.  The cheeses complimented the omelette well, and the green salsa gave it a nice added kick (but not too hot).  I enjoyed it a lot.  The hash browns were standard, good and cooked how I like.  I however love to drown mine in pepper, ketchup, and lots of Tabasco.  Yum.  The babystack pancakes?  Good to the last bite.  I dunno what it is about their babystack batter, but it's a keeper.  Nice, hot, fluffy (not you Gabriel Iglesias), not doughy or rubbery, perfect with some maple syrup.  All in all a great breakfast for me.  The wifey had the Mexican Skillet ($9.95) - flat top potatoes with marinated carnitas and jalapenos, with pepper jack cheese, topped with two eggs over-easy, and a side of fresh pico de gallo, and sour cream.  Wifey also opted for two buttermilk babystack pancakes.  She said her dish was good, but there was a bit too much jalapeno in her skillet making it a little spicy for her liking.  The pico de gallo also had more onion than tomato.  Other than that she enjoyed it, and gave thumbs up to the babystack pancakes.  I like Babystacks Cafe for breakfast and will keep coming here for their morning delights.  Service here is great, our server was quick, very attentive, and kept our cups full.  Can't ask for anything more, especially during the early morning rush.  Eat!  Next time it will be Rick's Adobo Fried Rice.  Or maybe not.

I decided today that I was going to do that and I called. The girl out me on hold for 8 minutes (I have a lot of patience).. I decided to just drive there and make an order since I had some shopping to do and I could swing by and just pick up my order. I walk in through the door and the girl asked if she could help, I told her I was the person they put on hold for 8 mins. I told her I wanted to make a take out order. She then said "we not doing take out right now.. Take out orders are on hold right now.." Ok, I get you're busy and you're cooks can't keep up but you could've said it to me when I called instead of keeping me on hold and waste my time.. Smh. I won't be eating here anymore nor ordering. Looks like I will find a new place. They really need to make this place bigger and hire more people. Or go find a new spot that's bigger that can handle all their guests.

-XE4I0Jz0ZBLig8bqef1cg.text: Food was average. Everyone I spoke with was ranting and raving about how good this place was. I thought they offered a great variety of food items, and the food was overall good. They are only open in the mornings so you need to be there early if you don't want to wait for a seat.

I had the Lolo Rick's adobo fried rice wrapped up in an omelet. I added the green sauce that they make in house, and Hollandaise sauce was off the hook. I highly recommend adding those two, to kick it up a notch.

o57YlPkQScZGvi90DZL6vg.text: We absolutely love the food,  the reason for the poor review is because of the service at the front counter. As people have already mentioned, it's always packed here so we always order food to go. Maybe I don't understand what exactly a tip is for but last time I checked a tip is for when you are being seated,  served/waited on... When paying at the counter they give you a tab to fill out for the tip before they proceed with the transaction... At that point I cross out the tip(because I don't feel I have a reason to leave tip due to not being seated and served) and return the receipt to the person at the register. No matter who I am dealing with I ALWAYS get nasty or disturbed looks when I don't leave a tip... Unless the tip is going to the cooks I honestly don't feel as I should be leaving a tip for the person who bagged my food or the cashier.  Maybe the process should be alerted or the workers at the front counter should be talked to about putting on a better face when they are displeased.

We walked in, busy and I expected that, didn't take our name down or how many in our party, forgot who was first and going where....it was so freakin hot. My friend ordered crispy bacon and it came out soggy, my husbands egg Benedict came out and the biscuits were soggy so we asked for new ones and those were soggy too, his breakfast was so bad he didn't even want to finish it. I got the country fried steak breakfast and I enjoyed it up until my husband decided he wanted to eat the eggs, I don't like eggs, he was so excited and hungry to eat them, he got them all dressed up and ready to eat and then when he went to go take a bite there is a whole corner of a plastic cut off in the eggs.  We ask for a manager and they came over and said that they had no idea where the plastic came from because all their stuff is organic and not packaged, which is bull crap, because when I walked in I could see the shelves with the cans in the back in the kitchen. And I find it disturbing that a manager would say that they have no idea where it came from instead of making us as guests feel comfortable.  It was a bad experience, it was disgusting, we will never go back there.

Akr19T-tAXFFflpsUdlIdw.text: First timer - Came in looking to feed this Halloween hangover. Hit the spot for sure!! Food was delicious. Now I'm going back to bed.

AiyVsArN_W6d9INPTFu1yw.text: Felisha was a great server! Very friendly and nice. She knew what to recommend and brought drinks and the food out fast even though it was really busy! I got a swish mushroom burger and it was good but I thought the patty could've had more seasonings. The fries were thinner than I like but they were so crispy and good that I didn't even mind. I tried my boyfriends smores pancakes and they were so delicious! The plates are a little smaller than I'd like but I'm comfortably full. I recommend this place!

z-fW3iXadXOe2g15Yl2WKg.text: I visited Baby Stacks for breakfast, after waiting for 30min we were seated. We ordered our our food which was pretty good. Once we were fo idhed eating ee waited over 15 min for the waitress to return. Tired of waiting, we took the check to the register, paid and left. As we are walking to our cars the person who waited on us was running after us yelling and accusing us of not paying out check. I was insulted, embarrassed and furious. I went back to Baby Stacks few days later and spoke with the manager who quickly dismissed me with a slight apology and a "we'll follow up with you." Of course  I never heard back from them. I never went back either.

8oOeLImDpWEQ6gtXNzTKwQ.text: We got here shortly after they opened and there were at least 3 other parties seated. We were worried because we were in a hurry to eat and run. Once our order was taken, our drinks came out quickly as did our food. The food portions were generous at a great value. Everyone was courteous and efficient. My kind of place! Definitely a great place to hit if you're in the area. Plus: they were able to accommodate our group's diverse nutritional needs. Such big wins.

lwsYbhagduaYwe8ZyNy5lQ.text: Didn't quite live up to the hype. All pancakes on the menu sounded amazing but they weren't as soft and fluffy as I would've hoped. Prices weren't cheap either.   S'mores and cinnamon roll pancakes were the most memorable, bacon sadly wasn't so hot.

R5lM2U6P_MylVuxPu4_JJg.text: Honestly, I don't understand how so many people seem to rave about how great this place is. I have been there 3 times. cnsV_uaqG_caO5S-km-zSw.text: Delicious breakfast. Pancakes, country fried steak and eggs, biscuits and gravy... It's all awesome. Will be back to try more of their menu items!

S_iOGHhMlsjeq_XZT0skww.text: Great breakfast choice, esp in the NW! Every time I am here, I order a breakfast platter and substitute the specialty pancakes. IMO, the pancakes are why anyone should come here! This time, I went with the Spam & Eggs ($8.50): Choice of Potatoes & Pancakes. Good stuff! Wish the spam was a bit crispier for my tastes. I substituted the Cookies & Cream Pancakes: Chocolate Batter with Oreo, Whipped Cream, Icing, Cream Cheese Syrup & more Oreo. These were delicious! But I love Oreo...pretty much anything....so I am a little bias :P Eva tried the Red Velvet Pancakes: Whipped Cream, Chocolate Crumbles & Cream Cheese Syrup. Good as always...probably one of the reasons why they got famous! My only complaint about this location is the lack of presentation/love put into the plating. After all, you eat with your eyes too! Compare this plate from the Buffalo location to the others below : yelp.com/biz_photos/baby... But besides that, yummy breakfast food at decent prices. I'll be back for more :)

W9y8ct_-Fj0HHTU-W8_xoA.text: I come here once a month with my husband. It's around the corner from our home. It's usually good, some of the staff are nice and helpful, while some of the others seem that we inconvenienced them by coming. This time around we ordered take out and they forgot my egg for my skillet. They showed me the order so quick i didn't even realize it. I mean neither did the take out guy. So when I called back, they put the manager Blanca on the phone.  She pretty much did nothing because it was my fault for not checking my order, not even an apology. I mean seriously, I'm paying you to put it together and I still have to check for myself and make sure every single is item there or it's my fault. I've worked a food server or over 10 years, so this to me is so unacceptable.

OKBTujMWeEaR4owMOTrO7A.text: There is a slight wait when it comes to this place.  Honestly, I'm not very impressed and it does seem overrated.  It's not so great. The rice was very dry and the eggs were overdone. It's like any other diner breakfast spot. I don't see anything extremely special about it. The pancakes were alright. Big I guess. Meh. The service is also not the greatest the two times I came.

47_uX2RhDDXsfByD55iBQw.text: Frequent customers because of the food but their service is not the best. Weekends are busy!! The public knows this so you would think the company would better prepare, they obviously know it's going to happen too. Getting placed on the waitlist is the hardest part lol and I'm not the kind to say I arrived first but on more than 1 occasion I've walked in looking for the clipboard person and they are taking names from the 2-3 guests that have walked in after me already -_-

54s1J_qPWqQlFMz50VGT6w.text: Food: I should have stuck with the pancakes. I am visiting from Hawaii and was a little home sick so I wanted to try the loco moco. First off I was a little disappointed that they couldn't sub fried rice for a small up charge but rather only could do garlic rice (over garlicked) or buy the $10 adobo fried rice on the side. This is something any L&L, big city diner, loco moco shop does easily. The gravy too tasted a little... Boxed. The coffee tasted distinctly plasticky mixed with that airplane coffee taste of bad water, and the sugar didn't make it any better. But I will admit this is my fault for ordering something Hawaiian in Las Vegas. My husband got the white chocolate macadamia nut pancakes and gobbled them up so those were good.   -stick to pancakes   Ambiance: the staff was very nice and smiley, a little inattentive but functional. The decor is a little sparse but the music was nice!   Overall: good place to get breakfast if you want traditional breakfast foods, but they have some work to do on their Hawaiian local specialities.

QE9rcHEDch8nT603ug0jWQ.text: This place is by far my favorite place to go for breakfast! From the varieties of pancakes to skillets and omelets, I can never just order one meal! Leftovers and take homes are mandatory when visiting here! The servers are always nice, helpful, and attentive.. The food always comes quickly after ordering and the price is definitely worth the food! 30$ plus tip for 2 for a Sunday breakfast with leftovers..

u2V4TMgLH71m9uE53Q13Pg.text: Good breakfast spot. Beats the chain places for sure. At times there can be quite a bit of a wait and they don't accept reservations. So on a Sunday morning you can expect up to a 45 minute wait to get seated. The food is usually very good and tasty and the service swift.

c56PV3-3izV-ARbSLjo3Zg.text: So disappointed.....  I think our negative dining experience had more to do with this location's poor management more than anything else.  It's obviously a busy location, but the process for checking in, waiting, being seated, waiting and then waiting even more....was too much.  The icing on the cake....when someone finally asked how things were....as we are paying on the way out.....when we said it wasn't good and for our first time here we were disappointed....the guy taking our money said nothing!  Not even a sorry about that, yeah today was really busy but give us another try, or even let me see if my managers available???  Nothing....  My Yelp recommendation DON'T try this location!

VGPuSjBcbyI455QDfLR1Zw.text: One star because my meal rocked. I had the Hawaiian sliders.   The wait was 30 min at 10:15 am. We waited 10 min at our table before we received water and coffee. We then had to ask 4 times for coffee refills which took about 10 minutes each time to get. That's another 40 min. I don't want to EVER have to ask. "Our" waiter never actually refilled it. Mikey was too busy. Another female waitress overheard us complaining and she refilled it once. One of the meals that came out was cold. I mean cold... The cheese wasn't even trying to melt. It was not good. We sent it back with little apology from our "waiter."  I had to ask for a coke refill. Again why am I having to do this? We then asked for butter for the pancakes. I swear to you 7 minutes passes and he comes back and says, "oh I forgot the butter, do you still want it?" No. No. No. Screw this we are done.  As we paid and the young man asked if it was ok and we said no it was actually a bad experience for our first time there. He simply took our money and  never looked up. That's crap in my opinion. You just lost a potential customer for the duration of our vegas living.  The "manager" looked just as lost as the rest if the staff while she was taking names to be seated and not back running the kitchen and doing quality assurance checks. What a crock. I chose not to say anything to her because I felt like that was a moot point as well.  On a side note there is only one restroom for the males and one for the females. We used the men's once because it stupid to stand in line that long for the women's. This place is huge and it's not equipped to handle the volume.

I usually go with the red velvet pancakes and the adobo omelette. Red velvet pancakes to be honest are ok. zbokXeIiunm4zRcvo5siDg.text: Went here with a friend for breakfast and it has it's good and bad points. First things first they do not take reservations here and they will not seat u if you whole party is not present. That being said the wait to get a table here is crazy. We were in on a Saturday morning and the wait time was 30m to an hour for a breakfast joint!!!! We were seated conceded to taking seats at the counter because we had waited 45m and did not want to wait longer for a table.   Waitress at the counter was nice enough but nothing special service wise.  I ordered the banana pudding pancakes with a side of bacon and my friend ordered the breakfast special. The prices were reasonable but I didn't like that the syrups were an extra cost (wth- where they do that at?) but since I had an embellished pancake I did not need syrup. (Also note no sides are included with the specialty pancakes.)   Overall the pancakes were really good and the bacon was cook nice and crispy. I do however feel that the pancakes were kind of smallish but still filling. I think the specialty pancake options they have are very original like red velvet, Nutella, various fruit flavors so I would like to go back and try some of the other flavors. Not yet a favorite place of mine but it could happen. I would definitely come back and I think I would recommend to others.

I always enjoy the food here and usually receive great customer service but there a very popular spot so they get really busy and I don't like how the tables are all crammed together so close and in this particular visit they decided to seat us on a bar area which was fine but then I realized there's no elbow space which makes it uncomfortable to eat but all and all it's a good place to try out I definitely will be coming back here again
