vTzyMozJES0c1ZyB4Ab2Iw.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE. It is seriously my number one spot. It's always crowded which tells you how good it is. Never less than a 20 minute wait, unless you go super early, of course. I  had the spam and eggs the first time, so good. Then I discovered the chili moco, substitute spam. OH. MY GOD. It is the only thing I order now. It's that good. GET IT!! I love that you can also upgrade your side of pancakes to one of their Babystacks. I have had their blueberry, banana cream pie, red velvet, Cinnabon, and cookies and cream. Still working. My way through the rest lol. My must try Babystacks are for sure the Cinnabon and the cookies and cream. You don't even need  he side of syrup they send. Just delicious.

xvyr8Z1-A8r0Q5FNNplAHw.text: I love babystacks I always go to the original location in Summerlin they have the best service there and should've just gone there instead. Never coming back to this location again after our experience . Yes, there's a lot of people, it's busy... BUT that doesn't give you an excuse to be rude and inattentive to your customers. Our server took 15 min to get us a drink and another five to get our orders... Once he did get our orders all of our orders were incorrect! A simple sorry about that would've sufficed BUT he managed to say are you sure you didn't order that?.... Like BRO... I ordered Portuguese sausage, rice, over medium eggs, with pancakes .... and he gave me the sausage, seasoned potatoes,scrambled eggs and toast... instead of apologizing he was just like so you changed your mind on the toast..? NO. I never ordered it.. and he was telling me that wasn't what he wrote down.. Well OBVIOUSLY you were not paying attention and didn't care much for good service...he apologizes after hearing me make a comment about him claiming we ordered what he wrote. To put the cherry on top of this horrific service he managed to put 3 drinks that we didn't order on the bill...... The cashier asks us if we wanted to add tip ... the answer is a big NO. I'm usually a good tipper but with that service he was lucky we didn't walk out... Amazing food won't keep customers coming back if your service is horrible and unprofessional. I did not expect a 5 star dining experience here but I also did expect attentiveness, and a little bit of courtesy.... SMH.

_Bs-AdaevgCZH-um5hFddg.text: Little known fact, there are very few things I love more than breakfast. So for obvious reasons it was on the top of my very long list bookmarks. A word to the wise, come early and come hungry! There will be a wait but it's worth it. Better than the cracked egg, the egg & I, egg works...basically anyplace with the word egg in it. Lol! (IMO anyway) :p   Friendly staff and lots of Hawaiian inspired dishes. I just love the aloha vibe here which makes sense since Vegas is the 9th island. Zippy's chili (If you've been to HI before then you already know what I'm taking about), portuguese sausage with garlic rice, macadamia pancakes, spam & eggs, adobo fried rice omelette, and the list goes on. It's easy to see why baby stacks stands out from the pack. So Ono!   Another notable mention are the red velvet pancakes. But my all time favorite are the bananas foster pancakes. OMG!!! Ahhh-mazing!

pzfo-AweVhZInzRGZc5k8Q.text: Came here for breakfast and I know a place is good if they can get me craving for more after I finished my meal.   We chose to eat at Babystacks because it was convenient. My boyfriend and I aren't really pancake people (we prefer savory breakfasts) and had ordered the corned beef hash and the adobo fried rice. I felt like it would have been an injustice to come to babystacks and not try their pancakes, so I asked our server for their most popular pancakes and decided to get the strawberry pancakes to go with my corned beef hash.  I wasn't expecting to really like the pancakes since I normally don't. BUT I ATE ALL OF MY PANCAKES. IT WAS DELICIOUS. It came with fresh cream and strawberries and this strawberry sauce that was addictive. I almost forgot all about my corned beef hash because all I wanted to do was keep eating the pancakes. The corned beef hash was perfect, it had a nice crisp to it and some softness in the middle. I love eating it together where I'm able to get corned beef hash, a little runny yolk, and potatoes all in one spoonful.   My boyfriend got the adobo fried rice which was served in an omelett. I've never seen that before so I thought it was really creative. It was well-seasoned and yummy.  For a place that we randomly picked, I was thoroughly impressed and we enjoyed everything we ordered. I'm honestly still thinking about those strawberry pancakes.

ltrwAmPbRvuFRBmjclXoqA.text: Since moving to Vegas , this has been my favorite . My wife and I frequent this place very often . The people are so nice and the food is always amazing . I would recommend for a family breakfast . The only thing is they close at 1pm I believe . We always get there early anyway .  I got the Mexican skillet with banana cream waffles and she gets the chili moko with cookies and cream pancakes .

dfByY_DJ7SuL1xQs9OU_gQ.text: Epic fail!!! Finally order drinks and didn't even  bring lemon for the water which we requested when ordered when I asked the pastor for straws and lemon she rolled her eyes as if I was putting her out! About five minutes later I then again asked for a server instead of the server who I asked to take our order she went for 10 minutes looking for the server instead of just easily taking our order which made no sense to me... finally the server came apologized took our order and then proceeded to go take someone else's order ask the people next to us if they needed anything else grabbed them to go boxes and started talking to another customer!!! At this point we were completely over it absolutely horrible customer service I made sure to let the manager now on the way out and she said she would address it but didn't seem to care at the time to take care of it!!! My husband and myself eat almost every meal out and service for us is huge without it we will avoid establishments like the plague!!! Horrible customer service they've gotten to be big shots and don't care about their customers I would think twice about going into there again

Lr4Tj2GnIJgSH6MO_PgY0w.text: The food and service is always good when we come here which is fairly frequently- :)! I love that I know exactly what I'm going to get because the food and service is consistent regardless of time/day. Definitely a go-to for a great breakfast at a great price!

PIXAOy3d7tRlh7FLePp23Q.text: Great breakfast spot! I've been there four times and it's been great every time. Servers are friendly. Pancakes are great, but !vorite by far is the Ranchero Skillet!! The green sauce is freshly made every morning. It's super flavorful and tangy, but not too spicy at all. Best breakfast!

pMx_6AX6Q8C3QZCGS8tBQw.text: Great place to have breakfast or brunch. I have been to their other branches as well and their food taste consistly. Highly recommended.

en-6E19RITcFe15xJByXyQ.text: We enjoyed a great breakfast here at Babystacks Cafe. The restaurant was pretty busy with a short wait to be seated. The food was excellent and so was the service. Our waitress Allison was quick to take our drink order and our food was served rather fast. I ordered the breakfast burrito with Portuguese sausage which was excellent. We will definitely return to try other items on the menu.

P_6LWNzm_3vvv7Hf-nlUcQ.text: Food wasn't good nice had  Breakfast at 2 locations and both times I was highly disappointed.  God tasted like it sat under a warmer for awhile. Not fresh at all. Henderson location had horrible Customer service and food and the other location in NLV good customer service but bad food.

aPW16aW_czuKyk-hEE3BIA.text: This is my favorite breakfast place in the entire world!!  Service here is hit or miss.  But the food here is always HIT!  I have been a fan since previously known as Babycakes.  Babystacks is known for their delicious red velvet pancakes!  They are served with mini chocolate chips, whipped cream, and a cream cheese syrup.  Delicious!!  After coming here for several years, I have tried almost all the pancakes.  Cookies n cream, chocolate chip, banana cream pie, red velvet, hazelnut, honey wheat, s'mores, white chocolate macadamia (surprisingly my least favorite).  My favorites are red velvet and hazelnut.  Their seasoned potatoes are to die for!!  Absolutely delicious.  I always get a side of country gravy with them, and dip my potatoes in it.  Yuuuummm!  I love sourdough toast, and am so happy this place has real sourdough.  A lot of places say they have sourdough and serve you white.  Although their menu says the bacon is crispy, if you like it well-done, make sure you tell them (because you may or may not get it crispy).  One of my only complaints!    There is usually a wait, especially on the weekends.  The least busy times I have found are around 2 PM.  Then you can get in and out of there in half an hour.  If you go when it's busy, expect a 20-30 minute wait.  So worth it though!

YSHcCe85zFsWjSQJUU80kg.text: My all time favorite breakfast spot. I go here all the time, and have brought everyone here to eat with me. When I want breakfast- I come here. I love the garlic rice and ribs but my favorite this is the red velvet pancakes!! My favorite!

gwadKF4V0wLpH1ZmvqRX_g.text: I am in love with this place! The many options and fa loves are amazing! My favorite is the Banana Foster pancakes; the red velvet are good as well. The service is good and the food is always the same as the first time' I recommend to anyone who was a sweet tooth and a taste for rich flavor!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Foster and Red Velvet pancakes

GOcElIWZ8P66c7js96wbQQ.text: Pumpkin Spice Pancakes!!!! Need I say more!! I had the skillet with green chillies and everything thing else! It was delicious!!

Amehg-vwCaS7zCZ9OaIEBw.text: Freakin loved this place. I came to visit a dear friend of mine who lives here and happens to be a regular here. We came here two days in a row and both times didn't disappoint. I even ordered the same thing both times, egg whites, bacon, small stacks of buttermilk pancakes and side of fruit. I know it's not really fruit season so I don't blame them that the fruit was wilty and wasn't flavorful. This won't be my last time here. It will be on my list of must-dos when I visit Vegas. The service was just as good as the food. No matter how early we got there, once was 9:15am, the other was 7:50am, they were still so chipper and happy to be working there. When people love their job and are happy, it makes everything that much better. The next time I visit, I will gladly change up my order and try something new. The ambiance of this place is so warm and homey as well. From the pictures on the wall to the colors they close. All of it was great!

1LpEO1o39oLK25JrE2P98A.text: Everything was very good, I built my own omelet with strawberry pancakes on the side. The service was just as good, I'd recommend stopping by if you're in the area.

lBGvvtTB6xwb97wC9oOA3g.text: The best desert breakfast place in town! Their biscuits and gravy is also a go to of mine. Wait time is usually less than what they quote it as. I see why their line is always out the door.

5kZ5jCDkiFH0CqAfCvnHig.text: Wow the food is delicious we ate their 2day in a row, Trac the waitress was so nice food was made quickly, I had the kalua eggs Benedict on the 1st visit my husband had biscuits n gravy, the 2nd day I tried the Portuguese fried rice omelet, so delicious, husband had loco moco very clean place, the music was awesome too. I highly recommend this place 5 stars for me.

ztOGiY4u7GtDVobHXCkumQ.text: Other then being super busy. Great food and service. A lot of options to choose from. Would definitely recommend. Just get there early.

afcVZCwDsAEO7YylF42TyA.text: Delicious and great service, even with a packed house. I love the mix of traditional, Hawaiian, and Filipino breakfast options; it was so hard to choose! That just means that we have to come back for more.

wJDq5tI8BlwrBKg9lvOECw.text: Did a skillet with chocolate chip pancakes and strawberries and hubby did steak and eggs with garlic rice and banana pancakes. Everything was phenomenal! Including service. Josh was a great server who anticipated every need, recommended great food and was extremely friendly. We are new regulars after finally trying this place!

0LS7DbCeySRW9tAiwO0w4w.text: Bad day here , not really crowded came in got seated and waited,waited and waited for 15 min went and talked to guy at register who was clueless, may have to think about service issues here

KqlPeLQ5udlsbOpPLX4dyQ.text: My kids and i live going to this local gem for breakfast, the Adobo Fried Rice is really flavorful paired with some of thier lemon pancakes it's the perfect match. I recommend getting there earlier than later because there's almost always at least a 15-20 min wait.

N6A7mx1F6zL2CR8LoV2PVQ.text: 5 stars for Austin, our server, who took incredibly good care of us. I asked for a bunch of crazy requests (I'm pregnant and have a bunch of weird cravings!) he got me a side of pickles, extra furikake, made sure I was always taken care of... he was so awesome!!!! Thank you

Dl3PY0lE5H5gurHb9czPOg.text: Not sure if it was the cook today or because I ordered out but I was disappointed. This was our first time eating here and saw how good the reviews were/live down the street and wanted breakfast food. Ordered blueberry pancakes and hash browns. The pancakes fell short. Tasted as if they drowned it in butter while cooking all while bland at the same time (butter isn't a replacement for sugar). Hash browns were hard around the edges and not seasoned at all. My boyfriend's red velvet pancakes were pretty good. Just super bummed they didn't live up to the hype. Overall, I'll pass.

D-7Pd40zEy9mEjI7GB0Z4g.text: Stopped in for a quick breakfast. My husband had the country fried steak with garlic rice. He loved it !! My choice was egg white garden omelet. It arrived wayyyy too greasy but our lovely waitress named Felicia was very receptive to taking it back and having the kitchen make a new one. The second time it was perfect. If you're looking for a less greasy omelet make sure you order it dry.

KYjHOUa7A5FphSxvGgJ0WQ.text: For breakfast places, this is a top favorite. This is one of those restaurants that will get you hooked after your first time. All the pancakes are amazing. The Mexican skillet is by far my favorite breakfast dish. I give them 5 stars based on the food alone. Sometimes the wait can be very long but it's worth it.

K4-kwJyBuGE0O-qvQBIOOA.text: Great food as always & less wait time to sit down since the sq ft is larger than the buffalo location.

or0PnfzYjaXLWPuVCYmXCA.text: Babystacks never disappoints. All their food is delicious and fresh, and every flavor of pancakes we have ever ordered has been fantastic. It's our go to breakfast spot, especially when we have company in town! There is usually a wait on the weekends, but it never takes very long! Food always comes out quickly too, and our servers are always friendly!

Upm9erJ3wmwrSAcfX68XuA.text: Been going to babystacks for years and it hits the spot. Here are a few tips.  1. Weekends are always busy. You will wait. If you have a large party or small party you will wait. Make sure everyone in your party is there or you will not be seated and you will wait. Once you're seated service is usually fast 2. Best time to come is a tues-thurs when school is in session. So a Tuesday in may is perfect and they will actually sit an incomplete party when they are empty 3. Get the pancakes. This is what they are known for. Red velvet is amazing but you may need insulin after. So is their bananas foster 4. Coffee isn't the best here, pretty weak tasting, but maybe you're into that. But it's always hot and they're usually really good at refills 5. Food doesn't come out piping hot. Usually just warm. For a while I was turned off by this, but number 3 gives you the reason why we go here. But hey at least they're consistent 6. I love that they have both hash browns and potatoes as options 7. They try to move you in and out of the place quick so if you come on a busy time, don't expect to just hangout after you're done eating.

K-zhZyx522n4vQ_F97dS2A.text: Great place to have hawaiian style food.  We wanted to eat at a breakfast place that served hawaiian food and we were not disappointed.  We weren't from Vegas but found that it was a very popular place to eat by the amount of people waiting to get in.  Service was great and the menu had a variety of different hawaiian and american breakfast plates.  Will visit that restaurant every time we go to Vegas.

tNlG3erhaisUuKG0St6UAQ.text: Everyone raves about the red velvet pancakes...and they should!  They are truly amazing. They have a slightly crusty outside and the middle is moist and not too sweet. It's served with this thick glaze that you pour over it in lieu of regular syrup. Oh my!  It doesn't get much better than that!!    The coffee was perfect with the pancakes. The only reason I didn't give it more stars is the service was a little lacking. They didn't seem to be all that busy but it took a while to get out order and the coffee refills didn't come around as much as I would have liked. I've been there a couple of times on different days of the week so I'm not sure why the service was just so so. I'll tell you what though, the red velvet pancakes makes it worth your wait!  Go there, NOW!

4Lp0rHarqZny8B7SgNzJjA.text: Food was delicious and the servers were fast and friendly.  My favorite pancake location.

UWTe5S6kkz0EitxQ4zkvyQ.text: My biscuits and gravy were.... alright. Pretty bland. Then again I DID order biscuits and gravy from a place called baby stacks... My wife got the Cinnamon roll pancakes and they were absolutely fantastic. Price was great. 20 bucks for my wife and I. no cell phone service in the building :( Seating is first come first served, I am ok with that, but plan accordingly.

ba8ASmxNOVGvXy-I4Xklrw.text: This used to be my favorite breakfast place because it is in my neighborhood, but the last two times I was not pleased at all. The employees Are not friendly at all. They are grumpy young men, really weird. They do not look in your face while they take your order and they look around while they place the plates in front of you, I felt like I bother this person. He was the one with the big golden necklace. The whole place makes me feel not comfortable and welcome, it also used to be way more clean I am not sure if the owner changed or what is going on. Definitely not a place I will visit again. You cannot act like that, too much competition.

RK7a4uuvLLJWLw34pYEY2g.text: I used to go to weekly meetings at this Mimi's location and I loved it from the start. The food is ALWAYS great, I'm in love with the Buttermilk Spice muffin! They employees are always really nice and the food always turns out amazing!

klsVndbfJbNA_kPRxjtcMA.text: I know most people come for the pancakes but I come for the Hawaiian breakfast. I love Hawaiian food!

UHnwsM04z1pa7w_JjqI1kA.text: Excellent breakfast. Great pancakes, omeletes and potatoes. A must whenever we are in town. Expect a wait but well worth it.

wnOVUpwEZaqo0EUhB932mw.text: So disappointed for the second time.   I ordered and omelet.  Eggs were overcooked, the avocado was not ripe, hash brown were cold.  My husband had bacon pancakes which were greasy.  The bacon was as hard as a rock.  We will not be returning.  The 2 stars are for the coffee refills.

dREqt8yLZ1L_mxDlR_YE8A.text: Our go to breakfast place.  Great food, affordable prices.  It can get busy, but I've really never waited more than 15-20 min.  Highly recommended!

EufKlJYFqwwXWOgDzw5a4w.text: Things have gotten better, food is always good just always crowded. Which isn't a bad thing always gotta get that to go.

-oiYNWLLX3x98A_i6NLm-A.text: I have eaten here a total of 2 times (and almost a 3rd if I had of stayed today) each time I have came with friends or family the taste and quality of the food has been great. The proportion sizes were nice for the price asked and the restaurant has always smelled great from the good food.   The complaint I have is each time there has been long wait times you should practically eat before you come. They say right from the start 30 mins to 45 min wait (which is some how a secrete code for an hour plus). I heard great reviews so each time I waited but it always left me with a tinge of angst before eating there.   The last and final straw for me was today when I was told the 30 to 45 min story from the hostess who to me makes a poor hostess (absolute horrible attitude for paying customers willing to wait an hour) after I wait the entire 45 minutes (I was counting). I asked how much longer before I'm seated (party of 3). She said there are 2 people in front of me.   After 6 parties are seated before me including 3 different parties of 3 I go to ask what gives. She sharply replies your coming up, internally my wheels are moving and I'm resistant to let this go! I ask her to explain what makes the other parties of 3 any different? She replies out of frustration and ask do I want to put a high chair at a bar.   Even if that is the case it has been an hour, as my family was being seated we looked at each other and thought we can not spend our money here today or any other day for that matter. Considering we waited an hour to eat just to  leave is a good indication of our level of frustration. Perhaps the hostess should go apply at the post office or DMV where you are not required nor expected to have a bearing on good customer service.   Sunday is a very relaxing day that I enjoy and I can not spend it at a place that had bad service and good food or vice versa for that matter. I'll pay extra for both they fall short here in the service and wait times.  But I can not discredit the food (every time I have eaten here was delicious) as it is the only reason for the 2 stars.

P_zovl-pn1ms5b2GvPEMWw.text: Food was excellent, the service left a tiny bit to be desired but it was a Sunday. Recommend to anyone who enjoys a good filling breakfast.

mU1rid2hOqyX6_5eKgJaRg.text: I do not understand why this place has four locations and still allowed to be in business. It's only technicality but I would like to get what I ordered and paid for.  First time this place opened some of the food they served wasn't even seasoned or ready to be served. Please thaw your frozen food properly before putting them in customers takeout.   Second time only reason I had to order from here was so I don't have to drive 25 mins to get the stuff to make my own at home. Let me tell you something put the takeout items in a bag so your customer can take it not placing aplastic bag in front me to put the food in the bag after paying for it. You staff was watching put my food in my own bag and didn't do anything. This is so petty but so important.   Food is isn't amazing it is mediocre and overpriced food that I wouldn't eat unless I have no choice.    It gets worst every time

K7RDcBXfCB06qAgIYQ9M_w.text: The red velvet pancake is a MUST! I got this as a side order with the adobo fried rice. The adobo fried rice is also amazing. Definitely one of my favorite places to grab brunch I really hope the branch out here to Los Angeles. I would probably go out here way too much.

Bt_2rZKDFrktgUFseEIl9A.text: Love love love this place! The red velvet pancakes are the best and the avocado chicken burger is amazing also service is fantastic im hear once a week at least!

OosV7wfHgGGx9WLVpEOWgQ.text: The food was good; the service and policy leave a lot to be desired. Mind-numbingly stupid staff.  I asked for milk for our coffee and was charged $2.25 for it; that's definitely a first. I asked the cashier if the policy was to charge for milk for coffee. I was told no, the server must not have understood; she continued to charge me instead of correcting it or asking a manager for assistance.  We also asked if a short stack of pancakes could be made into silver dollar sized (kid sized) pancakes. Not for extra pancakes, syrup, etc. Sure, but it's $2 extra. For the exact same amount of batter on the same exact plate. WTF?  Check your bill carefully.

0wLag7qqmWW0m4nyWuIoVA.text: I come here a lot and this time I was a little bit upset at the kitchen more then waitstaff. The cashier and our server was super friendly and the cashier joked with us. But I ordered an extra side of crispy potatoes and the came out not only soggy but cold, like they were old potatoes. When i asked for them to be made crispier the next ones she brought out tasted like they just refried the other ones. This place used to be one of my favorites and now it's slowly becoming more mediocre.

mcsxIS3KnLah7ikCPdcnwQ.text: Love the Garlic rice it is delicious!!! Suggest the Cinnamon pancakes yummy!!   Breakfast with Granddaughter..came at 10 had a bit of a wait but once we sat down Gidget our server was top notch!   Lovely time at a very sweet restaurant!   I love being able to have rice with breakfast!   It's like having a bit of Hawaii in he morning!

NuBUyh9Z97kNuuNWeC9p1w.text: I have yet to have a bad experience here.  The food is consistently good and prepared and served to my liking.  Although I don't really venture to the whole menu my breakfast is always delicious and served with a smile.  One meal here always gets me full and that means I go home and rub my belly.  That's a good thing.

RrxCdzT07ehxkuSwLEFq9w.text: Babystacks is an awesome breakfast/brunch option if you're on the NW side of town.  They have a huge variety of pancake choices.  Many of them super unique and all of them delicious.  I've had the carrot cake (tastes like carrot cake), banana cream (definitely my favorite!), orange creamsicle (super orangey tasting), and the cookies and cream (tastes like it sounds!).    I appreciate that they have Hawaiian/Filipino breakfast choices too.  Not every place has spam or my fav, the adobo fried rice.  The adobo fried rice, which is basically an omelet, is reallllly good here - super packed with lots of meat and its even better when you upgrade to the garlic fried rice.    My only qualm about this place is that service is not exactly top notch.  Servers are friendly enough, but not very attentive.  We've gone where service was soooooo sloooooow and we've gone when service was a normal speed.  Both times the place wasn't terribly crowded.  That part can be pretty hit or miss I guess.    Either way, the food is great so give it a try and judge for yourself!

BK5kn0LlIf1bWf2DxergYg.text: I'm still trying to figure out the hype. This was our second time going and my second time being less than satisfied.   Their unique-ness comes from their huge variety of pancakes (everything from savory, like bacon pancakes to sweet, like Nutella pancakes, bananas foster, etc).   The good: The honey French toast was amazing! Homemade whipped cream, huge slices. Delicious. My husband really liked the bananas foster pancakes, the skillet meal, and the huevos rancheros (ordered over the two trips). The sausage patties & links were both good, though I'd only order the patties again.   The okay: The Nutella crepes I ordered were fine, but I didn't think anything special.   The disappointing: Besides being pretty pricey for such a small, home style establishment (the menu is almost a la carte style), the service was definitely lacking. If I'm going to pay $25+ for a breakfast meal for two people, I expect either a lot of food (enough to be VERY filling or leftovers) OR great customer service OR even absolutely fantastic food. This place had none of the above. The entire time we ate, the previous tables' tip was at the table. We reminded the server SEVERAL times to tell the other server. It was STILL there when we left. Unprofessional. The bacon pancakes were disappointing. They boast pancakes filled with bacon. More like, a few bacon crumbs on top and maybe one or two "inside" the pancake (laying in the middle of two).   I don't think we'll be back anytime soon.

0rwrQUH48MQJiKmcq2JAIQ.text: I love babystacks but today was horrible !!! Today i ordered a BYO skillet with bananas pancakes like always and first i get my skillet with unseasoned potatoes, they take back the skillet and bring out my banana pancakes. After my first bite out of the pancakes i taste batter and look down and see that my pancake in uncooked. The waiter took the pancakes and came back with my skillet and once i started to enjoy my food they bought out me a fresh order of pancakes to only cut in them and have the same thing happen again the pancakes were uncooked. I couldnt even eat my skillet because my whole stomach was turned after being served my favorite thing about babystacks eating pancakes and what they r well known for.

Fje70eD0LiVXG8g0kdNslQ.text: We have been to one of the Babystacks on Buffalo before and loved it. We plan on going back to that one should we go to Babystacks again.  My boyfriend, son, and I came in for a late breakfast on Thursday. There were people there, but plenty of open tables. Once seated, we ordered drinks from the server while we looked over the menu. She asked if we were ready to order, but I wasn't and asked for another minute. She left and we did not see her again for at least 10 minutes. Fair enough though, I did ask for more time and that's what we got.  We placed our order ; I got the Mexican skillet with bananas foster pancakes, my son ordered bacon and eggs with Rocky Road pancakes, the bf ordered a veggie omelette and strawberry pancakes. After another kinda long wait, out came my pancakes, my bf's pancakes and my son's bacon and eggs. Then another wait. It wasn't too bad for me. I ate half my pancakes before the rest of my food came to the table, but my boyfriend likes to eat his pancakes for "dessert". That's just the way the man eats. So my skillet finally comes, my son's pancakes come. The server says to my bf, "your omelette will be out in a minute". Fine. Well, she didn't come back with his food until my son and I were about done eating. She just sets it down with a, "Sorry". So he scarfed it down since he was starving and then ate his cold pancakes while we waited for him.  My bf and I have both been servers before so we're pretty understanding of kitchen mishaps and we tend to tip generously, but the way she handled this was all wrong. She could have offered some form of explanation so he would know he should eat his pancakes instead of saying it will be out in a minute. She also should have offered a discount or something for the inconvenience of not bringing his food until we were done. So the 2 stars are strictly for the food which was very good. Service needs some work.

C6FvTgIgJFTQBaqQ_qIT2g.text: Amazing! I don't know if words can do this place justice! You must go and try it. Great food, great service,great prices, and great atmosphere. The staff are so friendly and fast, we walked in and were seated immediately but wouldn't mind waiting if it were a busy day. Our waitress came right over got our drinks within seconds and once we ordered our food we waited under five minutes for our food and it was delicious.
